loans.name: Charlotte

texts.en:
Charlotte has always had the enthusiasm for farming. She has cultivated their rice land in Mahayag and has yielded good earnings doing this type of work. 

Recently, she applied for a loan to pay for the threshing, drying, storage and processing of her harvest. She wants to ensure that she will have ample time and resources for this cropping season. Charlotte knows that she has to get things right and make way for the next cropping. 

In the future, Charlotte hopes to buy a hauling truck for the easy transport of produce.

loans.use: to pay for the threshing, drying, storage and processing of her harvest

loans.name: Lam

texts.en:
Lam, 45, lives in a rural area of the Chi Kreng district of Siem Reap province, and she is married with five children. The family’s main sources of income are from rice farming, selling Khmer noodle soup, and selling fish paste in her village. She also raises cows for supporting her farming business. She has been in these businesses for more than 10 years; the current business earns her about 30,000 KHR per day.

Lam has been with VisionFund for one loan cycle and completely paid back the loan, which has helped her relieve her family burden and improve her livelihood. Now she is asking for a loan to buy more fish paste for resale. With this loan, she hopes to make more income so as to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy more fish paste for resale

location.town: Siem Reap province, Chi Kreng district

loans.name: Mahfuza

texts.en:
Mahfuza is an honest, capable, hardworking and generous woman. It is her first try to ask for a loan from Kiva lenders.

She does an agriculture business. It is her individual business and additional income for living. She is a teacher in a secondary school. She teaches pupils and helps her community to make better the standard of getting a secondary education. She is a very kind person and hopes all her community children will be educated.

Her husband is an emigrant in Russia. He earns less than before because of the crisis. That is why their only income is being spent for their everyday expenditures.

Year by year, they have had bad conditions for living, and their house needs to be renovated. Mahfuza wants to renovate her house and buy construction materials.

She hopes that Kiva lenders will support her financially.

loans.use: to buy construction supplies to renovate her house.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane has signed up for her membership with PMPC and availed herself of the needed capital to start up a sari-sari (small grocery) store business. She is thankful for the capital it extends to a small-time borrower like her. 

Mary Jane has been able to turn the tide in her favor and has made good sales these days. She wants to take advantage of the good fortune. Recently, she availed herself of a loan to restock her store with basic commodities and other consumable items. In the future, she hopes to mount a decent home for the family.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities and other consumable items

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides for farming.

loans.name: Efrain

texts.es:
Efrain tiene 28 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, vive con su esposa y su menor hijo en el distrito de San Felipe que se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Jaén, región Cajamarca, en la sierra norte de Perú. La población se dedica a la agricultura siendo el cultivo de lima el de mayor producción, así como al comercio.

El se dedica al comercio de limas, cuenta con más de 05 años de experiencia en el rubro y con clientes fijos quienes dan buenas referencias personales y laborales de el. El préstamo será utilizado para la compra de una mayor cantidad de limas para incrementar el stock de su negocio, con esto Efrain espera generar mayores ingresos que le ayuden a mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Efrain is 28 years old and has a common-law wife. He lives with his wife and their young son in the district of San Felipe, which is located in the province of Jaén in the Cajamarca region in the northern mountains of Perú. The people here make a living growing limes as well as working in commerce.

Efrain makes a living buying and selling limes. He has more than 5 years experience in this field, and has steady clients that recommend him both personally and professionally. The loan will be used to buy more limes to in order to increase the inventory of his business. With this, Efrain hopes to earn more income that will help to improve the quality of life for him and his family.

loans.use: to buy more limes in order to increase the inventory of his business.

loans.name: Leonardo

texts.en: Leonardo lives at Iguig with his family. He manages a farming business for income. He wanted to increase his crop production, but had insufficient funds; that is why he is now asking for a loan of 10,000 PHP to invest in the rice field. He will buy pesticides, insecticides and fertilizers. This will help crops grow fruitfully and gain good harvest. He will pay back his loan in full.

loans.use: to buy pesticides, insecticides and fertilizers

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
As a result of unemployment and land fragmentation, almost three quarters of Kenya’s young people struggle to make their way in the world. But for Julius, 37, who is based in the Siongiroi area of Kenya and is a father of a lovely family, he has been practicing mixed farming for the past 8 years. He has managed to earn a decent income. His primary source of income has been milk, eggs, crops and some personal business that he engages in to make ends meet. He passionately loves dairy farming, and when asked what is most enjoyable about his business, he stated “feeding my cows.” 

Julius sells milk to his neighbors and to the local market, but the demand has been overwhelming, and he cannot meet the demand. For this reason, he is seeking a loan to buy an extra dairy cow, which will assist in increasing milk productivity. The dairy cow that he plans to buy is not just an ordinary cow, but it’s a quality breed of dairy cow that will be producing between 10-20 liters of milk a day. This will immediately translate to more profit and increased income levels. Profits from selling milk will be used to repay the loan in full, and the extra income will be used to increase his business enterprise. 

Julius is very visionary, and he intends that in the near future, he will start adding value to his milk business through packaging the milk before selling and selling dairy products such as yoghurt. An improved income level will assure his family of a secure future. By joining Juhudi Kilimo, which assists smallholder farmers, he will also benefit from free extension services and links to markets.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Zaven

texts.en:
Zaven is constructor. He provides construction work to local people living in Artashat town. Zaven is mainly specialized in stone bricklaying work. He lives with his only son who is 19 years old. Being the only breadwinner for the household, Zaven is working day and night to make ends meet. All his earnings go to covering daily needs, and there is little money left for investing in his work. That's the reason Zaven has applied for this loan. He plans to purchase a stone cutting machine, which will greatly help him with his construction work and will make his work efficient. 

Zaven's loan has been approved within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. This program provides business start-up loans to informal businesses that do not qualify through normal channels.

loans.use: to pay for a stone cutting machine

loans.name: Amelita

texts.en:
Amelita is 50 years old, married with three children.

Amelita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, shampoo, bread, soft drinks, spices, etc. Amelita has borrowed and paid 8 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 6 years and also earns an income from farming rice.

Amelita aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, shampoo, bread, soft drinks, spices, etc

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay fees and buy more new books for school at a high level

loans.name: G.s El Agricultor Del Merendon Group

texts.es: Misael, tiene 33 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su pareja con quien tiene 2 hijos, y reside en una zona que pertenece a San Pedro Sula, Cortes. Desde muy joven se ha dedicado a la agricultura, tiene un terreno donde cultiva hortalizas como zanahorias, rábanos, remolacha, frijoles  y maíz, además cultiva café. Esta producción la vende en el mercado local de la zona. Misael solicita un préstamo por 10,000 Lempiras en forma grupal para comprar abonos y fertilizantes, limpieza, para el cultivo de café. Su objetivo es darle asistencia al cultivo de café para su buen crecimiento y obtener buenas cosechas futuras. Tiene como meta a futuro comprar un vehículo de trabajo y comprar ganado. el grupo se llama El Agricultor del Merendón, esta integrado por 5 personas que se dedican a la agricultura y viven en la misma zona. El préstamo grupal es por 60,000 lempiras para comprar abonos, limpieza y fertilizar sus cultivos. En la foto se identifican de izquierda a derecha. Misael de camisa cuadriculada, Reginaldo camisa celeste, Marco camiseta rallada, José camisa verde olivo y Tomas camisa manga larga morada.
texts.en:
Misael is 33 years old. He lives in a common-law marriage and has two children. They live in San Pedro Sula, Cortés. He has been working in agriculture since he was very young. He owns a plot of land where he grows vegetables such as carrots, radish, beet, beans, and corn. He also grows coffee. Misael sells his produce at the local marketplace.

Misael is requesting a group loan of 10,000 Lempiras [HNL] to buy fertilizers and clean his coffee plantations. His goal is to do maintenance work on his coffee plantation in order have a better harvest in the future. His long-term goal is to buy a tractor and cattle.

The name of this group is El Agricultor del Merendón [The Farmer from El Merendón] and is comprised of five members who work in agriculture and live close to each other. The group is requesting a loan of 60,000 Lempiras [HNL] to buy fertilizers and to clean and fertilize their plantations. From left to right, the members are Misael (checkered shirt), Reginaldo (blue shirt), Marco (striped shirt), José (green shirt), and Tomás (purple shirt).

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pay for the labor needed to clean his coffee plantations.

loans.name: Nhi

texts.en:
Nhi is 62 years old and married with a single child. The family lives in the Prey Chhor district of Kampong Cham province and supports their living by farming rice. They have been doing this business for more than 40 years. 

Nhi wants to expand her farmland, yet she is short of capital; therefore, she decided to request funds from VisionFund to fulfill her dream. She hopes the loan will enable her to increase the crop productivity, and hence, generate more income for her.

loans.use: to buy one more plot of farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Sothea

texts.en:
Sothea is a 35-year-old married factory worker with two children who attend school. She lives Kampong Chhnang province in Cambodia. Her husband is a house builder. She has been working as a factory worker since 2008. Together, they can earn around $16 per day.

Now Sothea would like to request a loan to buy a motorcycle to commute to work. This loan can help her and her family increase their family’s income.

In the future, she wants to extend into animal raising and support her children to go to university for a degree.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle to commute to work.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es:
La socia Lucia pertenece al banco comunal Santa Rosita de Lima.
La socia se dedica al negocio de venta de productos de dormitorios como sábanas, fundas de almohadas, edredones, colchas entre otros, la socia Lucia agradece el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas, la socia vende su mercadería a sus clientes que le solicitan como amistades familiares, entre otros, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de edredones entre otros.
texts.en: Lucia belongs to the "Santa Rosita de Lima" communal bank. She works selling products for the bedroom like sheets, pillow cases, quilts and blankets amongst others. Lucia is grateful for the loan and promises to comply with the established payments. She sells her merchandise to her clients such as friends and family amongst others, this being the way that she gets her family ahead. She is requesting a loan to buy quilts amongst others.

loans.use: to buy quilts amongst others.

loans.name: Jose Leopoldo

texts.es: José es un hombre de 26 años de edad que pone todo su esfuerzo por sacar adelante a su familia demostrando ser un hombre muy responsable y trabajador, por lo que desde hace 3 años se dedica a la crianza y venta de pollos. Él habita en vivienda propia al lado de su esposa y su pequeño hijo. José desea invertir en su negocio y de esta forma obtener mejores ingresos económicos que le permitan obtener mayores ingresos para brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia, para ello solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: pollos, concentrado y vitaminas.
texts.en:
José is a 26-year-old man who works as hard as he can to get ahead with his family. He has proved that he is a very responsible and persistent worker, and has raised and sold chickens for three years. He owns a house where he lives with his wife and their young son.

José wants to invest in his business and make more profits, in order to improve his family’s living conditions. This is why he is requesting a loan at FUSAI to buy chickens, feed and vitamins.

loans.use: to buy chickens, feed and vitamins.

loans.name: Cherlyn

texts.en:
Cherlyn makes a living through her retailing business. She runs a small merchandise store in Mahayag and earns a promising income to support her family, in addition to her husband.

Cherlyn has signed up for her membership with PMPC to gain access to capitalization. She wants to increase her inventory. Now, she availed herself of a loan to buy merchandise for her store.

Cherlyn hopes to sustain her business and dreams to provide all her children a good education.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.en:
Carmen works hard to support her family. She is married and has a business of raising pigs in the Philippines.

Carmen requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Carmen has been in this business for two years now, and also earns additional income from farming rice.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Felicidad

texts.en:
Felicidad is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Felicidad is 39 years old, and both of her children are presently in school.

Felicidad has a fishing business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 30,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase fish net and bamboo and pay for maintenance for her business.

Felicidad has been in this business for fifteen years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase fish net and bamboo, and pay for maintenance for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies and pay the rent for 14,000 square meters of land where he will plant.

loans.name: Angel Vinicio

texts.es: Vinicio es un joven de 22 años de edad, vive con su madre que es una señora de bajos recursos y no pudo darle los estudios a su hijo Vinicio, este joven trabajador se dedica a la crianza de animales menores y también es obrero en una fábrica de lácteos, Vinicio necesita el dinero del crédito para invertirlo en la compra de chanchos   que los tiene en un lotecito, la aspiración de este joven es de comprar mas chanchos y seguir trabajando para formarse un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
Vinicio is a young man. He is 22 years old and lives with his mother, who could not afford paying for his studies. Vinicio raises small farm animals and works as a machine operator for a dairy company.

Vinicio needs a loan to buy pigs and raise them in a plot of land he has. His goal is to buy more pigs and continue working for a better future.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Rem

texts.en:
A 31-year-old mother of four children, Rem is married and lives in Kampong Cham province. The family relies solely on income generated from cassava planting and selling.

After successfully repaying her previous loans, Rem has applied for a third loan from VisionFund to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her cassava plantation. She also will reserve some amount of money for labor fees for plowing.

She hopes to make more money from the business this year so that she can expand her farmland.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides and to pay for labor fees for plowing.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more products like mobile phones and repair parts for his store.

loans.name: Haytham

texts.en:
Haytham is a 23-year-old single young man from Khan Younis city. Four years ago, Haytham opened a carpentry workshop where he makes home furniture. He sells his products to the local stores. Haytham loves his job, and now he has very good experience.

Haytham took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy raw wood bars for his carpentry workshop. This will increase his productivity and also his income.

Haytham appears in the photo in his carpentry workshop.

loans.use: to buy raw wood bars for his carpentry workshop.

loans.name: Panha

texts.en:
Panha is a 23-year-old single salesperson in a city, who comes from Tbong Khmum province in Cambodia. Panha has been working a salesperson since 2014, earning around $7 a day. Due to the fact that he is lacking finances to pay his first-year university fees, he would like to request a loan to pay his tuition fees. With this loan, he will be able continue his Bachelor's degree. 

In the future, Panha is going to find a proper job in the information technology field, and he wants to run his own business in the city.

loans.use: to pay his tuition fees

loans.name: G.s. Las Mariposas Group

texts.es:
EL G.S. LAS MARIPOSAS, Está conformado por tres integrantes madres solteras con seis hijos menores bajo su responsabilidad entre la edades de 4,5,7,9,15. Todos estudian en primaria y secundaria respectivamente. Son originarias de  Jinotepe  y tiene diferentes actividades económicas, como pulpería, venta de refrescos naturales, venta de hot dog.  Todas tienen el negocio ubicado en su casa de habitación. Son mujeres muy trabajadoras, responsables, con ganas de superación personal.  Lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos no pudieron estudiar y se vieron obligadas a trabajar desde temprana edad,. En la actualidad luchan para sacar a sus hijos adelante.
Gracias a sus ganas de salir adelante la coordinadora es  Arlen y  tiene por actividad económica  una pulpería es una pequeña tienda que vende productos comestibles como: arroz, frijoles, azúcar, leche, pan, huevos, tortillas, tiste, frutas, queso, mantequilla, fósforos. La rutina  de trabajo de Arlen es de una doce horas diarias ofreciendo sus productos. El objetivo es surtir su pulpería para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. El g.s. las mariposas agradecen la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan a persona de escasos y recursos y países. Pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
The "LAS MARIPOSAS" communal bank is made up of 3 single mothers with 6 children under their care between the ages of 4 and 15. All of them study in Primary and secondary schools. They are natives of Jinotepe and have different businesses such as a store, selling natural juices and selling hot-dogs. They all have their businesses in their homes. They are very hard-working, responsible with the desire to excel personally. Unfortunately due to the lack of economic resources they could not study and were obliged to work from a young age. Today they fight to get their children ahead.

Thanks to her desire to get ahead Arien is the coordinator. She has a pulperia which is a small store that sells food products like rice, beans, sugar, milk, bread, eggs, tortillas tiste (a corn and cocoa drink mix), fruit, cheese, margarine and matches. Arien works a 12 hour work day offering her products. Her goal is to stock her store so that in the not too distant future she can obtain higher income.

The."LAS MARIPOSAS" communal bank is grateful to the Kiva lenders for the support they give to people of low resources and poor countries like Nicaragua to have a dignified form of work.

loans.use: to invest in her store buying products like rice, beans, sugar, milk, bread, eggs. tortillas, tiste (a hot drinl mix made from corn and cocoa)fruits, cheese, margarine and matches.

loans.name: Rosa Amalia

texts.es: Rosa de 48 años de edad es una mujer trabajadora que habita en vivienda propia junto a su compañero de vida y sus 2 hijos de 15 y 13 años de edad, a los que con mucho esfuerzo apoya para que estudien. Ella se dedica a la venta de verduras en el mercado central, además vende leche de vaca para obtener mejores ingresos y de esta manera mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia. La vivienda de la casa de Rosa es mixta ya que las paredes de su vivienda están hechas de cemento y ladrillo en la parte de abajo pero arriba solo cuenta con varas de bambú como se observa en la fotografía, lo que le preocupa ya que no brinda una mayor seguridad, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena, grava, ladrillo y hierro para terminar de construir las paredes de su vivienda y de esta manera brindar una mejor calidad de vida a su familia dándoles mayor seguridad.
texts.en:
Rosa is a 48-year-old hardworking woman who lives in her own home along with her life partner and 2 children, ages 15 and 13. With great effort, she supports her children so that they study. She makes a living selling vegetables in the central market. In addition, she sells milk to earn more income and improve the quality of life for her family. 

Rosa's house is made of a combination of things, since the walls are made of cement and bricks in the lower section, but above are only bamboo poles, as is shown in the photo. This worries her since it doesn't offer much security. For this reason, she is requesting a loan from FUSAI to purchase cement, sand, gravel, bricks, and iron in order to finish building the walls of her home. By doing this, she will give her family a higher quality of life and better security.

loans.use: to buy cement sand, gravel, bricks, and iron to finish building the walls of her home.

loans.name: Ronald

texts.en:
Ronald is a farmer. He is 49 years old, married, and has four children. One is still studying, while the others already got married.

He plants and harvests rice to sell for income. He wanted to gain additional profits, but he had insufficient funds to sustain his crops. Ronald wanted to ask for additional capital for his ricefield, so he is now asking for additional capital of PHP 10,000 to buy fertilizers and pesticides to use in farming.

In the future, he hopes to keep gaining profits to reinvest in the business and someday achieve economic stability.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides to use in farming.

loans.name: Magali Esther

texts.es:
Magali tiene 44 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, tiene 2 hijas, vive con su familia en Nueva Arica, una zona rural que se encuentra ubicada en el distrito de Cayaltí, provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú. Los pobladores de este distrito se dedican a la agricultura y comercio principalmente.

Ella se dedica a la venta de cerveza, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su mismo domicilio, cuenta con más de 4 años de experiencia en el negocio y con buenas referencias por parte de sus clientes y vecinos. El préstamo lo utilizará para la compra de una mayor cantidad de cerveza para incrementar su negocio, con esto Magali espera incrementar su nivel de ingresos lo que le permitirá mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Magali is 44 years old, and she has a common-law husband and 2 daughters. She lives with her family in the Nueva Arica, a rural area located in the district of Cayaltí, in the Chiclayo province of the Lambayeque region on the northern coast of Perú. The people of this district primarily make a living in the areas of agriculture and commerce.

Magali makes a living selling beer. She runs the business out of her own home. She has more than 4 years experience in this work, and has good recommendations from her customers and neighbors. The loan will be used to purchase a large quantity of beer to grow her business. With this, Magali hopes to earn more income which will enable her to improve the quality of life for her and her family.

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of beer to grow her business.

loans.name: Ma. Rosalina

texts.en:
Ma. Rosalina is heading into the next cropping season. She wants to prepare well, especially the much-needed land and seedbed preparations.

She wants to have enough supply of rice fertilizer and herbicides, and pay for a knapsack sprayer. For these, she applied for a loan from the Cooperative.

Ma. Rosalina hopes to save enough for future emergencies and any business opportunities to benefit her family.

loans.use: to buy rice fertilizer and herbicides, and pay for a knapsack sprayer.

loans.name: Joceta

texts.en:
Joceta is 48 years old, married with one child.

Joceta works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, shampoo, spices, soft drinks, coffee, milk, etc. 

Joceta has borrowed and repaid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for seven years and also earns an income from selling ready-to-wear.

Joceta aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, shampoo, spices, soft drinks, coffee, milk, etc.

loans.name: Changret's Group

texts.en:
Changret is 32 years old and married with three daughters. To support the family, she and her husband have been growing cassava for more than ten years. This is Changret's second loan with VisionFund. The income generated from the first loan enabled her to get more household appliances. 

Leading the four-member group, Changret will spend her loan portion on labor fees such as land plowing fees. She hopes this loan allows her to generate more income so that she can save up for the children's school fees.

loans.use: To pay labor fees

loans.name: Willy

texts.en:
Willy is a farmer from Kapsumai village, in the Kapsowar area of Kenya. Willy is able to provide for his family by engaging in mixed farming. He owns a half-acre piece of land where he keeps dairy animals and grows maize, among other crops. He is also involved in other personal businesses that earn him extra shillings.

For the last five years that he has been in business, dairy farming has become deeply ingrained into his system. Willy is constantly looking for ways to grow a business he is so passionate about. Willy is seeking a loan to purchase a dairy cow. He already has a name in mind that he is going to name the cow.

Willy is going to make use of the additional money from the new acquisition to repay the loan and to improve his living condition.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Lorina

texts.en:
Lorina works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

Lorina requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional fish net and to pay for maintenance for her boat.

Lorina has been in this business for thirty years now, and also earns additional income from a general store.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional fish net and pay for maintenance for her boat.

loans.name: Norma Ligia

texts.es:
A pesar de tener 51 años, doña Norma es una mujer fuerte, trabajadora, emprendedora y alegre. Se despierta todos los días desde las primeras horas del amanecer, para tener a tiempo su venta de tortillas, pues ella sabe que al ofrecer los mejores y más frescos productos, atraerá y enamorará  a sus clientes.  
Por ello, solicita un financiamiento para invertir en su venta, con la compra de maíz, carbón, y queso, que también ofrece para acompañar las tortillas. Ella espera poder ayudarse con más créditos, para seguir aumentando sus ventas y tener mayor estabilidad en su hogar, pues actualmente ayuda a su hija menor, con los gastos de sus estudios.
texts.en:
Although she is 51 years old, Norma is a strong, hard-working, enterprising, and happy woman. She gets up at the crack of dawn every day so she can have her tortillas ready to sell. She knows that by offering the best and freshest products, she will attract customers and make them fall in love with her.

This is why she is asking for a loan to invest in her business by buying corn, cheese, and coal. The cheese is an accompaniment to the tortillas. She hopes to be able to help herself with more loans to continue increasing her sales and having more stability in her home. She is currently helping her younger daughter with her educational expenses.

loans.use: to buy corn, cheese, and coal.

loans.name: Sota

texts.en: Sota is a 36-year-old married servant with two children who attend school. She lives in Kampong Chhnang province in Cambodia. Her husband is a motor taxi driver and construction worker. She has been working as a servant since 2012. Together, they can earn around $7 per day. Now Sota would like to request a loan to buy a motorcycle to drive motor taxi and to commute to work. This loan can help her and her family increase their family's income. In the future, she wants to grow her family income and to build a latrine to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle to drive motor taxi

loans.name: Timoteo

texts.en:
Timoteo raises and sells hogs to earn a living. He is a resident of the town of Talibon, Bohol. He is a 44-year-old married man with six children. His oldest child is 24, and the youngest is 2. It has been more than ten years now that he has been engaged in a hog raising business.

He is asking for a loan to buy pigs. These will improve his hog raising business, and enable him to raise and sell more pigs in the coming few months. He could handle his finances and pay his obligations. He would be able to continue to send his children to school and provide better living conditions.

Timoteo dreams to expand his business to become successful.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en: Vilma is 61 years old and lives in Tabo-o, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married with 5 children who are now adults. Vilma has been engaged in the hog-raising business for almost 10 years already. She earns approximately 5,000 PHP each month doing this work. She has requested a loan to purchase 3 piglets and sacks of feed for her business. Vilma has been a member of PMPC for 8 years. In the future, She hopes to expand her hog-raising business.

loans.use: to purchase 3 piglets and  sacks of feed

loans.name: Mildred

texts.en:
Mildred is 35 years old and single, and she lives with her parents in Migcanaway, Tangub. For a living, Mildred has started a sari-sari (small grocery) store and was able to expand it through her characteristic effort and salesmanship. Mildred wants to improve her business, so she decided to join Paglaum MPC to gain insurance and credit. Aside from financial assistance, she was able to generate savings and enjoys the benefit given by the co-op.

She became a member in May of 2013 and has taken out two loans. Now she is applying for a loan of 15,000 PHP to buy additional stock for her sari-sari store, particularly basic commodities. In the future, she wants to own a mini-mart some day and will be fully satisfied if she can renovate and expand their house.

loans.use: to buy additional stock for her sari-sari store, particularly basic commodities.

loans.name: Kem's Group

texts.en:
A resident from Dambae district's Kampong Cham province, Kem is 43 years old and married with four children. Growing cassava is the family's main source of income. Having insufficient capital to expand the business, Kem is leading a loan group which is comprised of two members to apply for a loan from VisionFund. 

Kem will use her loan portion to get another plot of farmland and also to buy fertilizer. She hopes to generate more income this year so that she can renovate her wooden house.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and another plot of farmland

loans.name: Sreypich's Group

texts.en: Living in a rural area of Dambae district's Kampong Cham province, Sreypich and her husband have been growing cassava to support the family for more than ten years. Moreover, during their spare time they also labor for others for a fee This is Sreypich's third loan with VisionFund. The income generated from the previous loan was just enough to support their daily food. This time Sreypich applied for a new loan to buy more cassava seeds and to pay plowing fees. She hopes that this third loan will enable her to generate more income and hence expand her business.

loans.use: to buy cassava seeds and pay plowing fees

loans.name: Manuel Francisco

texts.es:
Así es Manuel, un hombre fresco, sonriente, eufórico, trabajador, emprendedor, vive y goza sus momentos, en su negocio la alegría es primordial, trabajar al sonido de una buena música que alegra su alma y sus días.

Manuel trabaja en una ebanistería el repara y fabrica muebles, sillas, metas, closet entre otros productos.

Su negocio inicio en el año 1985 y sigue en pie con la misma energía que lo inicio, gracias a su forma de vida ha podido sacar adelante a su familia constituida por su pareja y tres hijos.

Su sueño es crecer, empelar gente, construir su vivienda, ser mejor persona y ser felices.

Solicita un préstamo para la compra de madera en cantidades, comprar de materiales para la fabricación de muebles, forros, pintura, y herramienta.
texts.en:
Manuel is a refreshing man, smiling, elated, hard-working, enterprising, lively and enjoying the moment. In his business happiness reigns. He works to the sound of good music that fills his days and his heart.

Manuel works in a carpentry shop repairing and making furniture, chairs and closets amongst others products. He started his business in 1985 and continues with the same energy with which he began. Thanks to this way of living he has managed to raise his family consisting of 3 children and his partner.

His dream is to grow, employ people, build a house be a better person and be happy. He is requesting a loan to buy wood and supplies like spray paint, upholstery and tools to buy materials and supplies to make furniture, upholstery, paint and tools.

loans.use: to buy wood and supplies like spray paint, upholstery and tools.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to collect used stuff made of metal to reproduce and resell it.

loans.name: Kalistrati

texts.en:
Kalistrati is a 41-year-old married man, from the village of Kokhnari. He has a wife, a pensioner father and a little son and daughter. Sadly, for lack of economic resources and because he had to start working at a very young age, Kalistrati was unable to study for a professional career.  He works hard on family-owned agricultural land, growing nuts and also breeds cattle and milk-cows, producing cheese. He always has high quality produce, which is sold to local retailers.

However, the family belongs to the subsistence poor category, as they have no source of significant income and live in poverty.  According to the above-mentioned situation, Kalistrati lacks the access to capital markets and financial institutions to obtain credit for starting a business, as they require stable income and business experience.  The Start Up program created by Kiva and Credo enabled him to get a loan of 400 GEL and purchase special tools. He will start digging and work on private orders. Kalistrati will get the chance to make another source of income that will cover family's increased needs. He awaits your support and kindness.

loans.use: To purchase special tools and start digging

loans.name: Kisukulu Group

texts.en:
Safia, who is in her early 50s, is married with four children who are still in school.  She has been running a retail business for eight years now. She works from 6.30 am to 10 pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be Safia's fifth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to keep increasing the shop inventory and started a chicken business and has paid back all her loans successfully.  She used the profit to pay school fees and cover household expenses.  She will use this loan to  buy rice, beans, salt, cooking oil, sugar, flour, sweets and biscuits to resell in her retail shop.  She dreams of owning a wholesale shop.

Safia will share this loan with her loan group "Kisukulu" which has three members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, salt, cooking oil, sugar, flour, sweets and biscuits to resell in her retail shop.

loans.name: Touch's Group

texts.en:
Residing in a rural area in Kampong Cham province, Touch and her husband support the family by growing cassava which is a common business in the area. Touch is 40 years old and has six children. The income generated is just enough to cover the family's daily food.

 As she does not own any farmland, Touch needs to rent farmland to grow cassava every year. This is Touch's third loan with VisionFund. She needs the money to pay for the land rental fee as well as the plowing fee. She hopes this loan will enable her to generate good income so that she can get her own farmland.

loans.use: To spend on plowing fees and farmland rental fees

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase poultry

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.en:
Ofelia is married and comes from Molave, Zamboanga del Sur. For the past thirty years, Ofelia and her husband have been farmers. She earns a good income from each crop, focusing on her rice farm. 

Ofelia became an active member of PMPC in 2009. She is now requesting a 14,900 PHP loan to purchase fertilizer to have a higher crop yield on her rice farm. In the future, she hopes to expand and improve her business to improve the general living conditions for her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer so as to have a higher crop yield on her rice farm

loans.name: Assucena

texts.pt:
A senhora   Assucena  de 33 anos de idade é professora, mãe solteira de  3 filhos dos quais 2 a estudar e 1 ainda menor sustenta sua mãe  que vive com ela na casa da mãe .
Diz que com o valor do empréstimo irá comprar cimento, areia, chapas de zinco, janelas, portas para dar continuidade a sua obra.
Seus sonhos e esperanças para o futuro são terminar sua obra, ter  uma mini mercearia, ter aviários na sua casa onde poderá criar para reforçar a renda familiar.
Diz que tem como desafios insuficiência de  fundos  e para ultrapassar esta situação faz depósitos numa conta bancaria como forma de poupar e que irá solicitar mais créditos para concretizar o seu plano.
texts.en: Assucena, age 33, is a professor and single mother of three children, of whom two are in school and the other is not yet school-aged. She also provides for her mother, who lives with her in her mother's house.  She says that with this loan, she will buy cement, gravel, sheet metal, windows, and doors to continue with her construction project. Her hopes and dreams for the future are to finish this work, establish a mini-market, and to have chicken coops at her house where she can raise poultry as a supplement to her household income. Her main challenge is a lack of funds; to overcome this she maintains a savings account and plans to take out future loans in order to realize her plans.

loans.use: to buy cement, gravel, sheet metal, windows, and doors.

loans.name: Loyola Group

texts.en:
Yona, who in his mid 30s, is single with no children.  He has been running a retail business for eight years.  He woks from 08 am to 10 pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Yona's seventh loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  He used the previous loans to keep increasing the shop stock and has paid back all his loans successfully.  He used the profit to take care of himself and covered household expenses.  He will use this loan to buy rice, sugar, salt, tea leaves, beans, flour, cooking oil, sweets, etc.    He dreams of having a big business and having a good life.

Yona will share this loan with his loan group "Loyola" which consists of three members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, salt, tea leaves, beans, flour, cooking oil, sweets, etc

loans.name: Anelyn

texts.en:
Anelyn is married and has been a wholesaler of bananas in Tangub for almost ten years. From this long experience of selling, she already has a lot of knowledge about dealing in this kind of business. Even though there are many competitors in the area, Anelyn still gets more customers than the rest, due to her good salesmanship and characteristic effort. She has been successful over the years and manages to save more money for her family. 

Now, Anelyn is planning to make and sell banana snacks in order for her to gain more profit. To fund this project, she needs additional capital to purchase 200 kilos of bananas for wholesaling and to make banana snacks to sell, so she has requested a loan from Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC).

loans.use: to purchase 200 kilos of bananas for wholesaling and to make banana snacks to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase a new refrigerator for her house

loans.name: Rosie

texts.en:
Rosie is 29 years old and married with three children. She lives in the Philippines. Rosie is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Rosie has been in this business for five years and also earns additional income from her general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita, 56, is married with four adult children. Her major source of income is buying and selling grocery items. She has been in this business for 11 years already. The business helped her meet her family's financial needs, especially the education of her children, until they graduated and got jobs. She is still continuing the business because it provides good income due to her loyal customers. Someday, she will have a legacy to leave to her children. 

Teresita's plan is to maintain her inventory so that her customers will be served well. She is still planning for business expansion for the good of her children and even her grandchildren. She already accessed loans previously to purchase additional stock and now she is re-applying for a loan for her store.

loans.use: To purchase additional grocery items for her grocery store.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is 45 years old and lives in San Vicente, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is widowed with four children, now adults. 

Rosemarie earns a living from the sales of her sari-sari store business. She’s been engaged in this business for three years already. Rosemarie earns approximately PHP 5,000 each month doing this type of business activity; said amount is very helpful to meet her needs. She has requested a loan to be used in purchasing additional stocks of assorted groceries and other consumable products for retail. 

Rosemarie has been a member of PMPC for almost one year. In the future, Rosemarie hopes to expand her sari-sari store business.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of assorted groceries and other consumable products

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
Rosalina has wide experience in farming. She has mastered farming activities from growing, caring for and harvesting and earning income as well. She has supported her husband in doing this type of work.  

Like a farmer, she has nurtured her membership with PMPC and has maintained a good repayment record. She knows she can always turn to the Cooperative for her financial needs. 

Recently, she applied for a loan to purchase rice seeds so that she will have good results, with healthier and potentially higher-yielding seedlings, and to pay for two bags of rice fertilizer.  Someday, Rosalina hopes to purchase another rice field to cultivate that will potentially add income for the family.

loans.use: to purchase rice seeds, so as to have good results and potentially higher-yielding seedlings, and pay for two bags of rice fertilizer

loans.name: Rovelyn

texts.en:
Rovelyn works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

Rovelyn requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional fish net and pay for maintenance for her boat.

Rovelyn has been in this business for 10 years now.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish net and pay for maintenance for her boat

loans.name: Senghan's Group

texts.en:
Residing in Dambae district's Kampong Cham province where a common business is cassava growing, Senghan, is 32 years old and married with one daughter. Senghan and her husband support the family by growing cassava. Moreover, they work for labor fees to make additional income.

 Leading a group of two members, Senghan requested her second loan from VisionFund after the first loan has been fully repaid. She will spend her loan portion on fertilizers and also land plowing fees. Senghan hopes to expand her current business to generate more profit.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pay land plowing fees

loans.name: Maria Camila

texts.es:
Maria, de 21 años, tiene muy claro que es lo que quiere para su vida y está decidida a culminar sus estudios para salir adelante y tener una buena vida.

Ella desea desempeñarse como vendedora de mercancía variada tales como ropa, accesorios como billeteras y algunos cosméticos, entre otros, en el municipio de Victoria.

Esta actividad desea iniciarla con el afán de buscar los recursos necesarios para su sostenimiento y para sus estudios, además de poder contribuir con los gastos en su hogar.
Es una mujer emprendedora y muy disciplinada.

Ella solicita un crédito para comprar un amplio surtido de ropa al por mayor y de este modo aprovechar la oportunidad que le presenta la Corporación Interactuar de ser independiente.

Tiene la esperanza de poder progresar como empresaria y tener unos ingresos más estables y agradece a todas las personas que puedan contribuir con su sueño.
texts.en:
Maria, 21, knows very well what she wants for her life and she has decided to complete her studies in order to get ahead and have a good life.
She wishes to become a merchant of various kinds of merchandise such as clothing and accessories such as wallets and cosmetics among other things in the municipality of Victoria.
She wishes to initiate this activity with the aim of looking for necessary resources for her sustenance and for her studies, as well as to contribute to the household expenses.
She is an enterprising and very disciplined woman.
She is requesting a loan in order to buy an ample assortment of clothing wholesale and in this way to take advantage of the opportunity presented by the Interactuar Corporation to become independent.
She hopes to be able to progress as a businesswoman and to have some more stable income.  She thanks all the people who can contribute to her dream.

loans.use: to buy an ample assortment of clothing wholesale.

loans.name: Ma. Sherly

texts.en:
Ma. Sherly is 55 years old and married with one child. With her one child still in school, Ma. Sherly works very hard to provide for her family.

Ma. Sherly runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, shampoo, bread, soft drinks, spices, etc.

Ma. Sherly has been in this business for 30 years. 

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, shampoo, bread, soft drinks, spices, etc

loans.name: Hasan

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! Now it’s time for you to meet one of Ruma’s agents, Hasan. Hasan lives in East Serang, located about two hours' drive from Jakarta, the capital city. He lives there with his wife and his only child. Hasan owns a stall where he sells daily consumer products and now he also provides mobile payment service for his community. He joined Ruma in 2013. He feels that since he joined Ruma, he learned a lot about how to improve his business and how to find another business opportunity, as well as making more contributions to his community. 

As the business keeps growing, Hasan is hoping to get a working capital loan from Kiva. He will use the capital to provide more mobile payment services to his community, especially on weekends. Having known about the importance, your loan will be very useful to help Hasan improve his business and accordingly, his community which needs access to such services. As seen in the photo, Hasan is the one who is standing in his own stall. He will be thankful for your support.

loans.use: to provide more mobile payment services to his community

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to increase the genge (small store) stock and serve more customers.

loans.name: Malohat

texts.en:
Malohat is living in a rural area. She is married and has three children. Her husband is a constructor. She is busy with feeding, tending and selling livestock. Currently, she has three cattle and three calves. She plants agricultural crops also. She plants greens, garlic, and so on. She knows well her activity and has many years of practice. 

Malohat has some problems with finance because she needs money for organizing a holiday. She is asking for financial support from KIVA lenders to organize a holiday. She hopes to be supported soon.

loans.use: To organize a holiday

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Five years ago Alice started farming on a small inherited piece of land in Nyamaiya, a remote village in the Nyamira area of Kenya. Today, this humble mother of three children sells milk, eggs, maize and a variety of food crops. She is a passionate farmer and, because of the immense knowledge she has on farming, she commands a lot of respect from other farmers in her village. 

Dairy farming is close to Alice's heart, and every day she wakes up to milk her cow and that makes her very proud. Although she makes profits through selling milk, she lacks a proper dairy unit and she is seeking a loan to build a modern dairy unit. Through the loan she will have a better time milking her cow and also feeding it. A good dairy unit provides a good place where cows can relax and also prevents them from diseases that may arise because of being exposed to harsh weather conditions such as rain.

 Alice believes that through this loan, her living conditions will change because she is going to have an increase in milk production. She will save the money that she used to spend on treating her cows because she lacked a good dairy unit. Alice waits your kindness.

loans.use: To build a modern dairy unit.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 61 years old and married with six children. Elizabeth works very hard to provide for them.

Elizabeth runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, shampoo, bread, soft drinks, spices, etc.

Elizabeth has been in this business for five years. 

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, shampoo, bread, soft drinks, spices, etc

loans.name: Glenda

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Glenda works hard to support her family.

She has a fruit vending business in the Philippines, and she earns additional income from recycled materials. Glenda is borrowing PHP 21,000 through NWTF to buy more fruit to sell to customers.

Glenda has been sustaining her business activities through her past 14 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more fruit to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase and run one Fresh Life Toilet

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase an assortment of things in wholesale such as soda, candy, baked goods, among other things

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a drill and a compressor to improve the services he offers.

loans.name: Bibirajab

texts.en:
Bibirajab is a very good woman and a mother of four children. She is 47 years old. She lives in Jomi district with her family. Bibirajab has a secondary school education. Her husband engages in agriculture.

 Bibirajab is a dressmaker. She has been involved in this kind of activity for five years. She learned this activity from her mother. Her daughter helps her in the work. Bibirajab tries to sew new dresses, because it is one of the sources of income for her family. 

Bibirajab wants to expand her activity. For this she needs to buy more fabrics and other things for sewing beautiful dresses. Unfortunately she does not have enough money. She hopes for your support.

loans.use: To purchase fabrics and other things for expanding her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more products from the wholesalers and distribute them.

loans.name: Sayohat

texts.en:
Sayohat is a hardworking woman. She was born and grew up in a rural area. She is one of the confident and brave women in her area. She is married. She has four children. Her husband is a master serviceman. Additionally he is busy with keeping livestock. Sayohat has a wish to help her family with finances and make their standard of living better. She is planning to get a 3,000 TJS loan for a more productive way to keep livestock. 

Sayohat with her husband decided to enlarge their livestock business. Now they have one big honored cow and two small honored cattle. She needs to buy forage and hopes to be supported by the Kiva project. She is asking for financial support to buy forage.

loans.use: to buy forage

loans.name: Bernardina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SANTA ROSITA DE LIMA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
La socia Bernardina continua con su  negocio de realizar eventos como matrimonios, bautizos, cumpleaños entre otros, la socia se siente agradecida por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para comprar vasos entre otros.
texts.en:
Bernandina belongs to the community bank Santa Rosita de Lima. The bank is located in the district of Cusco, which belongs to the Province of Cusco and Cusco Department. Bernandina’s continues her business of holding events such as weddings, christenings, birthdays, and more. She is grateful for the loan and promises to meet her scheduled repayments. She is a responsible and earnest person who supports her family. 

She is requesting a loan to pay for drinking glasses and other items.

loans.use: to purchase drinking glasses and other items for her events business

loans.name: Policarpio

texts.en:
Policarpio is a fish vendor from Dulag, Leyte. He is 58 years old, married, and has two grownup children. Policarpio has been in the fish vending business for more than thirty years now. This is the source of his income.

Policarpio is asking to take a loan to buy more fish to sell. A loan will help him improve his stock, thus allowing him to sell more fish to the market.

In the future, Policarpio hopes to make his business a success.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Josielyn

texts.en:
Josielyn is 31 years old and has five children. Her husband is a farmer. 

Josielyn sells meat, chicken and fish. Due to inadequate capital, she wants to borrow 4,000 PHP to purchase more stock of meat, chicken and fish. 

Josielyn and her husband are working hard to change their current living status. They believe that God will not leave them in their journey to reach their dreams.

loans.use: to purchase meat, chicken and fish for her business.

loans.name: Mary Luz

texts.es:
La socia Mary Luz se dedica al negocio de venta de comida, la socia realiza diferentes platos como pollo al horno, sopas y saltados de carne, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene 8 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es tener un restaurant. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar productos para cocinar como arroz, verduras y pollo.


La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The partner Mary Luz is in he business of selling food. She makes different dishes like baked chicken, soups, and chipped beef. She works from 8 am to 6 pm. She has had this business for 8 years and is doing very well. Her dream is to have a restaurant. She is requesting a loan to buy cooking ingredients like rice, vegetables, and chicken.

Mary Luz is happy for the loan and promises to meet her scheduled repayments.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for cooking like rice, vegetables, and chicken

loans.name: Fredrick

texts.en:
Fredrick is 23 years old and single. 
He provides transport services via his motorcycle. He has been doing this business for the last two years and he now wants to start a a new business shop with the loan he is borrowing to expand his business.

He supports his brothers and sisters in primary school. 

His hope for the future is to live a stable life as his dreams are being fulfilled.

loans.use: to start a new business shop

loans.name: Deborah

texts.en: Deborah has stopped her work as a school janitor, where she only received a daily wage of PHP 150. As a good mother and responsible wife, she never gets tired of supporting her husband to provide for their family. Deborah has four children. In order to earn a living, she engaged in a snack vending business. Her business is doing well when she doubles her time perfecting her rice cake recipe. She has maximized her profits and keeps pursuing her goals for the good of her family. The reason why she availed another loan from PMPC is to buy additional raw ingredients for her rice cakes, to cater for more customers and to be able to accept orders as well for additional earnings. She hopes and prays that her business will grow and she can make other snack recipes to increase sales. In the future, she wishes to renovate her house.

loans.use: to buy additional raw ingredients for her rice cakes, to cater for more customers and to be able to accept orders as well for additional earnings.

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Monica is 58 years old and has one child who is still in school.

Monica has a food vending business in the Philippines. Monica requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business like meat, flour, fish, vegetables, spices, etc.

Monica has been in this business for three years and earns additional income from her general store. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business like meat, flour, fish, vegetables, spices, etc

loans.name: Merlita

texts.en:
Merlita works hard to support her family. She is married, and has a buy and sell peanuts business in the Philippines.

Merlita requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional peanuts to sell.

She has been in this business for eight years now, and also earns additional income from food vending.

In the future, Merlita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional peanuts to sell

loans.name: Fabio Nelson

texts.es:
Fabio un humilde agricultor que cada mañana sale a trabajar en su campo, dedicado en pleno a su trabajo, este hombre solo piensa en progresar y entregar un buen producto pues sabe que muchas personas lo consumen y por ello cada gota de sudor que sale de su frente es el empeño que pone para que su productos salgan puros y de calidad, 

Como todo buen agricultor, quiere siempre implementar arreglos y mejoras para a sus cultivos pero sabe que estos arreglos o implementaciones son muy costosos por esta razón solicita un crédito para adecuar sus campos y comprar insumos como abonos y riegos para el mantenimiento de sus cultivos de frutas con el único propósito de mejorar su manera de cultivar, hacer más fácil su trabajo y darle al cliente final un producto de calidad
texts.en:
Fabio is a humble farmer, who goes to work on his farm everyday. He is completely dedicated to his work. This man only thinks about progressing, and he delivers a good product since he knows that many people consume it. Because of this, every drop of sweat that drips from his forehead represents the effort that he puts in so that his products are pure and of quality.

Like every good farmer, he always wants to implement repairs and improvements for his crops, but he knows that these repairs and implementations are very costly. For this reason, he requests a loan to adapt his farm and to buy supplies, such as fertilizers and irrigation, to maintain his fruit crops. His only goal is to improve his way of growing, which will make his work easier and will ensure his clients get a quality product.

loans.use: to buy supplies, such as fertilizers and irrigation to maintain his crops.

loans.name: Carmen Maria

texts.es:
La venta de ropa usada, cada vez se convierte en una opción segura de empleo, es por esto que, Carmen apostó por vender desde su hogar este tipo de productos, para ayudar a la economía de su familia. A la vez, esta mujer emprendedora y dedicada, vende artesanías características de su zona. 
Ella solicita un crédito para la compra de más ropa usada, piezas artesanales, pues le ayudarán a ofrecer mayor variedad, tanto en precios y artículos. De esta forma, podrá atraer más clientes y amentar sus ganancias. Además, Doña Carmen quiere ahorrar para ampliar el local donde vende.
texts.en:
Carmen Maria sells used clothing, which is an increasingly secure form of employment. That’s why Carmen decided to sell these items from her home to help the economy of her family. In turn, this enterprising and dedicated woman sells the crafts that are characteristic of her region.

She is requesting a loan to buy more used clothing and handmade craft pieces because they will help to provide a greater variety in both prices and articles she has to sell. She can attract more customers and increase her profits. Also, Carmen wants to save to expand the location where she sells.

loans.use: to purchase more used clothing and artisan pieces to sell

loans.name: Robert

texts.en: Robert is aged 29, married, and has two children ages nine and four who attend school. They live in Hoima Uganda. He deals in second hand clothes and shoes, supplemented by income from farming. He hopes to develop and expand his business His main challenge is inadequate capital for his business. He will use the loan to buy more shoes and clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy more shoes and clothes to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy poultry

loans.name: Rostom

texts.en:
Rostom is 26 years old. He lives with his parents in the small village of Zugdidi district. 

The family runs an agricultural business. In particular, they have cows and a plot of agricultural land, where they grow nut trees. They sell the harvested nuts and produced dairy products locally. 

Rostom wants to start his own business and requested a loan. The startup program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo enables him to get a loan of 2,000 GEL. 

With the received credit, he will purchase essential auto repair installations such as a tire changer and trim controller in order to respond rapidly to his clients' problems. In his newly opened workshop, Rostom will repair cars. He will pay rent for the workshop. Rostom is experienced in this field and is good at cars, so he thinks that he will have a good number of satisfied clients, that will affect his income.

loans.use: to purchase all the needed materials to open an auto repair workshop

loans.name: Marta

texts.es:
Marta, de 54 años de edad, está viuda y vive con sus 2 hijos de 20 y 23 años de edad, ninguno estudia, solo le ayudan a trabajar en la milpa, ya que actualmente cultivan granos básicos y agroindustriales como caña de azúcar.

Marta, es una mujer muy trabajadora, se dedica a la agricultura, lo realiza como un trabajo que fue heredado de generación en generación.- Pero además de cultivar granos básicos, también cultiva caña de azúcar de donde extrae el jugo, luego realiza todo el proceso de cocción, lo traslada a los moldes y después de 30 minutos, se obtiene el producto final llamado “atado de dulce”, que es un sustituto de los azucares empacados.

Marta, necesita el crédito para comprar insumos agrícolas para la siembra de maíz, específicamente comprará fertilizantes, para fortalecer sus cultivos y obtener una mejor producción para poder vender a mejor precio sus granos.

Marta, sueña con dejarles a sus hijos un buen patrimonio, para que continúen la tradición familiar, la cual es trabajar en la agricultura y que tengan mejores condiciones de vida que las que ella tuvo.
texts.en:
Marta, 54 years old, is a widow and lives with her two children who are 20 and 23 years old. Neither studies but they help her work in the cornfield and currently they are growing basic grains such as agro-industrials such as sugarcane. 

Marta is a hardworking woman, dedicated to agriculture, doing work that is passed down from generation to generation. But besides growing basic grains, she also grows sugarcane extracting the juice later during the cooking process moving it to molds and after thirty minutes she obtains the final product called “atado de dulce” [a whole unrefined cane sugar made from boiling and evaporation of sugarcane juice, a product also known as panela] which is a substitute for packaged sugars.

Marta needs a loan to buy agricultural supplies for growing corn, specifically to buy fertilizers, to strengthen her crops to obtain a better harvest in order to sell her grains at a higher price.

Marta dreams of giving her children a good heritage, so they have a better life than she had, continuing the family tradition which is working in agriculture.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies to grow corn

loans.name: Hach's Group

texts.en: Hach, a widowed mother of four, lives in a rural area in Kampong Cham province. Hach supports her family by growing cassava. To supplement her income, she also does rice farming. This is Hach's third loan with VisionFund. Hach's group consists of three female members and as leader, Hach requested the loan to get fertilizer and also to pay for land plowing labor. She hopes to grow a higher yield than in previous years which would allow her to generate more money and hence support her children until they graduate from school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and to pay for land plowing labor

loans.name: Fadil

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! Now it's time for you to meet one of the Ruma agents, Fadil. Fadil lives in Bogor, located about a one-hour drive from Jakarta. Fadil lives there with his wife and daughter. He owns a small stall where he sells small snacks and provides mobile payment services for his community. Fadil joined Ruma in 2013 and this is the second time he is applying for a loan from Kiva. He thanks all of the lenders for the support in the previous loan.

With assistance and support from Ruma’s staff, Fadil sees improvements in his business. As the business grows bigger, he hopes to get another working capital loan from Kiva. He will use the loan to provide more mobile payment services for his community, especially on weekends. Having known about the importance of your loan, it will be very useful to help Fadil improve his business and accordingly, his community who needs access to such services. In the photo, Fadil is the one who is standing in front of his own small stall. He thanks you for your kind and endless support.

loans.use: to provide more mobile payment services for his community

loans.name: Nijazi

texts.en:
Nijazi wants to thank all of the lenders for the previous loan which he used to purchase a cow in order to use the meat for the sausages that he sells. He still sells sausages but has not yet been able to expand to open a full butcher shop. He still hopes that he will be able to, one day. 

Now, for the second time, he is requesting a loan in order to purchase a new machine to make sausages to sell to the butcher. Nijazi is happy to have his career be the main source of income for his family. He has much confidence in his work and popularity. He promises to repay on time and wants to thank all of the lenders for their continued support.

loans.use: to purchase a new machine to make sausages to sell to the butcher.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a variety of summer-season clothing for reselling.

loans.name: Sughran

texts.en:
Sughran is the age of 55, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her son owns a shoe shop in which he sells variety of shoes. He buys shoes from different shoe manufacturing companies and sells them in his shop. He has been selling men's shoes only but now he wants to offer ladies' shoes as well according to customer demand. The major problem is the lack of a lump sum amount. 

Therefore, Sughran requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that her son would be able to buy variety of ladies shoes as well. Sughran is very happy after receiving this loan and thanks to Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to enhance her son's shoe sale shop

loans.name: Savann

texts.en: Savann is a 42-year-old married rice farmer with a child who is a factory worker. She lives in the Kampong Speu province of Cambodia. Her husband is a 43-year-old painter. Savann has been a rice farmer since 1982. Together, she and her husband can earn around $39 per day. Now Savann would like a loan to buy materials for drawings. This loan can help her and her family have enough money to buy more materials for drawing. In the future, she wants to build a fence around her house.

loans.use: to buy supplies for painting

loans.name: Mwita

texts.en:
MWITA, who is in his early 40s, is married with four children, who are still in school.  He has been running a business selling milk for fifteen years.  He works from 06 am to 12 noon and is able to make a fair monthly profit.  

This will be MWITA's 6th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  He used the previous loans to buy a large cow for more milk and has managed to pay back all his loans successfully.  He used the profit to pay school fees, loan repayment and covered household expenses.  He will use this loan to buy cow feed to make his cows produce more and better milk to meet his customers' request and demand.  He dreams of owning a big business.

Mwita will make sure he pays back his loan according to the loan schedule.

loans.use: to  buy cow feed to make his cows produce more and better milk to meet his customers'  request  and demand

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is 65 years old and supports a family of 6 people. His wife is a house wife and his children are all above 18 years of age. 

He is building a temporary business premise in Barwessa center to rent and receive income. 4

He has engaged in this business for 20 years and has 4 plots at the center.His hope and dream is to be wealthy with a stable source of income.

loans.use: This borrower will use this loan to complete building a temporary house for rental in barwessa centre

loans.name: Rosanelia

texts.en:
Rosanelia is 45 years old and married with six children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, eggs, milks, noodles, etc.

Rosanelia has been in this business for 15 years. 

In the future Rosanelia would like to save enough to provide secure financial stability for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, eggs, milks, noodles, etc

loans.name: Erlita

texts.en:
Erlita is 58 years old and married with nine children, one of whom is in school. Erlita works very hard to provide for them.

Erlita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Erlita has been in this business for seven years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, canned goods, and other groceries. 

In the future Erlita would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Analuz

texts.en:
Analuz works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 15,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy gasoline, fishing nets, etc.

Analuz has been in this business for eight years now. In the future, she would like to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy gasoline, fishing nets, etc

loans.name: Benina

texts.en:
“When smallholder farmers come together, they are powerful,” says Benina, a 37-year-old mixed farmer. For the past 16 years, she has been actively involved in mixed farming. Benina has been making great profits in farming. Because of how much she likes farming, she has even nicknamed her cows Maua and Mrembo, which makes her a very proud farmer, especially when she is milking her cows. Through her dairy cows, she is able to get between 10-15 liters a day, and this helps her support her family. 

Benina also practices crop farming, but she has not been making good profits because of poor farming implements. This is why she is kindly seeking a loan to buy farm implements. Through the loan, she will be able to buy high-quality seeds, good fertilizer and pesticides that she will use to greatly improve her crop production. Modern farming requires the use of modern techniques. Using high-quality seeds will assure her of a bumper harvest and hence, increased profit levels. 

Benina is very visionary, and her goal for the season is to boost her crop production and be able to get more crop output than the previous year. All this can be achieved through lenders’ help and goodwill. Benina believes that through the loan, she will turn around her family life and be able to give her children a solid educational background. This loan will be Benina’s way out of poverty.

loans.use: To buy farm implements, high-quality seeds, good fertilizer and pesticides

loans.name: Sona's Group

texts.en: Sona lives in Dambae district's Kampong Cham province where cassava plantations are a common business. She is 33 years old and married with three sons who all are in school. Sona and her husband have been growing cassava to support the family for more than 10 years. The previous two loans from VisionFund enabled Sona to get sufficient food for the family. This is Sona's third loan. As leader, Sona applied for the loan to buy cassava seed and to pay for land plowing labor and the land rental fee. She wants to expand her farmland.

loans.use: To buy seed and pay plowing and farmland rental fee

loans.name: Riziki

texts.en:
Riziki is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.
Riziki operates a grocery/vegetables stall, where she sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces a challenge in the high cost of transportation to her place of operation. In addition she also operates a fish selling business. 
With the Kshs 25,000 loan, she wants to purchase green vegetables, 2 crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, 2 crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale

loans.name: Kigaga Development Group

texts.en:
Edirisa is a resident of kigaga zone Nateete, a group member and chairman of the above group. He is aged 34 years, with 2 children aged 5 and 2 years respectively. He has a clinic which has been running for the last 4 years. He is acquiring a loan of ugx 500,000 in order to increase capital in the clinic by restocking drugs for his clinic. Operating his clinic allows him to support his family. He plans to increase and expand the business if he gets enough capital, since there is high demand for the services from clients of the clinic.
The challenge he is facing includes the limited capital, high demand by clients, and competition from other upcoming clinics in the area. The group members appreciate the support of the Kiva lenders. They are hard working and committed.

loans.use: To buy medicine for his clinic

loans.name: Toji

texts.ru:
Точи  трудолюбивая женщина 48 лет. Точи очень жизнерадостная женщина и хорошая мать. Она родилась и выросла  в семье рабочего. Точи замужем и имеет четырёх  детей.  Точи  вместе с супругом живут душа в душу. Они воспитывают своих детей. Вместе они живут в доме, который сами для себя построили.  Точи работает в школе. Она по профессии учительница. Точи имеет  26 лет стажа работы. 
Она обратилась в Арванд за кредитом для оплвты договора обучения её сына.Она заранее благодарит за поддержку и доверие. Спасибо Арванд.
texts.en: Toji is a hardworking 48-year-old woman. Toji is a very happy woman and good mother. She was born and raised in a working-class family. Toji is married and has four children. Toji and her husband are soul mates. They are raising their children. They live together in a house that they built by themselves. Toji works at a school. She is a teacher.
