Toji has 26 years of work experience. She requested a loan from Arvand to pay for her son's education. She is grateful in advance for the support and trust. Thank you, Arvand.

loans.use: to pay for her son's education

loans.name: Gerardo

texts.en:
Gerardo has been involved in the fashion industry for over 10 years, beginning in Mexico when he made some contacts who helped him open a retail shop. He owned multiple businesses and properties in Mexico and was very successful, when he suddenly became ill, and lost everything. He lost all his businesses and properties both in Mexico and the United States. However, being a single father, Gerardo knew he could not give up. 

All of Gerardo’s family contributed to help him rise again from his crisis; his son went to work, and Gerardo and his family moved in with his brother. Gerardo begin working as a private driver to pay his bills and take care of his family, sometimes working as much as 70 hours a week.

He has now relaunched the business named Tendenzy (http://www.tendenzy.com/) and is planning to use this loan to launch his website to sell the large amount of inventory he has purchased in an effort to rebrand and restart the business. Gerardo and his family have had to learn to live a very frugal lifestyle, a huge shift from the previously lavish lifestyle they once lived. Gerardo is resilient, and willing to use what he can to start again. 

In the future, Gerardo hopes to expand his online following and really use the brand he is creating in his packaging. Gerardo has known luxury, and now he is learning hard work, but he has received a second chance at life and is not planning to give up on his hopes, dreams, and goals anytime soon.
 
Because of safety reasons, Gerardo has chosen to have personally identifiable information altered for his protection.

loans.use: to launch his website to sell the large amount of inventory he has purchased in an effort to rebrand and restart the business.

loans.name: Adolat

texts.en:
Adolat is a modest woman. She is 23 years old. She lives with her family in Khuroson district. Currently, Adolat`s husband is a migrant worker in Russia. 

Adolat has engaged in animal husbandry for more than five years. Before marriage, she was involved in this business with her parents and she continued it in her home, too. She works very hard because she tries to provide for her family. Their life condition is bad. 

The purpose of getting a loan is because Adolat would like to arrange a circumcision event for her son. 

Adolat really needs your support. She will be very grateful for your kindness.

loans.use: to arrange a circumcision event for her son.

loans.name: Constantina

texts.es:
La socia Constantina  se dedica al negocio de restaurant, la socia es una mujer emprendedora que por medio de este negocio la socia quiere que sus hijos que terminen de estudiar, el sueño de la socia es tener un restaurant grande. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar pollo, verduras, arroz y carne.


La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The borrower, Constantina, makes a living in the restaurant business. She is an enterprising woman who, with her work in this business, wants to help her children finish their studies.

Having a big restaurant is her dream. She is requesting this loan to buy chicken, vegetables, rice and meat.

Constantina is happy to be getting a loan and she is committed to making her payments as scheduled.

loans.use: to buy chicken, vegetables, rice and meat.

loans.name: Valerio

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “Santa Rosita de Lima” de la Asociación Arariwa.
El socio sigue dedicándose al negocio de  venta de veneno para plagas, roedores, antenas entre otros, él socio lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias ale peño que le pone cada día su negocio, él socio desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
El socio solicita el crédito para la compra de antenas entre otros.
texts.en: This is a member of the “Santa Rosita de Lima” communal bank of the Asociación Arariwa. He is still making a living from his business selling insecticide, rat poison, and antennas, among other items. He has had his business for a long time and it is going well thanks to the effort he puts into it each day. He wants to be able to keep working in order to keep supporting his family. He is asking for the loan to buy antennas, among other items.

loans.use: to buy antennas, among other items.

loans.name: Mehvar

texts.en: Mehvar is a capable man born in 1992 in a small village. He is married and lives with his family. He is a confident, responsible, honest and hard-working  person. It is hard for Mehvar to support his family because he is the only one who earns income.  It is hard yo find good work in the area where he lives. That is why he is doing business in agriculture. He grows wheat, cereal and potatoes. Additionally, he raises and sells cattle at a domestic market and also in the nearby village. From each head of cattle he gains 400-450 TJS profit. Mehvar is planning to have a better standard of living. He wants to use his annual income to renovate a place to keep his cattle next year. He is asking for financial support from KIVA lenders to meet his family's needs because he is the only income source.

loans.use: To meet his family's expenses.

loans.name: Isaac

texts.en: Isaac is 53 years old. He is married and blessed with two children. He has been farming for 10 years. He has asked for a loan to purchase farm inputs. He hopes this will help him generate income. His hopes and dreams for the future are to build a dairy house, produce food in bulk, and satisfy his family needs.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs

loans.name: Dora Elizabeth

texts.es:
Dora, de 33 años de edad, es una mujer muy trabajadora, es madre soltera de un niño de 4 años de edad; actualmente se dedica al comercio.

Dora, tiene 4 años de vender comida típica a un lado de su casa, ya que es un buen lugar para vender sus productos como: papas fritas, pasteles de carne, horchata, yuca frita y tostadas de plátano, a las personas que pasan por la calle, además es bien conocida en la comunidad, por el buen sabor de sus productos. 

El dinero lo necesita para volver a comprar los insumos necesarios para continuar con su negocio de venta de comida típica, porque cuando se enfermó su hijo, tuvo que realizar muchas gastos en medicinas y se quedo sin dinero para invertir en su negocio, es por esa razón que necesita el crédito, ya que el negocio es su única fuente de ingresos, para suplir sus necesidades.

Dora, desea en un futuro tener una pequeña tienda de productos varios, donde pueda ofrecer más variedad de productos.
texts.en:
Dora is a 33-year old single mother of a 4-year-old son.  She is a hard-working woman who has a business.

For 4 years Dora has been selling typical food beside her house since it is a good place to sell her products such as potato chips, meat pies, horchata [a sweet soft drink], fried yuca, and plaintain chips to people who pass by on the street.  Besides, she is well-known in the community for the good flavour of her products.

She needs money to again buy the necessary supplies to continue her business of selling typical food because when her son was sick she had to spend a lot on medicine and that left her without money to invest in her business.  It is for this reason that she needs the loan to replace the necessities, since the business is her only source of income.

Dora wishes in the future to have a small store where she can offer a greater variety of products.

loans.use: to again buy the necessary supplies to continue with her business of selling typical food

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en: Merlyn works hard to support her family. Merlyn is married and has had a general store business in the Philippines for four years. She requested a 18,000 PHP loan through Kiva's partner, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, to buy items to sell in her store such as shampoo, soap, eggs, coffee, etc. In the future, Merlyn would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase  fertilizer to have a more productive  banana  harvest

loans.name: Thorn's Group

texts.en: A married mother of two, Thorn is 33 years old and supports the family's living by growing cassava on a 1.5-hectare farmland. As she is short of capital to maintain the crops, Thorn led a group of two members to apply for a loan from VisionFund. Thorn will spend her loan portion on labor for land plowing and also she will use this money to buy fertilizers and pesticides. She hopes this loan will allow her to make more profit so that she can build a decent house for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, pesticides and to pay for labor for land plowing.

loans.name: Maria Angela

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SANTA ROSITA DE LIMA”; la socia continua dedicándose a trabajar como barman en una empresa privada, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su trabajo el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada dia, la socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para sus estudios.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the communal bank "Santa Rosita de Lima" and continues to make a living working as a bartender for a private company.  She has a good time at work, which is going well thanks to the determination that she has each day.  She is grateful to all those who share in her dream through these means and promises to complete her repayments in the established term.  In this way she will get her family ahead in life.  

She asks for a loan in order to pay for her studies.

loans.use: to pay for her studies.

loans.name: Bertha

texts.es:
La socia Bertha se dedica al negocio de venta de ferreteria,la socia vende clavos, pinturas y alambres, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de ferreteria.La socia solicita el crédito para comprar clavos, pinturas y alambres.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member Bertha works selling hardware.  She sells nails, paint and wire.  She works from 8 AM until 7 PM.  She already has several years in this business and it is going well.  Her dream is to expand her hardware business.  She is asking for the loan to buy nails, paint and wire.

The member is happy for the loan and commits to carrying out the payments.

loans.use: to buy nails, paint and wire

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon is 58 years old, married, and has two children. She works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines, which she has been doing for two years.

Corazon requested a loan from NWTF for 10,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase more stock such as coffee, eggs, noodles, wine, etc. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase coffee, eggs, noodles, wine, etc.

loans.name: Analiza

texts.en:
Analiza is 45 years old and married with eight children, three of whom are in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell like soap, chips, eggs, bread, canned goods, etc.

Analiza has been in this business for seven years.

In the future Analiza would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell like soap, chips, eggs, bread, canned goods, etc.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 55 years old and married with four children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy more household goods to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, soap, shampoo, etc.

Jocelyn has been in this business for 10 years.

In the future Jocelyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more household goods to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, soap, shampoo, etc.

loans.name: Monica

texts.es:
Apoyada y motivada por su esposo, la señora Monica inicio un negocio de venta de pollos en el año 2001 pues los dos se sentaron a conversar del déficit económico que tenían y analizando su hogar, lo más correcto era buscarle una actividad que le permitiera estar cerca de su hogar y poder generar ingresos, de ahí la señora Monica se convirtió en una criadora de aves.

Por una inconveniente le toco parar su negocio por un tiempo pero busca reactivar su actividad por ello solicita un préstamo para abastecer sus cocheras que las podemos ver en las fotos, con el monto comprara pollos y gallinas para vender huevos y aves gordas.

Para Monica es primordial reactivar su actividad ya que ella sostenía los gastos de sus hijos y su marido los del hogar y servicios públicos, al no estar ella, han pasado algunas necesidades que no quieren volver a pasar.
texts.en:
Supported and encouraged by her husband, Sra. Monica started a business of selling chickens in 2001. The two of them had sat down in order to discuss and analyze the financial deficit of their household. They felt the best thing to do was to find a business activity that would allow her to stay close to home and still be able to generate an income. At that point, Sra. Monica decided to become a poultry farmer.

One challenge she had to face was that she had to stop her business for a period time. Now she wants to restart the business and is requesting a loan so that she can fill the coops that are shown in the photo. The amount she requested will be used to buy chickens and hens so that she can sell eggs and fattened birds.

It is important for Monicia to restart her business since it provides the means to pay the expenses for her children, her husband, her household, and public services. Without the business, they will have to sacrifice some of their needs, which is what she does not want to happen.

loans.use: to restart her business by purchasing chickens and hens.

loans.name: Anastacia

texts.en:
Anastacia is married and works hard to support her family. She operates a general store business in the Philippines, which she has been doing for nine years.

Anastacia requested a loan from NWTF for 15,000 PHP, which she will use to buy additional stocks of household goods to sell such as soap, shampoo, eggs, milk, etc. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase soap, shampoo, eggs, milk, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clothing, perfume, skin products, etc.

loans.name: Martha Evelyn

texts.es:
Marta, de 44 años de edad, está acompañada y su pareja se dedica a la agricultura, tienen dos hijos que estudian en el centro escolar del caserío.

Marta, tiene 2 años de haber abierto una pequeña tienda, donde vende productos alimenticios como arroz, azúcar y pan.- Además de tener la tienda, también vende comida típica como pasteles de carne, yuca frita y papas fritas.

Marta, necesita el préstamo para comprar más productos para su tienda y para comprar leña para cocinar la comida típica, porque en el verano, la leña se compra a precios más bajos.

Su sueño, es que sus hijos tengan una educación de calidad y desea ayudarles a que estudien en la universidad y encuentren mejores oportunidades que las que ella tuvo.
texts.en:
Marta, 44, is in a relationship. Her partner makes a living in agriculture. They have two children who study in the school of their village.

Marta opened a small store 2 years ago, where she sells foodstuff, such as rice, sugar and bread. Besides having the store, she also sells typical dishes like meat pies, fried cassava and fried potatoes.

Marta needs the loan to buy more products for her store. She also needs it to buy firewood for cooking the traditional dishes, since in the summer, firewood is sold at lower prices.

She wishes that her children have a quality education and wants to help them get to college to find better opportunities than those she had.

loans.use: to buy more products for her store and firewood for cooking traditional dishes, since it is cheaper in the summer.

loans.name: Abida

texts.en:
Abida is a 42-year-old woman residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of four children. Her husband has been running his electronics store for past six years. Her husband is responsible for feeding his entire family and fulfilling their needs.

Abida's husband has to purchase electronics merchandise such as a fridge, washing machine, iron, and other electronics devices but due to insufficient financial means her husband cannot afford to purchase these items for business purposes.

Therefore she has applied for a Kiva loan from BRAC Pakistan so that she can help her husband to purchase this merchandise as per his business needs. This loan will also help her husband to increase the size of his business and earn maximum profit.

Abida is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to help her husband to increase his electronics business.

loans.name: Chhoy's Group

texts.en: Chhoy’s group lives in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Chhoy makes a living cultivating rice to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these people to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Fanny Maximiliana

texts.es: Fanny  una joven de 26 años de edad es soltera. Actualmente cursa el 4to año de la carrera profesional de Educación por el periodo de 05 años de estudio. Decidió estudiar dicha carrera para que los niños puedan tener una educación de calidad. Actualmente se encuentra realizando sus prácticas profesionales en un colegio. Agradece a sus padres por el apoyo moral y económico que siempre le brindaron. Su mayor deseo es de poder  trabajar en el Ministerio de Educación. El crédito que solicitó lo destinará para el pago de su pensión y matricula de estudio. Fanny agradece a los inversionistas Kiva por apoyar a jóvenes como ella que buscan  superarse profesionalmente.
texts.en:
Fanny is a single, 26-year-old woman. She is currently studying in her fourth year of her five-year professional degree in Education. She decided to study for this career so children can have a quality education. She is currently student-teaching at a high school. She is grateful to her parents for the moral and financial support they have always provided her with. Her greatest desire is to be able to work at the Ministry of Education. 

The loan she requested will be used to pay her room and board and the tuition for her studies.Fanny thanks the Kiva investors for supporting young people like her who are seeking to advance professionally.

loans.use: to pay her room and board and the tuition for her studies

loans.name: Mirzohamdam

texts.en: Mirzohamdam is an agrarian man. He is from the northern part of Tajikistan and was born in 1967. He is married and has one child. In spite of his age, Mirzohamdam is a very active and capable person to work on his land every day. His wife helps and supports him doing business. He plants cereals, wheat and potatoes on his land. Additionally he has cattle and feeds them to sell in the domestic animal market. Each trade of cattle made is spent for the benefit of his family’s needs. He also has two combine harvesters. It makes his activity easier. Those combines need to be repaired. He wants to renovate them as soon as possible because when the season comes, he will need to gain the harvest. He is asking for financial support to buy spare parts for the combines to renovate them. He awaits Kiva lenders' mercy.

loans.use: To buy spare parts for the combines.

loans.name: Khalil

texts.en:
Khalil is a 32-year-old, married man from Khanyounis city. He is a father of one son. 

Khalil works as an employee in a local firm where he earns a low income. This income is barely enough to cover all the family's needs. 

Khalil wants to improve the family's living conditions, so he decided to open his own business. He started a small center for special lessons for school students.

Khalil took a USD loan from Palestine for Credit & Development (FATEN). This loan will help him to prepare his new learning center by buying furniture and some supplies. This loan will enable Khalil to increase his income.

Khalil appears in the photo.

loans.use: to prepare his new learning center by buying furniture and some supplies.

loans.name: Ronald

texts.en:
Kiva lenders! Meet Ronald, one of the most hardworking men on earth. He is 41 years of age, very hardworking and a go-getter. He is the proud father of four lovely children. He hails from Kegogi, a remote village in the Nyamira area of Kenya. This area has harsh weather conditions, and to survive you must have tough skin, but Ronald has defied all the odds and has been engaged in farming for the past fifteen years. His primary sources of income are maize, poultry, milk and animal farming. Ronald passionately loves farming and has even nicknamed one of his cows. Whenever he is milking his cow, he feels proud. He is content with the farming way of life. His biggest challenge in farming is irrigating his farm.

He is requesting a loan to buy a water tank and water pipes that he will use in pumping water from the river to his farm. Irrigation is used to assist in growing agricultural crops, maintaining landscapes, and re-vegetating disturbed soils in dry areas as well as during periods of inadequate rainfall. Through this loan, he will be able to double his crop production, and this will translate to more income. Through the extra income from farming, he will be able to support his family and keep up with his rising family expenses. Ronald patiently waits for your kindness.

loans.use: To buy a water tank and water pipes.

loans.name: Selly

texts.en:
Selly is 44 years old and supports a family of four people. Her husband is employed; hence supports his family.

Two of their children are currently in high school, and two are in college. Selly operates a shop where she supplies eggs.

She has asked for loan to purchase a refrigerator from the Coca Cola company. She will use it to chill her bottled sodas and water, and hence meet her customers’ thirst for cold drinks.

She has done this business for the last six years and has managed to support her family's needs.

loans.use: to purchase a refrigerator from the Coca Cola company that she will use to chill her bottled sodas and water.

loans.name: Vidal

texts.es:
Vidal tiene 44 años de edad, vive en casa propia de material rústico con su cónyuge y su hijo en el distrito de Querocotillo que se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Cutervo, región Cajamarca, en la sierra norte de Perú. Los pobladores de este distrito se dedican a la agricultura y al comercio.

El se dedica a la agricultura, específicamente al cultivo de maiz amarillo, cuenta con una experiencia en el rubro de 10 años y con buenas referencias por parte de sus clientes y vecinos. El préstamo que se le otorgará lo utilizará en labores agrícolas, aplicaciones e incorporaciones de productos fito sanitarias, fertilizantes, y mano de obra para deshierbo de su cultivo de maíz amarillo, esto lo ayudará a la mejora tanto fisiológica, morfológica y productiva de su cultivo, así como también tener una cosecha oportuna, y por ende tendrá mayor producción, una mejor calidad de producto, por lo cual no tendrá problemas en vender su producto lo que le generará mayores ingresos que le permitirán mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Vidal is 44 years old and lives in a house made of rustic materials that he owns with his partner and their son in the district of Querocotillo, which is located in the Cutervo province, Cajamarca region, in the northern mountain range of Peru. The inhabitants of this district make a living in agriculture and commerce.

Vidal makes a living in agriculture, specifically in growing yellow corn. He has about ten years of experience and good references from his customers and neighbors. He will use the loan he is receiving for agricultural work, to apply and incorporate phytosanitary products and fertilizers, and for labor for weeding his yellow corn crop. This will help him to improve the physiology, morphology and production of his crop, and to have a timely crop. He will therefore have a better production and a better-quality product. As such he will not have any problems selling his product and will generate better earnings that will allow him to improve his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: to do agricultural work, to apply and incorporate phytosanitary products and fertilizers, and for labor for weeding his corn crop.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is a hardworking 25-year-old farmer based in Ekerenyo village, in the Nyamira area of Kenya. She makes a living raising dairy cows and poultry. She also has a borehole where she fetches water for both domestic and agricultural use.

Beatrice is seeking a loan to purchase poultry. With a 20,000 KES loan, she will buy more chickens to add to the nine she already has.

Her dream is to scale up her poultry business and have it as one of her main sources of income. In order to achieve this, she has partnered with other local farmers to form a group so that they can access co-guaranteed loans. Income generated from the poultry farm will enable her to repay the loan on time, and she will use the additional amount to meet her family's basic needs and education costs.

loans.use: to purchase poultry.

loans.name: Musarat

texts.en:
Musarat is 41 years old, married, and has three children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been working in a public sector organization for many years and is responsible for the needs of family. Musarat provides sewing services to earn an income to contribute to the household needs.
 
Musarat requested a loan from BRAC Pakistan, which she will use to purchase needles, threads, pieces of clothes, machine oil, etc. for her business. This loan will help her to increase her monthly sales and profits by providing better sewing services.

loans.use: to purchase needles, threads, pieces of clothes, machine oil, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy recharge phone cards for her business.

loans.name: Sam On

texts.en: Sam On is 38-year-old married seller of secondhand clothes with two children, one of whom is a factory worker and one who attends school. She lives in Kampong Chhnang province in Cambodia. Her husband is a 47-year-old car driver in a company in the city. She has been selling secondhand clothes since 2013. Together, they can earn approximately $13 per day. Now Sam On would like to request a loan to buy iron, cement, rocks and zinc sheets to build a house. This loan can help her and her family have a proper house. In the future, she wants to develop her secondhand clothing shop and support her children's higher education.

loans.use: to buy iron, cement, rocks and zinc sheets to build a house.

loans.name: Rami

texts.en:
Rami is a 34-year-old married man from Khan Younis city. He is a father of two sons. Rami works as an employee in a local firm where he earns a low income. This income is barely covers all the family needs. Rami also has a store, selling home appliances in the city. It is a very good business and supports the family with a good income.

Rami took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy more products for his store to resell. This will improve the store and also his income.

Rami appears in the photo

loans.use: to buy more products to sell in his home appliance store.

loans.name: Rosario

texts.es:
La socia Rosario pertenece al banco comunal “Patrón de San Sebastián” de la ciudad del Cusco.
La socia continua dedicándose al negocio de venta de golosinas, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa,la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando  a su familia,  la socia continua vendiendo chupetines, galletas entre otros a todos sus clientes que le solictan,siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar galletas, chocolates entre otros.
texts.en:
The member Rosario belongs to the communal bank “Patron de San Sebastian” in the city of Cusco.

She continues to work in her business of selling snacks.  She is a very responsible and persevering person.  She wishes to be able to continue working and in this way continue supporting her family.  She continues selling lollipops and cookies among other items to all her customers who ask her for it.  In this manner she provides for her family.  She is requesting a loan to buy cookies and chocolate among other items.

loans.use: to buy cookies and chocolate among other items

loans.name: Nancy Goya

texts.es:
La socia Nancy pertenece al banco comunal “Patrón de San Sebastián” de la ciudad del Cusco. 
La socia Nancy es docente de profesión, a la  vez la socia sigue realizando su negocio de tejidos hechos a mano,la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa ,la socia continua elaborando sus tejidos a sus clientes que le solicitan  como amistades, familiares entre otros, siendo de  esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de lanas entre otros.
texts.en: Nancy belongs to the “Patrón de San Sebastián” communal bank in the city of Cusco. She is a teacher by profession and also still has her hand-knitting business. She is a responsible and hardworking person. She continues knitting for her customers who ask her to, such as her friends and family, among others. In this way she is able to get her family ahead. She is asking for the loan to buy wool, among other items.

loans.use: to buy wool, among other items.

loans.name: Pamela

texts.es:
La socia Pamela pertenece al banco comunal “Patrón de San Sebastián” de la ciudad del Cusco. 
La socia continua  dedicándose al negocio de alquilar carros, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando en su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio.
La socia solicita el crédito para realizar el mantenimiento de su carro.
texts.en:
The member, Pamela, belongs to “Patrón de San Sebastián” communal bank in the city of Cusco. She still works at her car rental business and wants to continue with this work so she can continue to support her family.

Pamela is a responsible and hard-working person.  She wants to be able to continue working at her business which has been going very well thanks to the hard work she puts into it every day.  She is asking for the loan so she can have maintenance done on her car.

loans.use: to perform maintenance on her car.

loans.name: Meriam

texts.en:
Meriam is 50 years old, married and has two children. One of them is in school.

Meriam is in the agricultural business, farming vegetables in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

Meriam has been farming vegetables for four years now, and has borrowed seven times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, she would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Tatu

texts.en:
Tatu is a married woman and has two kids who attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

Tatu has operated a tailoring business for the past 6 years. Her potential clients are both ladies and gents. She dreams of establishing a boutique in the future.

With the KES 30,000 she wants to purchase cloth, materials and sewing thread for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access financial support to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase cloth, materials and sewing thread for her business.

loans.name: Venus

texts.en:
Venus is 45 years old, married and has six children, three of whom are in school.

She is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Venus requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Venus has been raising pigs for 2 years now, and has borrowed 3 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Venus would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Nilda

texts.en:
Nilda is 56 years old and married with seven children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a nipa roofing making in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase nipa leaves, bamboo, plastic rope, etc.

Nilda has been in this business for 15 years. 

In the future she would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase nipa leaves, bamboo, plastic rope, etc

loans.name: Sok's Group

texts.en:
Sok has been growing cassava to support her family's living for around ten years. She is married, with five children, and lives in Memot district's Kampong Cham province. 

Consisting of five members, Sok is leading this group to request loans from VisionFund Cambodia. Since she rents the farmland, she will spend her entire loan portion on the rental fee. 

Sok hopes to generate more profit, so she can expand her business to include growing cashews next year.

loans.use: to rent farmland to grow cassava.

loans.name: Shamim

texts.en:
Shamim is a responsible mother of three children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been providing transport facilities by driving a taxi for two years. Her husband is responsible for fulfilling the needs of the entire family. He needs to do maintenance on his taxi because the current condition of his taxi is not good. It requires more maintenance charges on a daily basis. Due to insufficient financial means, her husband is unable to do maintenance on his taxi. Therefore Shamim has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

With the help of this loan, Shamim's husband can afford the maintenance cost easily and provide better transport facilities to earn a profitable income. Shamim also plans to make savings with the profit amount of her husband's income to meet her family's needs in the future. Shamim is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to help her husband to repair his taxi.

loans.name: At's Group

texts.en: A 62-year-old father of two, At lives in the Memot district's Kampong Cham province. At supports his family's living by growing cassava. This is At's fifth loan with VisionFund as he successfully repaid the previous four loans. As the group leader of his group consisting of two members, At will spend his loan portion on the rental fee as he will rent the land for farming. He hopes this year he could save enough money to get a plot of farmland so he does not need to rent the land from others.

loans.use: to pay for the farmland rental fee.

loans.name: Maa Grameseni Group-A

texts.en:
Mohini is a 30-year-old divorced lady living with her father and two children. In the picture, the lady standing first in the photo is Mohini. She owns and manages a dairy farm where she has a few cows and buffaloes. She sells ten litres of milk per day and earns 5,000 INR per month.

Her monthly income is very small for a family of four persons, as her children are in a good school. She wants to purchase a Jersey cow for her farm, as demand for cow's milk is high in her village. She also has a plan to repair the shed for her cattle and make it bigger.

Mohini, along with her group members, has requested a loan of 36,000 INR. She will use her portion of the loan for purchasing a cow and renovating the shed.

In the future, she wants to expand her farm and sell more milk products like yogurt, butter, etc. She has a dream to give a quality life to her family and save some money for her children's future.

All the members of this group are engaged in the dairy business.

loans.use: to purchase a cow and renovate the cattle shed.

loans.name: Gulmira

texts.en:
Gulmira was born into and grew up in a family of agrarians. Her parents are working in agriculture. She has practice to work in agriculture. Gulmira is living in a village with her family. She is married and has three children. Her parents worked hard in order to have wealth in the family. Her gained practice learned from her parents helped her in life. 

Because her husband works as a teacher in secondary school and the salary that he earned was not enough to feed their family, they left to another district with her family. Her husband then left for Russia to earn money to feed his family. Gulmira decided to help and support her husband, starting a  business in agriculture. 

Gulmira started to work with land and saved up money. With saved money, she bought a milk cow. She is planning to eventually enlarge this business and buy more cattle. At the same time, she rented a land for planting watermelon, melon and rice. This year she does not have enough money to plant watermelon, melon and rice. She is requesting financial support from Kiva lenders to buy seeds and fertilizer. She hopes to be supported.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Sobira

texts.en:
Sobira is a very responsible woman. She organized a family business, because she feels a filial duty to support and help her family. She has a business trading cattle and planting grapes. She well knows her business well, and has years of practice.

Sobira lives in bad conditions and wants to live better. She is planning to buy construction materials to complete renovations. She is asking for financial support from Kiva lenders to buy construction materials. Sobira is hoping for your support.

loans.use: to buy construction supplies for renovations.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is 44 years old and married with four children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a retail nipa roofing in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional nipa roofing to sell.

Marilyn has been in this business for three years. In the photo she is holding her son.

In the future, Marilyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional nipa roofing to sell

loans.name: Karen

texts.en:
Karen is involved in a retail business. Together with his three children and his wife, Karen lives in Artik town, in the Shirak region. 

Karen has been involved in selling cement and sand for ten years already. He works with his brother and they are the only traders of cement and sand in the region. 

To boost his business, Karen applied for this loan for financial support. He plans to purchase cement and sand for his retail business. 

His loan has been approved within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. This program provides business start-up loans to informal businesses that do not qualify through normal channels.

loans.use: to pay for cement and sand for a retail business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a motorbike to transport produce to market.

loans.name: Artur

texts.en:
Artur is from Vedi town, where he lives with his wife, three children and mother.

Artur has been involved in construction for eight years already. He provides construction services for houses and interior design work. Artur needs some financial support, because the tools and equipment he uses are old and they need to be changed. He is asking for this loan to purchase tools and materials needed for his work.

His loan has been approved within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. This program provides business start-up loans to informal businesses that do not qualify through normal channels.

loans.use: to pay for tools and materials for his construction and interior design work.

loans.name: Victoria Del Socorro

texts.es: Doña victoria es una mujer que día a día lucha por salir adelante. Ella agradece a Kiva y a Mi crédito ya que gracias al beneficio que se le brindo pudo mejorar las condiciones de su negocio e invertir en nuevos insumos para la elaboración de tortillas y también para comprar nueva mercadería para su pulpería y de esta manera diversificar su negocio. Ahora ella solicita nuevamente el crédito para volver a invertir en productos y comprar dulces, jugos, bocadillo, meneítos, etc. de esta manera ampliar la oferta para sus clientes; ya que así podrá obtener mayores ganancias y mejorar su calidad de vida. Sus metas son pagar su crédito.
texts.en:
Victoria is a woman who, day by day, struggles to forge ahead. She is grateful to Kiva and Mi Credito, since, thanks to the benefits they have offered her, has been able to improve the conditions of her business and invest in new inputs for making tortillas; and, also, to purchase new merchandise for her general store.  In this manner, she has diversified her business.

Now, Victoria is requesting a loan to, once again, invest in products and purchase sweets, juices, sandwiches, snacks, etc. By doing so, Victoria hopes to expand her offerings for her customers. As a result, she should be able to obtain greater earnings and improve her quality of life.

Victoria's short-term goal is to pay off this loan.

loans.use: to purchase sweets, juices, sandwiches, snacks, etc., to sell.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
Francisca, de 62 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, es viuda y es madre de un hijo, el cual ya no vive con ella, solos vive con sus nietos y su nuera.

Francisca, se dedica a los oficios domésticos y a la agricultura, ya que cuando quedo sola tuvo que trabajar para sacar adelante a su familia, trabajando en la agricultura, compra cerdos para engordar y cría aves de corral.

Francisca, utilizara el préstamo para la construcción de un muro de retención en la parte oriente y poniente de su casa, para evitar deslaves cuando comience el invierno, esto le dará mayor seguridad a su vivienda y su familia.

Francisca, sueña con poder compartir con sus nietos, verlos crecer y que puedan tener acceso a la educación.
texts.en:
Francisca is 62 years old, widowed, and the mother of one son who doesn't live with her any longer. She lives with her grandchildren and her daughter-in-law. Francesca never had the opportunity to go to school. She takes care of her house and also works in agriculture, since when she lost her husband she had to work to support her family. She buys pigs to fatten and also raises poultry.

Francisca will use the money from the loan to construct a retaining wall on the east and west sides of her house to avoid landslides once the winter begins. This will provide more safety for her house and her family.  She dreams of sharing with her grandchildren, watching them grow, and seeing them have access to an education.

loans.use: to construct a retaining wall to avoid landslides when the winter starts.

loans.name: Srey's Group

texts.en:
A widowed mother of six, Srey is 49 years old and lives in the Ponhea Krek district's Kampong Cham province. Srey supports her family's living by farming rice. She also works as a laborer for a fee. 

As the first loan has been fully repaid, Srey is leading her group of two members to apply for another loan from VisionFund. Srey is planning to use her entire loan portion to get piglets to raise. This will enable her to supplement her income, helping her to fulfill her wish to keep her children in school until they graduate.

loans.use: To buy more piglets

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Mama

texts.en:
Mama is a 27-year-old married woman with one son who is engaged in cultivating vegetables and selling them in the market. Through her job, she works to support her family, to improve her business and to continue growing. She is a very determined person who wants to continue growing. 

She is requesting this loan in order to be able to invest it in the purchase of vegetable seeds, fertilizers, pesticides, and other vegetables and fruits to continue to increase her sales. Mama is very grateful for this opportunity for growth that she is receiving.

loans.use: To purchase vegetable seeds, fertilizers, pesticides, etc

loans.name: Maa Grameseni Group-C

texts.en: These members belong to the Maa Grameseni Group-C. One of them is Sabitri, age 27. In the picture, the lady standing first from the left is Sabitri. Sabitri has a spouse and three children. She alternates her daily activities with a business selling rice, grams, spices, wafers, hair oil and other household consumables. She runs a small shop where she sells all these things to support her family. She has been in this business for a good amount of time, and she does well thanks to the daily effort she puts into her business. She also sells vegetables in her shop. She requests the loan to buy sugar, rice, edible oil, soap, detergents and other household consumables for her business. She thanks those who share her dream by this means and commits to making her payments as scheduled. The businesses of the other group members are a butcher shop, dairy farm, and a tailoring shop.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, rice, edible oil, soap, detergents and other household consumables to sell.

loans.name: Maa Grameseni Group-B

texts.en:
Bidar is a 45-year-old lady living with her husband and two children. In the picture, the lady standing first from right in the photo is Bidar. She owns and manages a dairy farm where she has a few cows and buffalos. She sells five litres of milk per day and earns 3,000 Indian rupees (INR) per month. Her monthly income is very small for a family of four persons. She wants to purchase a Jersey cow for her farm, as the demand for cow's milk is high in her village. She also has a plan to repair the shed for her cattle and make it bigger. 

Bidar, along with her group members, has requested a loan of 36,000 INR. She will use her portion of the loan for purchasing a cow and renovating the shed. In the future, she wants to increase her farm and sell more milk products like yogurt, butter, etc. She has a dream of giving a quality life to her family and saving some money for her children's future. All the members of this group are engaged in dairy businesses.

loans.use: to purchase more cows and repair her cattle shed.

loans.name: Shabana

texts.en:
Shabana is a 59-year-old woman. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan and has two children. Her husband has been working in public sector organization for many years, and her husband is responsible to fulfill the needs of family. Shabana is also providing sewing services and earns income to contribute with her husband to the management of the household. 

She needs different kinds of goods like needles, thread, pieces of cloth, machine oil and more for her business purpose, but due to insufficient financial means she is unable to purchase these accessories. Therefore, she has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her to purchase the above accessories and also be helpful for her in increasing monthly sales and profit by providing better sewing services. 

Shabana is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase tools and materials tp increase her tailoring business

loans.name: Mom

texts.en:
Mom is a 62-year-old widowed rice farmer with a child who is security guard. She lives in the Kampong Speu province in Cambodia. She has been a rice farmer since 2000. Mom and her child can earn around $8 per day. 

Now, Mom would like to request a loan to buy a motorcycle for her child who commutes to work. This loan can help her and her child reduce transportation expenses for their family. In the future, she wants to buy more soil to fill the yard around her house.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle for her child to commute to work

loans.name: Las Piedritas Group

texts.es: Esta es la nueva Alcancía Comunal “Las Piedritas” y  lo conforman  05 socios trabajadores y solidarios. Sandra de 27 años de edad, es  separada con 02 hijos dependientes. Ella se dedica a la venta de pollos hace mas de 4 años, el cual le va bien, gracias a su esfuerzo ella trata de sacar adelante a sus hijos. Su mayor deseo es implementar su negocio con más variedades de productos. Solicitó el crédito para la compra de pollos.  El grupo “Las Piedritas” agradece a los inversionistas Kiva por el crédito brindado. Sandra es la segunda del lado derecho y viste polo negro.
texts.en: This is the new Las Piedritas Communal Bank and it is made up of five hardworking and supportive members.  Sandra, who is 27, is separated with two dependent children.  She has been selling chickens for other four years, which is going well for her thanks to her efforts.  She is trying to get her children ahead.  Her greatest desire is to stock her business with a wider variety of products.  She requested this loan to buy chickens.  The Las Piedritas Group thanks Kiva's lenders for the loan they have provided.  Sandra is the second from the right and she is wearing a black t-shirt.

loans.use: to buy chickens

loans.name: Gulbahorhon

texts.en: Gulbahorhon has eight years of practice in trading women's clothes. She was born in 1981 and lives in a village. She is married and has three children. She wants to have a permanent place for trading and business. She is well known among sellers and has satisfied clients. She tries to serve clients gently and refreshes her goods, buying a new collection of clothes. Now she is asking for financial support from Kiva lenders to buy women's clothes. This is needed to attract more clients to her goods because it will help her to earn more money and have a better standard of life. She hopes to be supported.

loans.use: To buy women's clothes

loans.name: Ana Silvia

texts.es: Ana de 52 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su compañero de vida, su hija y sus 2 nietos de 6 y 3 años de edad que son la alegría de su casa. Ella se dedica desde hace muchos años a la crianza de ganado bovino y para obtener ingresos económicos comercializa leche de vaca, además su compañero de vida se gana la vida como jornalero, gracias a lo cual le brinda su apoyo. Ana desea construir un corredor frente a su vivienda lo antes posible, ya que al no contar con este beneficio en épocas de lluvia el agua ingresa a su vivienda deteriorando sus pocas pertenencias, por lo que ella solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena, grava, láminas, polines y ladrillos para construir un corredor en su vivienda y de esta manera brindar una mayor protección a la misma y a su familia.
texts.en:
Ana is 52 years old and lives in her own home together with her life partner, her daughter and her two grandsons who are 6 and 3 years old.  They are the joy of the house.  She has worked at raising cattle for many years, and she sells cow's milk for income. In addition, her partner earns a living as a day laborer, so he is able to provide support as well. 

Ana wants to build a veranda on the front of her house as soon as possible, because without it water floods her home during the rainy season, ruining her few possessions. This is why she is asking FUSAI for a loan which she will use to buy the cement, sand, gravel, corrugated metal, beams, and bricks she needs to build the veranda.  This will provide better protection for her and her family.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, gravel, corrugated metal, beams, and bricks to build a veranda onto her house.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.es:
La socia Patricia pertenece al banco comunal “Patrón de San Sebastián” de la ciudad del Cusco.
La socia Patricia continua dedicándose a realizar diseños publicitarios ,la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia a la vez continua dedicándose a la elaboración de tortas, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de insumos como harina, mantequilla entre otros.
texts.en:
Patricia is a member of the “Patrón de San Sebastián communal bank in the city of Cusco. 

Patricia continues to work creating advertising designs. She has been in this business for some time and things are going well thanks to the effort she puts in each day to the business. 

At the same time she continues dedicating herself to making cakes. She wants to continue working in this way to continue supporting her family. 

She is asking for a loan in order to buy supplies such as flour, butter, and more.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as flour, butter, and other items

loans.name: Eliana

texts.es:
La socia Eliana pertenece al banco comunal IMASUMAC II ,la socia sigue dedicándose al negocio de venta de ceviche, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa ,la socia continua vendiendo su ceviche a su cliente que le solictan,la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de pescado, limón, sal entre otros.
texts.en:
Eliana belongs to the IMASUMAC II Communal Bank; she still has her business selling ceviche.  She is a responsible and diligent person.  She is still selling her ceviche to the customers who order it.  She wants to keep working so she can keep supporting her family.  

She is requesting this loan to buy fish, lemon, and salt, among other things.

loans.use: to buy fish, lemon, and salt, among other things.

loans.name: Maria Magdalena

texts.es:
La socia María pertenece al banco comunal IMASUMAC II ,la socia continua dedicándose a la venta de joyas , la socia María se siente agradecida por el crédito y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas con mucha responsabilidad, la socia continua vendiendo lo que son aretes,collares,pulseras entre otros para todo sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia es una persona responsable  siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de pulseras entre otros.
texts.en:
María belongs to the IMASUMAC II Communal Bank.  She is still selling jewelry for a living.  María is thankful for her loan and promises to make her payments very responsibly.  She is still selling earrings, necklaces, and bracelets, among other items, to all the customers who order from her.  She is a responsible person, which is how she has gotten her family ahead.  

She is requesting this loan to buy bracelets and other items.

loans.use: to buy bracelets and other items.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es:
La socia Vilma pertenece al banco comunal IMASUMAC II ,la socia continua  dedicándose a la artesanía, la socia se siente  agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas, la socia continua vendiendo chompas, polos entre otros, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicito el crédito para la compra de chompas.
texts.en:
Vilma belongs to the IMASUMAC II Communal Bank.  She is still doing craftwork.  She is thankful for the loan she has received and she promises to make her payments.  She is still selling sweaters and t-shirts, among other things.  She wants to keep working so she can keep supporting her family.  

She requested this loan to buy sweaters.

loans.use: to buy sweaters

loans.name: Yeny

texts.es:
La socia Yeny pertenece al banco comunal IMASUMAC II ,la socia continua dedicándose al negocio de venta de Cds y Dvds, la socia se siente  agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas, la socia continua vendiendo  su mercadería  a todos sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma  seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de Dvds.
texts.en:
Yeny belongs to the IMASUMAC II Communal Bank.  She still has her business selling CDs and DVDs.  She is thankful for the loan she has received and promises to make her payments.  She is still selling her merchandise to all the customers who request it.  She is a responsible and diligent person.   She wants to keep working so she can keep supporting her family.  

She is requesting this loan to buy DVDs.

loans.use: to buy DVDs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase farm tools.

loans.name: Buntheng's Group

texts.en:
A young mother of one boy, Buntheng is 20 years old and married. The family lives in the Ponhea Krek district's Kampong Cham province. Buntheng works in rubber plantation for a labor fee to support her family's living. 

To supplement her income, Buntheng also grows peppers for selling. As the business needs money, Buntheng led a group of two members to apply for loans from VisionFund. Buntheng will spend her loan portion on fertilizer and pesticide for her pepper plantation.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticide

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Kamba Group

texts.en:
Eric is a group chairman of Kamba Group. He lives in Kasubi. He is taking a loan of UGX 500,000 as a top up to buy a motorcycle. He has three children, of which two are school-going. The children are nine, five, and two years old. He also has three dependents of whom he takes care.

He has been operating his boda-boda (motorcycle transport) business for the last six years. That is how he earns a living and supports the family's needs and demands.

He plans to expand the business by acquiring more motorcycles. He wants to expand the business in order to earn more income in the near future. The challenges he is facing include the aging of the motorcycle, stiff competition, stealing of motorcycles, and poor roads during the rainy season.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.es: Ricardo de 62 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus cuatro hijos, el se dedica a la acrianza de ganado bovino y también a la agricultura, sus actividades las desarrolla solamente con su grupo familiar, tiene más de 8 años de dedicarse a la acrianza de ganado y más de 35 años de dedicarse a la agricultura, comercializa sus productos en los pueblos aledaños y con lo que obtiene de sus ganancias  logra salir adelante, el esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de un terreno que es el que muestra en la fotografía para poder seguir con sus cultivos y si poder tener una mejor calidad de vida junto con su familia.
texts.en: Ricardo is 62 years old and lives in his own home with his wife and their four children.  He raises cattle and also farms for a living.  He does his work with his family group only.  He has been raising cattle for over eight years and he has been farming for over 35 years.  He sells his produce in neighboring towns and he is able to get ahead with his earnings.  He is requesting a loan to buy a plot of land, which is shown in this photograph, so he can continue with his planting and thereby enjoy a better quality of life along with his family.

loans.use: to buy a plot of land

loans.name: Juan Antonio

texts.es: Juan  de 40 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus dos hijos, el se dedica a la crianza de ganado bovino y también tiene una pequeña tienda, en ambas actividades tiene una experiencia de más de 15 años, inicio con capital propio, comercializa sus productos en los alrededores de la zona donde el reside y con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar algunos gastos que se le presentan en su hogar, el esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de un toro reproductor para seguir con la crianza y asi poder tener mejores ingresos para una calidad de vida.
texts.en: Juan  is 40 years old and lives in his own house with his wife and his two children. He works raising cattle and also has a small store. He has more than 15 years of experience in both businesses. He started with his own capital. He sells his product in the area surrounding where he lives and manages to pay some of the household expenses with what he makes. He is requesting a loan to buy a breeder bull to continue raising cattle and be able to have greater income for a higher quality of living.

loans.use: to buy a breeder bull.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy various household supplies for retail.

loans.name: Munozhot

texts.en:
Munozhot is an agrarian woman. She was born in a family of workers in 1983. She is married and has three children. She has a business dealing in calves and has twelve years of practice in agriculture. Her husband supports and helps her to do business. She has a good planting of grapes and good conditions for keeping a livestock. 

Munozhot is responsible and hardworking person. She needs to buy construction supplies for renovation. She is planning to renovate her house because it is in bad condition. She requested financial support from Kiva lenders to buy construction supplies to renovate her home. She hopes to be supported.

loans.use: to buy construction supplies for renovating her home

loans.name: Anthony

texts.en:
Anthony is a single man. He describes himself to be ambitious. He operates a transport business where he transports customers using his motor vehicle. He has been involved in this business for eight years. His primary customers are the general public. 

He will use the Kes 90,000 loan to service his motor vehicle.

His business goal is to buy another motor vehicle within five years. He hopes that in the future he will be independent. 

This is his fifth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to service his motor vehicle

loans.name: James

texts.en: This is 37 year-old James.  He is married and has 2 children aged 10 and 1. He has 2 additional dependents, who live with him as foster children.  In 2012, James established his cement, rice, vegetable oil, soft drinks, etc. business. He began his business because he stopped at the tertiary level and later was employed as a driver.  The money he earned was used to start a clothing business and also he was loaning people in his community money with interest. The interest and profit he generated from the clothing business and loan business was used to establish the drinks and cement business.  Working 6 days a week and 13 hours a day, he earns about Le 3010000 every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of Le 5,000,000. James requires a loan in order to buy vegetable oil, crates of assorted hard and soft drinks and packets of liquor drinks.  In the future James plans to provide quality education for his children, reinvest in his business and improve the standard of living of his family.  His main challenge is lack of adequate capital to purchase the goods needed by customers.  He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy vegetable oil, crates of assorted hard and soft drinks and packets of liquor drinks.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is married and she works hard to support her family. She has a fishing business in the Philippines and also earns income from pig fattening. She is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to buy fishing gear and other equipment for her fishing business.

Rebecca has been sustaining her business activities through her past 20 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Nancy is 38 years old and has three children who are in school.

Nancy has a buy and sell vegetables business in the Philippines. Nancy requested a PHP 10000 loan amount through NWTF to buy vegetables to sell in her stall.

Nancy has been in this business for 5 years. In the future, Nancy would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy vegetables to sell in her stall

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay workers who harvested maize.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
Patricia is a widowed woman. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Patricia is 55 years old.

Patricia has a buy and sell ready to wear business in the Philippines. Patricia requested a PHP 17000 loan amount through NWTF to buy clothes and other item to resell.

Patricia has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Patricia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy clothes and other item to sell

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Alicia is 53 years old.

Alicia has a nipa roofing business in the Philippines. Alicia requested a PHP 8000 loan amount through NWTF to buy materials needed for her business like bamboo sticks, etc..

Alicia has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, Alicia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for her nipa roofing business like bamboo sticks, etc.

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.en:
Ofelia is 41 years old and married with three children. With three children in school, Ofelia works very hard to provide for them.

Ofelia runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25000 loan through NWTF to buy item to sell in her general store like canned goods, beverages, home care products and groceries.

Ofelia has been in this business for 10 years now. 

In the future, Ofelia would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her general store like canned goods, beverages, home care products and groceries

loans.name: Kiraaro Twekambe Group

texts.en: Peter is a 60-year-old married man with five children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He sells fresh foods and at the same time, grows bananas that add to his income. He is faced with the challenge of defaulters who delay to pay him, which in the end hinders growth of his business. He has hopes of educating all his children to higher levels of learning. Peter needs a loan to buy more fresh foods for sale.

loans.use: to buy more fresh food for sale

loans.name: Mary Luz

texts.es: Mary es una señora muy alegre, Mary tiene 40 años de edad y esta casada con el que tiene una hija de 15 años y esta estudiando, Mary se dedica  a la comercialización de ropa, el esposo de Mary se dedica a trabajar a la agricultura también es músico, Mary vive con su esposo y su hija en la casa de su cuñada, Mary necesita el dinero del crédito para comprar ropa, Mary compra su mercadería en ciudades  lejanas donde puede conseguir  la ropa mas barata y al momento de venderla  le queda su ganancia, Mary y su esposo aspiran seguir trabajando para a futuro comprarse una pequeña casa donde pueda mejorar la calidad de vida de su hija.
texts.en: Mary is a very cheerful woman.  Mary is 40 years old and she is married with a 15-year-old daughter who is in school.  Mary sells clothing for a living; Mary's husband works in farming and he is also a musician.  Mary lives with her husband and their daughter in her sister-in-law's house.  Mary needs the money from the loan to buy clothing.  Mary buys her merchandise in faraway cities where she can get clothing cheaper and after selling it she makes a profit.  Mary and her husband hope to keep working so that in the future they can buy themselves a small house where they can improve their daughter's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy clothing.

loans.name: Rosa Concepcion

texts.es:
Rosa, de 33 años de edad, está casada y su esposo es agricultor y le ayuda en la siembra de milpa de temporada, ya que este tipo de tareas son las que desarrolla con mucha facilidad, tiene 3 hijos, siempre están dispuestos a colaborar en los quehaceres de la casa y del campo.

Rosa, se dedica a la elaboración de pupusas y tortillas, las cuales hace para la venta en la localidad y con sus vecinos, a los cuales les encantan las tortillas de0 Rosa.- Hace tortillas y pupusas desde hace 6 años, es su principal fuente de ingresos.

El préstamo será utilizado para comprar un molino, el cual servirá para tener otra fuente de ingreso para su familia, ayudando para apalancar la carga familiar que ya tiene Rosa.
 
En el futuro Rosa, sueña con arreglar su casa y mejorar su calidad de vida y la de sus familia en general.
texts.en:
Rosa is 33 years old.  She is married and her husband is a farmer.  She helps him in the seasonal sowing of maize since this type of task can be carried out easily.  She has 3 children and they are always ready to contribute to the household and field chores.

Rosa works at making pupusas [a thick corn tortilla stuffed with cheese, fried pork rind, chicken, or refried beans] and tortillas which she makes to sell in the area and to her neighbours who love Rosa's tortillas.  She has been making tortillas and pupusas for 6 years and it is her principal source of income.

This loan will be used to buy a mill which will serve as another source of income, thus helping to ease the financial burden of supporting the family.
 
In the future, Rosa dreams of fixing up her house and improving her quality of life and that of her family in general.

loans.use: to buy a mill

loans.name: Carlos Eduardo

texts.es: A sus 47 años de edad Eduardo está soltero, tiene un hijo de 10 años de edad que asiste a la escuela, Eduardo se dedica a trabajar en el jornal y en la crianza de animales menores, Eduardo vive con su hijo ya que comenta que la madre del niño los abandono,  Eduardo con el dinero del crédito va a comprar pollos que los va a criar en pequeños galpones y comenta  que si le queda ganancia para gastan en la educación de su hijo, Eduardo tiene  la aspiración de seguir en su negocio y que mejoren sus ingresos y asi lograr mejorar la calidad de vida de su hijo.
texts.en: At 47, Eduardo is single; he has a 10-year-old son who is in school.  Eduardo does day labor and raises small animals for a living.  Eduardo lives with his son and tells that the boy's mother abandoned them.  With the money from the loan Eduardo is going to buy chickens, which he will raise in small sheds and he tells us that if he makes surplus income he will spend it on his son's education.  Eduardo hopes to continue with his business and to improve his earnings so he can improve his son's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy chickens

loans.name: Luiza

texts.en:
Luiza has been providing hairdressing services for five years. Most of the work day, Luiza works at home, and sometimes she fulfills orders at a customer's home. Luiza lives with her husband, who works at a police station in Kapan, a town in the Syunik region.

Luiza likes her job and, due to her hard work, is now a very professional hairdresser. To be able to make her work more convenient both for clients and for herself, Luiza asks for this loan. She plans to purchase a hairdressing chair and table as well as materials (cosmetics, hair dryer, paints).

Her loan has been approved within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. This program provides business start-up loans to informal businesses that do not qualify through normal channels.

loans.use: to purchase a hairdressing chair and table as well as materials (cosmetics, hair dryer, paints).

loans.name: Abel

texts.es: Abel es un señor de 65 años de edad, está casado y su esposa tiene una pequeña tienda de confites en un cuartito por el que paga arriendo, Abel tiene 2 hijos que  ya son mayores de edad e independientes, Abel vive con su esposa en una casa que le presta un familiar, Abel se dedica a la agricultura y a la ganadería ya que comenta que estas actividades son sus fuentes de ingresos, Abel necesita el dinero del crédito para comprar terneros y así seguir adelante en su negocio, Abel comenta que su más grande aspiración es de seguir trabajando para él y su esposa y asi tener una vejez digna.
texts.en: Abel is 65 years old; he is married and his wife has a small candy shop on a small corner that she pays rent for.  Abel has two children who are now adults and independent.  Abel lives with his wife in a home lent to them by a relative.  Abel works in farming and livestock and he tells us that these businesses are his sources of income.  Abel needs the money from the loan to buy calves so he can move forward with his business.  Abel tell us that his greatest dream is to keep working for himself and for his wife so they can have a dignified old age.

loans.use: to buy calves

loans.name: Akokoè

texts.fr: A 27 ans, Akokoè est une femme célibataire sans enfant et vit dans le quartier de Tokoin. Pour répondre à ses besoins, Akokoè vend des chaussures en se promenant dans le quartier. Akokoè s’approvisionne une fois par mois au marché. Akokoè nécessite ce crédit pour acheter des chaussures afin de gagner assez de bénéfices pour subvenir favorablement à ses besoins quotidiens
texts.en:
At the age of 27, Akokoè is a young single woman with no children. She lives in the Tokoin neighborhood. To support herself, Akokoè sells shoes, walking through the neighborhood. She buys her stock once a month in the market. 

Akokoè needs this loan to buy some shoes so as to earn enough profit to meet her daily needs.

loans.use: to buy 83 pairs of shoes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more goods for the customers

loans.name: Sokhorn's Group

texts.en:
Sokhorn is 39 years old and married with four children. The family lives in Kroch Chhma district, Kampong Cham province. Sokhorn makes a living to support her family by growing cassava.

As the third loan ended, Sokhorn is now leading a group of four members to apply for a loan from VisionFund. She will spend her loan portion on plowing services and to get piglets for raising to generate additional income. She hopes to improve her family's lifestyle.

loans.use: to pay a land plowing fee and to buy piglets

location.town: Kampong Cham province; Kroch Chhma district

loans.name: Atsu

texts.fr: Marié et âgé de 34 ans, Atsu est un homme très entrepreneur et actif dans la gestion de ses besoins. Avec sa femme et son enfant à charge, Atsu habite à Gbossimé pour faire le commerce de vente des objets de décorations et des objets d’arts qu’il fabrique. Ce commerce lui apporte son bénéfice et Atsu s’approvisionne deux fois par mois auprès de ses fournisseurs. Pour acheter des peintures et des fleurs, Atsu demande ce crédit pour financer sa commande et réaliser assez de profit pour répondre favorablement aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en: Atsu is 34 years old and married.  He is a man with a very enterprising spirit, who actively manages his own needs.  He lives in Gbossimé with his wife and one dependent child.  He makes and sells decorative items and artifacts. He is able to make a profit thanks to this retail business.  He gets his supplies from wholesalers twice per month.  Atsu is taking this loan to buy paints and flowers.  This loan will help him to finance his current order and to make enough profits to meet his family's needs.

loans.use: to buy some paints and flowers.

loans.name: Sofia

texts.en:
Sofia, 44 years old, is married with four children. 

She lives in rural Ishaka and operates a retail shop as her main source of income and her clients are all categories of people. She does business from her local area of residence in Rutoto, Rubirizi District. She also does agriculture, where she earns income to support her family. 

Sofia has requested a loan of UGX 2,500,000 (Two million five hundred thousand shillings) to buy more stocks for her retail business. 

She started her businesses in the year 2005, to have a steady source of income to look after her family. She is a hard-working and honest woman, giving her businesses ten hours a day and six days a week, which has enabled her to grow the businesses from one level to another. 

However, Sofia is faced with the challenges of price fluctuations and high taxes charged on rental goods that have affected her business so much, but she has learned to manage them. 

She hopes to start a big wholesale business in the future.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her retail shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a metal press machine.

loans.name: Nji Richard

texts.en:
He is married with five children living in a five room house in the North West Region of Cameroon. He faces so many challenges in life, amongst which are the death of his son, sickness, and inadequate finances for proper medication and the education of his children.

With this loan he plans to buy Irish potato seedlings, fertilizer and also rent a farm plot. He will also use part of the money to pay for transportation of the farm inputs to the farm and transport the crops back to the market.

He holds a positive view of succeeding in this farming activity because of the ever increasing demand of his farm products. Again the soils are good and with an additional input of fertilizer, there will be an increase in yields. Furthermore, with the recent support from agricultural institutions and improved seeds, he expects a high output.

With the profit from this Empowerment credit loan, he will improve his family's living conditions, pay his children’s school fees and extend his farmland. 

He prefers a loan from GHAPE because of its lower interest rate, the loan is paid in instalments, and the long duration is less stressful. It also couples with non-financial services offered by GHAPE (e.g. training and social networking).

loans.use: to pay for Irish potato seedlings, fertilizer and to rent a piece of land for cultivation

loans.name: Sohibahon

texts.en:
Sohibahon has more than twenty years of experience trading in children's wear. Especially when her husband died, it was hard for her to feed her family. 

She has a good loan history at IMON. She is a responsible, communicative and punctual person. Sohibahon is asking financial support from Kiva lenders to buy children's wear. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To buy children's wear

loans.name: Nisreen

texts.en:
Nisreen is a 30-year-old married woman from Bethlehem city. She is a mother of one son and three daughters. Her husband works as an employee in a local company where he earns a low income. 

Nisreen has a workshop for traditional sewing. She makes nice traditional pieces and sell them to the local traders. Nisreen would like to improve her business so she has taken a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to buy raw materials like textiles and yarn for her business. 

Nisreen appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy raw materials like textiles and yarn for her business.

loans.name: Rahab

texts.en:
