Rahab is 31 years old. She is married to David Muruoki, a Kenya Power and Lighting Officer. They are blessed with three children, ages 11, 7, and 1. 

She has had a retail shop for 10 years and earns a monthly income of 30,000 KES. She has borrowed 20,000 KES from VisionFund Kenya as her first loan. She will use the loan to purchase soft drinks, sugar, cereals, match boxes, cooking fat, biscuits, sweets, pancakes, toothbrushes, toothpaste, detergent, tissue papers, and bar soaps. 

She hopes the anticipated profit will help her pay school fees for her children, buy food for the family, provide medical care for the family, expand the current business, and repay the loan. Her hopes and dreams for the future are to have a thriving business, to educate her children, and to enjoy a better life with her family.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, sugar, cereals, match boxes, cooking fat, buscuits, sweets, pancakes, toothbrushes, toothpaste, detergent, tissue papers, and bar soaps.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a dairy cow for milk production, to enable him to add more stock of plastic household items for sell so as to meet his customers' needs.

loans.name: Theresia

texts.en:
Theresia is a 30-year-old boutique owner who resides in Mombasa where she sells clothes and the business has been doing well. She is a married mother of three.

Theresia is requesting a loan to purchase more stock of clothes for sell and make more income. This will be her third loan from Visionfund Kenya and she has been paying her previous loans successfully. She will use the anticipated profit from her expanded business to improve her family's living standards by providing the basic needs and also repay the loan. 

In the future, she hopes to expand her business and be successful.

loans.use: To buy more stock of clothes for sell and make more income to improve her family's living standards.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow for milk production and get more milk stock for preparing tea in his hotel and meet his customers' demand.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is a woman with seven children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Emma is 52 years old.

Emma has a business selling charcoal in the Philippines. Emma requested a 11,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

Emma has been in this business for one year. In the future, Emma would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Arnida

texts.en:
Arnida is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Arnida is 48 years old.

Arnida has a buy and sell frozen goods business in the Philippines. Arnida requested a PHP 11000 loan amount through NWTF to buy frozen goods to sell in her business.

Arnida has been in this business for 3 years. In the future, Arnida would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy frozen goods to sell in her business

loans.name: Wesley

texts.en:
Hello lenders, meet Wesley. Wesley is a 26-year-old farmer from Kaplong location in South Rift Kenya. He is a dairy farmer whose main income source is from the milk he sells in the nearby local market . 

Like most businessmen, Wesley's aspiration is to scale his business. For Wesley to grow his business, he needs adequate capital for the expansion. His business being small makes it very hard for him to secure financing from mainstream banks. That is why he is appealing to Kiva lenders to invest in his business in form of a loan. 

He plans to use the loan to buy a dairy cow. An additional dairy cow will provide him with more milk for sale and cushion him from milk shortages during periods when other cows are not on their lactation days.

Increased income from the investment will place Wesley in a better position to meet his family's basic needs.

loans.use: to buy a cow

loans.name: Tseko

texts.en:
Tseko is a married man with four children, all of whom attend school. He lives at a rental house that has electricity but no piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past ten years, he has operated a clothes selling business, selling from door to door to his neighbours and passersby. He faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation. He dreams of expanding and establishing a boutique business in the future. 

With the loan of KES 50,000 that he is requesting, he wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale

loans.name: Sandrina

texts.en:
Sandrina is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Sandrina is 37 years old and three of her children are in school.

Sandrina sells ready-to-wear clothing in the Philippines. She has requested a 18,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy clothes and other item to sell in her stall.

Sandrina has been in this business for 8 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy clothes and other item to sell in her stall

loans.name: Dayana Gabriela

texts.es: Gabriela es una joven que está empezando a luchar por su vida, Gabriela tiene  18 años y se dedica a comercializar confites los fines de semana, Gabriela trabaja de vendedora de zapatos de lunes a viernes, Gabriela necesita el dinero del crédito para  invertirlo en la compra de confites para mejorar su pequeño negocio, Gabriela vive sola ya que comenta que sus padres viven en el campo y que se le dificultaba mucho el transporte para ella estudiar, Gabriela tiene la aspiración de incrementar mercadería en su puesto de confites y en algún momento lograr ponerse una tienda de confites y mas productos, Gabriela tiene un objetivo que es  el de terminar sus estudios asi sea a distancia.
texts.en: Gabriels is a young lady who is starting to earn her own living.  Gabriela is 18 years old and she sells candy on the weekends.  Gabriela works selling shoes Monday through Thursday.  Gabriela needs the money from the loan to buy candy to improve her small business.  Gabriela lives alone, as she tells us that her parents live in the country and transportation to school was very difficult for her.  Gabriela hopes to increase her stock at her candy stand and sometime she hopes to set up a store for candy and other products.  Gabriela's goal is to finish her studies, even if it is long-distance.

loans.use: to buy candy

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
Francisco, de 57 años de edad, está acompañado y vive con su pareja.

Francisco, actualmente se dedica a trabajar la agricultura y a administrar su tienda, la cual le da los ingresos necesarios para poder subsistir.- Además, tiene un molino que genera también ingresos útiles para cubrir sus gastos.

Francisco, se dedica a la agricultura y a la venta en su tienda, desde que regreso de los Estados Unidos de América y con el molino, sirve a toda la comunidad, porque brinda el servicio para que puedan moler los granos para preparar tortillas y otros alimentos. 

El préstamo se usará para comprar productos para su tienda y mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda, porque necesita ampliar más su casa.

Francisco, sueña con construir más cuartos en su casa, porque es muy pequeña.
texts.en:
Francisco is 57, in a relationship, and lives with his partner. 

Francisco currently works in farming and running his store, which gives him the income he needs to get by.  Additionally, he has a mill that also generates helpful income to cover his expenses. 

Francisco has worked in farming and in sales at his store since he returned from the United States, and with the mill he serves his entire community because he provides grinding services so they can grind their grains to make tortillas and other foods. 

He will use this loan to buy products for his store and to make improvements to his home because he needs to make his house bigger. 

Francisco dreams of adding more rooms to his home because it is very small.

loans.use: to buy products for his store and to make improvements to his home.

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius has a retail shop as his major source of income. He is 48 years old, married, and has 5 children aged 18, 16, 14 and 12 years, and five of them attend school at the moment. 

He has applied for a loan of 1,500,000 UGX  (One million five hundred thousand shillings) to buy beverages and daily household use items to sell in the business. 

He started the business in 1994 with high hopes of earning income to look after his family. He also has rentals and does agriculture to supplement his monthly income. 

His business is located in a street in Ishaka town -Bushenyi District and his clients are people around his area. He is a hard working man who works 10 hours a day but is faced with a challenge of high prices and competition from his fellow traders, but at the same time it has encouraged him to work hard. 

He is determined to boost his business after getting the loan and achieve his long term dream of becoming financially stable.

loans.use: To buy beverages and daily household use items to sell in the business

loans.name: Hina

texts.en:
Hina is a 38-year-old woman. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her one son and two daughters are engaged in study. Her husband has been running his own business selling clothes for four years. Her husband is solely responsible to feed the entire family and manage the household. 

Her husband needs to purchase different types of clothes in bulk for reselling purposes, but due to insufficient financial means her husband is unable to purchase these clothes. Therefore, Hina is applying for Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan so that she can assist her husband in purchasing these clothes in bulk for his business. He can also increase the size of his business and earn maximum profit with the help of this loan amount. 

Hina is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase the inventory of her husband's clothing business

loans.name: Nyabitete Twekambe Group

texts.en:
Rovina, the lady with the raised hand in the group photo, is a hardworking, active and confident woman from Nyabiteete village, Bugangari subcounty. She is 28 years old, living with her husband, and two children who have not started going to school. 

Rovina has a coffee plantation farm which she manages, and she also buys dry coffee seeds from other farmers. Her husband owns a retail shop where she also works. 

This being the coffee season, Rovina is facing a challenge of limited capital to invest in buying coffee from farmers, and also improving her farm by buying manure. She decided to form a group called Nyabitete Twekambe Group; she is the leader of the group that acquires loans from Ugafode. 

She has applied for a loan of ugx.700,000 through the group. She hopes this will help her to increase her yield, sales, and profit in the long run. 

The group is grateful for the support rendered by Kiva funders, and promises to work had to continue accessing the funds.

loans.use: To buy coffee

loans.name: Agali Awamu Devt- Masajja Group

texts.en:
Sauda is a repeat client of Ugafode Microfinance Limited having taken previously a loan of 500,000 UGX.  She is a married woman, 42 years old, with  children.

She is a businesswoman keeping and selling birds to increase her working capital and expand her business. She has applied for a loan through the group to buy poultry feeds, however she is faced with challenges of high prices,competition and insufficient capital.

Sauda is very grateful for the support Ugafode Microfinance and Kiva lenders have offered to her since she is now able to fund her business. The group members are appreciative of the role of Kiva lenders in supporting their businesses.

loans.use: to buy food for her birds

loans.name: Saima

texts.en:
Saima is a 29-year-old woman who resides in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is the mother of two children. Her husband owns a printing shop and is the guardian of the family, responsible for fulfilling the needs of all of the family members.

Saima has been running her own beauty salon for the past five years and, like her husband, she also contributes her income to manage the household.

She needs to buy different types of cosmetics like creams, hair brushes, and other accessories for her beauty salon. Due to financial constraints, she is not able to buy these items. Therefore, Saima has applied for a Kiva loan.

This loan will help her to buy the relevant items for her business purposes so that she can provide better services to her customers. It will also help maximize her profitable income to fulfill the needs of her business and family.

Saima is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan for this financial assistance.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics and accessories for her beauty salon business.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
NB: après versification l'agent m'avait dit de changer le prénom a Sitan donc c'est bien le profil de Sitan au lieu de Koutien. 

La dame qui a sa main sur le sac est Sitan sur la photo. Tous ceux qui sont sur la photo sont membres du groupe.  
Sitan  est veuve de 48 ans, vie dans une commune rurale au mali avec  son 01 enfant non scolarisé, elle-même est analphabète. Son enfant est âgé de 20 ans. Sitan espère toujours l’amélioration des conditions de  vie de l’enfant et de la famille  en santé et nourriture suffisante. Son activité est le stockage et à travers cette activité elle parvienne à assurer le bien-être de ses enfants, avec une expérience de 4 ans Sitan  veut acheter plus de céréales. Avant  elle n’avait pas de moyen pour pratiquer cette activité c’est grâce à l’IMF qu’elle se débrouille maintenant.  Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché local et écoules ses produis au même lieu au comptant et à crédit. Elle n’a aucun problème pour pratiquer cette activité. 
Sur la photo, les 4 femmes assisses n'ont pas pris le prét, en plus de trois arrétées, deux femmes a droite et une femme a gauche de la femme au milieu.
texts.en:
Sitan is the woman with her hand on the sack in the photo.  All the women featured in the photo are members of the same group.

Sitan is a 48-year-old widow.  She lives in Mali in a rural commune with her 20-year-old child who did not attend school.  Sitan herself is illiterate.  Sitan always strives to improve her child's and her family's living conditions, in particular regarding health and nutrition.  She makes a living storing grains and, thanks to this activity, she is able to ensure her children's well-being.  Sitanhas four years of experience in her field and she now wants to buy more grains.

In the past, she had no money to run her business.  She now works with the microfinance institution RMCR.  She buys her supplies at the local Grand Market and resells her merchandise at the same market, for cash or on credit.  She runs her business without any difficulty.

The four women seated in the photo are not part of the loan. In addition, three of the women standing are not part of the loan: the two women on the right and one woman to the left of the woman in the center.

loans.use: to buy bags of grains for storage and resale.

loans.name: Emerita

texts.es: Emérita de 47 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y su hijo, ella se dedica al cultivo de maíz y frijol y también a la crianza de pollo de engorde, tiene 6 años de dedicarse a esa actividad, vende sus productos en los diferentes mercados que se encuentran cerca de su casa y con lo que obtiene de sus ventas y con la ayuda de su esposo logran solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, Emérita está solicitando un crédito para la compra de  semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, y mejorar el terreno que muestra la fotografía y así poder continuar con su trabajo ya que esa es su única fuente de ingresos.
texts.en:
Emérita is 47 years old and lives in her own home along with her husband and child. She grows corn and beans, but she also raises chickens for fattening. Emérita has been in business for six years. She sells her products at different markets that are located near her house. With the income she generates from her sales, she is able to help her husband with some of the household expenses.

Emérita is requesting a loan in order to buy seeds, fertilizers, compost, and pest controls in order to improve the land shown in the photograph. As a result, she can continue her work since this is her only source of income.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, compost, and pest controls in order to improve her land.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a single mother of eight children, three of whom go to school. She also takes care of additional family members such as her grandchildren. She has sold charcoal at the market for the last nine years. She has applied for a loan of 2,000,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy bags of charcoal. 

Mary generates additional income through selling tomatoes, green bananas, and onions. She works seven days a week and sells on a retail basis only. Her major business challenges include seasonality. She aspires to build rental rooms. She resides in her own house, and the family has access to electricity but does not have access to piped water. Her monthly expenses include her children's school fees and food for the family.

loans.use: to buy bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Kildare Otayme

texts.es: Don Kildare de 43 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa, el se dedica a la crianza de ganado lechero y compra de  novillas para engorde en repasto que es una actividad que le genera buenas ganancias, se dedica a esta actividad desde hace varios años y comercializa sus productos en los diferentes mercados, el está solicitando nuevamente un crédito para la compra de una vaca de muy buen encaste para seguir con la crianza y poder seguir teniendo mejores ingresos.
texts.en: Kildare is 43 years old and lives in his own home with his wife. He earns a living breeding dairy cattle and buying heifers to fatten up in the pastures which is an activity that earns him a good income. He has been doing this work for several years and he sells his products in different markets. He is asking once again for a loan to buy a cow with good genetics in order to continue breeding and to be able to continue to earn a better income.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter, a married father of seven, describes himself as focused and disciplined. For over five years he has been operating a tailoring business, located in a busy area, where he makes bags and seat covers. Price fluctuations of tailoring materials are his major business challenge. 

His previous loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank repaid, Peter is requesting his second one for Kes 40,000 to buy more materials for making bags. He will use the anticipated profits to improve his life and educate his children.

loans.use: to buy more materials for making bags

loans.name: Corita

texts.en:
Corita is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Corita is 38 years old and has two children who are in school. She has a nipa roofing business in the Philippines. 

Corita has requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy materials needed for her business like bamboo sticks, etc. She has been in this business for 12 years. In the future, Corita would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for her business like bamboo sticks, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Mohamed Musa

texts.en: This is Mohamed. He is married and has two children who are seven and three years old. He has three additional dependents who live with him to assist in the business.  In 1995, Mohamed established his ladies bags and jeans business. He began his business to meet his personal needs and to take great care of his family. His main customers are women. Working 6 days a week and 11 hours a day, he earns about Le 1,150,000 every month from this business. He would like a loan of Le 5,000,000. Mohamed requires a loan in order to buy additional ladies bags and jeans. He hopes that this loan will help to increase his stock and also his profit. The loan will help to achieve some of his future plans. In the future, Mohamed plans to further his education and educate his children. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to pay for ladies bags and jeans to sell

loans.name: Fanta

texts.en:
This is 46-year-old Fanta.  She is married and has four children aged 22, 20, 18 and 16 years. Two of her children attend school.   

In 2010, Fanta established her electrical items (musical set, plasma, fans) business.  Working six days a week and 11 hours a day, she earns about SLL 12,851,000 every month from this business. 

Fanta would like a loan in the amount of SLL 5,000,000. Fanta has already received and successfully repaid four loans, and now requires a new loan in order to purchase dozens of food stuff and baby wear to add to the current business she is doing.  

In the future, Fanta plans to reinvest and improve her business with another product within the town which she want to use the loan for, and improve the standard of living of her family.  

She succeeded in opening another shop. Changes in prices of goods to meet the customers' demand is her main challenge. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase dozens of food stuff and baby wear to add to the current business

loans.name: Sullay

texts.en:
This is 36-year-old Sullay. He is married and has two children, aged 5 and 2 years; both are school-going children. 

In 2007, Sullay established his spare parts business. Working six days a week and 12 hours a day, he earns about 5,641,000 SLL every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of 6,000,000 SLL. Sullay has already received and successfully repaid five loans, and now requires a new loan in order to purchase motor spare parts and other accessories.   

In the future, Sullay plans to provide quality education for his children and improve his business.  

He has built a house and also acquired a garage on his own. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to pay for spare motor parts for his business

loans.name: Sattu Mongo

texts.en: This is 50-year-old Sattu.  She is married and has four children who are 39, 32, 29 and 28 years old. In 2012, Sattu established her rice, oil and maggi business. She began her business because she did not want to put her burden on her children so she decided to do a business.  Working six days a week and 11 hours a day, she earns about Le 1,500,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan of Le 5,000,000 in order to buy more bags of rice, gallons of oil, cartons of maggi, salt etc. for resale.  She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 429,000. In the future, Sattu plans to complete the house she is building and help to educate her school-going children.  She is very hardworking and she thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more rice and other items to sell

loans.name: Marie

texts.en: This is 40-year-old Marie. She is married, and has one child who is 13 years old and goes to school. She has two additional dependents who live with her to be fostered.  In 2001, Marie established her cooking utensils (dishes spoons, plates, bowls, etc.) business.  Working six days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about Le 4,337,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan of Le 5,000,000. Marie has already received and successfully repaid six loans and now requires a new loan in order to buy dozens of bowls, plates, spoons, cartons etc. In the future, Marie plans to open an account for her children and rent a shop.  She was only able to build the house and cannot rent the shop as previously planned.  Sometimes her goods were damaged when she was traveling with them.  She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy and transport new items to sell.

loans.name: Beatrace

texts.en:
Beatrace used her previous loan to finish up her rentals. She is a thirty-nine-year-old hardworking single woman living in Kamwenge, Uganda. She still runs a restaurant as her main source of income alongside rental ownership. She still faces a challenge of scarcity of resources to buy more food for sell. She has hopes of completing her rentals.  

She intends to use the loan to finish up her residential house.

loans.use: to finish up her residential house.

loans.name: Mellen

texts.en:
Mellen is a hardworking, 37-year-old farmer, based in Ekerenyo village, in the Nyamira area of Kenya. She lives with her husband of 25 years and five children on a 1.5-acre farm in the village. She makes a living raising dairy cows and poultry. She also has a borehole where she fetches water for both domestic and agricultural use. 

Mellen is seeking a loan to purchase poultry. With a 20,000 KES loan, she will buy more chickens to add to the twelve she already has. Her dream is to scale up her poultry business and have it as one of her main sources of income. In order to achieve this, she has partnered with other local farmers to form a group so that they can access co-guaranteed loans. Income generated from the poultry farm will enable her to repay the loan on time and she will use the additional amount to meet her family's basic needs and education costs.

loans.use: to purchase poultry.

loans.name: Kanyarukoma Bakyara Tweyambe Group

texts.en:
Doreen is a 41-year-old married woman who has ten children, living in Kyenjojo, Uganda. She operates a shop where she sells secondhand clothes. She also gets a salary as a nurse working in Government Hospital. She has always reaped tangible benefits and she even used these profits to improve her welfare and that of the family. She has a challenge of customers not paying on time. Her business plan is to expand to new areas. Doreen is requesting a loan to buy secondhand clothes to sell.

The extra person in the photo is group member with savings but has not yet reached the level of borrowing. Being a group member, he has guaranteed the others for a loan.

loans.use: to buy secondhand clothes to sell.

loans.name: Noreen

texts.en:
Noreen is a responsible mother of two children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been providing transportation services by driving a taxi for five years. He is responsible to provide for the needs of the entire family. Her husband needs to perform maintenance on his taxi because the current condition of his taxi is not good. It requires more maintenance expenses every day. Due to insufficient financial means, her husband is unable to maintain his taxi. Therefore Noreen has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

With the help of this loan Noreen's husband can afford the maintenance costs easily. He will provide better transportation services to earn a more profitable income. Noreen also plans to save some of the profit of her husband's income to meet her family's needs in the future.

Noreen is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to repair her husband's taxi

loans.name: Sotia

texts.en:
Sotia is 36 years old woman. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her one son and two daughters are engaged in study. Her husband has been running his own business selling clothes for five years. Her husband is solely responsible to feed the entire family and manage the household. 

Sotia's husband needs to purchase different types of clothes in bulk for reselling purposes, but due to insufficient financial means her husband is unable to purchase these clothes. Therefore, Sotia is applying for Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan to assist her husband in purchasing these clothes in bulk for his business. He can also increase the size of his business and earn maximum profit with the help of this loan amount. 

Sotia is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: her husband wanted to increase his cloth business

loans.name: Matia

texts.en:
This is Matia.  Her previous loan was a big help in her business. She was able to buy more vegetables for her grocery business. She has been in this business for years now, and it keeps on growing. She works hard to provide income for her family's everyday expenses.

She would like to apply for another loan, this time for KES 30,000 to purchase more green vegetables, tomatoes, and onions. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

loans.use: to purchase more green vegetables, tomatoes, and onions.

loans.name: Conrad

texts.en:
Conrad is married with two children. His wife is a businesswoman. He buys, packages, and sells hardwood charcoal. At first he used to buy the charcoal already packaged, but he was able to expand his storage area and can now store up to 60,000 kg of charcoal. He buys bags and polyurethane, packages the charcoal, and sells to small businesses in the area. 

He needs this loan to purchase charcoal because he is increasing his number of customers and need to increase the amount of charcoal to meet their demands. His greatest desire is to provide an education for his two children who attend school so that he can guarantee them a prosperous future.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal

loans.name: Yasmeen

texts.en:
Yasmeen is a 30-year-old woman. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her one son and two daughters, who are doing studies. Her husband has been running his own business of selling clothes for seven years. He is the only one responsible to feed the entire family and manage the household. Her husband needs to purchase different types of clothes in bulk for reselling purposes, but due to insufficient financial means he is unable to purchase these clothes. 

Therefore, Yasmeen is applying for a Kiva loan from its field partner, BRAC Pakistan, so that she can assist her husband to purchase these clothes in bulk for his business. He can also increase the size of his business and earn maximum profits with the help of this loan amount.  Yasmeen is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to help her husband increase his clothes business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a material for complete the house

loans.name: Kwibuka Group

texts.fr: Jules a hérité de son père la culture du café dès son jeune âge. Il a actuellement une expérience de 20 ans. Grâce à cette activité, il a pu prendre en charge son intervention chirurgicale l'an dernier et également supporté ses charges familiales. Ce crédit lui permettra de payer la main d'oeuvre pour les travaux de sarclage et de récolte. Sur la photo, il est  accompagné son épouse.
texts.en:
Jules inherited this business from his father at a young age. He now has twenty years' experience. Thanks to this business, he was able to cover the costs of surgery last year, as well as paying the family's bills.
This loan will allow him to pay for labour; in the photo, he is accompanied by his wife.

loans.use: to pay the labour costs of weeding and harvesting.

loans.name: Shalom Self Help Group

texts.en:
Miriam is the name of the lady raising her hand in the photo. She is a member of Shalom Self Help group. She is married and a mother of three.

She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in September 2013. She has benefited from training on enterprise development and financial planning which have assisted in boosting her enterprise.

Miriam runs an enterprise selling clothes and needs a loan to add stock to her business. She trusts this will help her increase her sales and therefore increase her income. She will therefore be able to improve her family’s living standards including providing them with quality education.

Miriam is grateful for the Kiva loan and promises to make the established payments

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes to help meet customers' rising demands.

loans.name: Gladwel

texts.en:
Gladwel is 44 years old and married with one child. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in the year 2013 to benefit from training, especially enterprise development. 

Gladwel practices dairy farming and she is taking out a Kiva loan to purchase dairy feeds to boost milk production and hence earn more income.

She is grateful to Kiva and her lenders.

loans.use: To purchase animal feeds to boost milk production and hence earn more income

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to store palm oil products.

loans.name: Simeon

texts.es: Simeón de 57 años de edad vive en casa propia con su compañera de vida, el se dedica a la crianza de ganado bovino y también a realizar viajes, tiene 29 años de experiencia en ese rubro e inicio con capital propio con lo que obtiene de du trabajo logra salir adelante, el quiere terminar de construir su casa  colocando puertas y ventanas con balcones, pero con lo que obtiene de su trabajo no le alcanza por esa razón solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito para la compra de puertas, balcones, vidrios para ventanas y pago de mano de obra para que el y su compañera de vida puedan vivir mas cómodos y seguros.
texts.en: Simeón is 57 years old and lives in his own home with his partner. He earns a living breeding cattle livestock and he also offers transport. He has 29 years of experience in this work and he started it with his own money. With what he earns from his work he manages to get ahead in life. He wants to finish building his house and install doors and windows with balconies, but with what he earns he cannot afford it and this is the reason why he is asking INTEGRAL for a loan in order to buy the doors, balconies, glass for windows and to pay for labour so that he and his partner can live more comfortably and securely.

loans.use: to buy doors, balconies, glass for windows and to pay for labour.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stock for her kiosk

loans.name: Agiri

texts.en: Agiri lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single and has six children. She also takes care of one additional family member. She operates a grocery in a shop that she rents. She has been in this business for the last 10 years. She works seven days a week. She earns additional income from selling pan cakes and cassava chips. She has requested a loan of 1,400,000 UGX from MCDT–SACCO to buy boxes of soap, sugar, rice, flour, crates of soda, and cooking oil. Her major challenges include seasonality and transportation. Her goal and aspiration is to build a house. She lives in a rented house, and the family has access to piped water and electricity. Her major monthly expenses include rent and food.

loans.use: To buy boxes of soap, sugar, rice, flour, crates of soda, and cooking oil

loans.name: Tuhtahon

texts.en:
Tuhtahon has 33 years of experience. She is living in a village and has two children. For people who have problems with living, the government supports and pays attention on their request. Each person has an opportunity to request a land from the government. The government considers what the land will be used for. 

Tuhtahon is one of those people who stayed in line and requested a land from the government. Now, after some period of time she has it. As she is a widow, she alone has to feed her family. That is why she is planning to buy fertilizers to make the land better for planting corn. She is asking for financial support from Kiva lenders to buy fertilizers. She wants to have a good standard of living and be prosperous. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers.

loans.name: Aleksandre

texts.en:
Aleksandre, is a 47-year-old married man, who lives in a small village named Bashi. He has a wife and two sons. None of the family members has a stable job, as there is high unemployment rate in the region. Aleksandre is a hard worker who supports his beloved wife in making their precious family's living and covering their increasing needs. They get income from a small agricultural activity. In particular, they own two milk cows and produce milk products. Aleksandre sells the products at the local market, which is the only source of income to this four-member family. 

As the existing income is not enough for the family, and Aleksandre can’t find a job, he decided to expand his agribusiness. All the financial institutions rejected his loan requests because of his unstable financial conditions.  After several unsuccessful attempts, he applied for the credit from MFO Credo. His request was approved in the framework of the StartUp program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva, permitting the rural poor to start or re-start businesses. Aleksandre plans to build a greenhouse in his yard and start cultivating vegetables and greens. He will sell the products to local retailers for a good price and will satisfy his family's increased needs.  The StartUp credit will be a great support for the family, as their income will be significantly increased.  He regards Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to set up a greenhouse and expand his business.

loans.name: Allen

texts.en:
Allen, 47, is married and has 4 children aged 22, 18, 16 and 15, and four of them attend school at the moment. 

She is dealing in pineapple growing having started the business in 1999. She started the business to have a source of income to sustain to her family's needs. In addition to pineapple growing, Allen does tea trading, where she gets supplementary income.  She does the tea growing in Kakira, Bitooma, Bushenyi District. 

She has applied for a loan of 1,000,000 UGX (One million shillings only) to buy mulch for the pineapple garden. This will help to boost the yields and sales. 

She is a very hard working and honest woman which has helped her greatly to thrive in the market despite the challenge of price fluctuations. 

However, she hopes to be financially stable and educate all her children for a better future. She appreciates the good job of the kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy mulch

loans.name: Om Marwa Group

texts.en:
Om Marwa is a group from four women who live in Sana'a, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 200,000 YER from AMB.

Living in an old house made Samah, who is the leader of the group, apply for a loan of 50,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase different kinds of paint gallons to renovate the house. The income of Samah is very weak, as is her husband's, so they can't renovate the house. This loan will help her make different ornaments for the house from the inside. The appearance of the house is annoying, but with the new paint it will be stylish and very nice. 

Samah runs a sewing business inside her house. She feels very ashamed if any customer comes to her house. After new paint for the house from this loan, she will receive her customers inside the house happily. The family will live in a healthy environment. All of Samah's dreams are about making a better future for her children.

Samah looks forward to completing the renovation of her house.

loans.use: To purchase different kinds of paint gallons to renovate the house

loans.name: Maa Bhairabi Group-A

texts.en:
Maa Bhairabi Group-A was formed with three members in 2014 in a small village in Odisha. They all came together to help each other and solve the social issues among them, save money and provide financial support to their families. They chose Manini as the leader of their group. The lady standing in the middle in the photo is Manini. She is a 28-year-old woman living with her husband and her two children. For seven years, Manini’s husband has been working as a farmer to manage his small family, but his income is not sufficient to manage the family. So Manini is helping her husband by working with him and being involved in the milk business. She has three years of experience in this business. 

Manini, along with her group, has requested a loan to buy a cow and fodder so that she can increase her family’s income. Manini says that by selling milk, she can support her family and she can send her children to a good school. Through that, she can provide a better education to her son.

loans.use: to purchase a cow and fodder and to make a cow shed.

loans.name: Shamshad

texts.en:
Shamshad is a 45-year-old woman. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her one son and one daughter. Her husband has been running his own business selling clothes for six years. Her husband is solely responsible to feed the entire family and manage the household. 

Her husband needs to purchase different types of clothes in bulk for reselling purpose, but due to insufficient financial means her husband is unable to purchase these clothes. Therefore, Shamshad is applying for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan to assist her husband in purchasing these clothes in bulk for his business. He can also increase the size of his business and earn maximum profit with the help of this loan amount. 

Shamshad is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: her husband wanted to increase his clothing business

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives at her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past five years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of transportation in her business. With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to cover the cost of attending Spire Education's six-week career accelerator programme.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to cover the cost of attending Spire Education's six-week career accelerator programme.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to cover the cost of attending Spire Education's six-week career accelerator programme.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to store palm oil products.

loans.name: Essohanam

texts.fr: Agée de 32 ans, Essohanam est une femme mariée et mère de deux enfants. Pour exercer ses activités, Essohanam vit à Doumassesse et vend du riz et de l’huile dans son quartier pour ainsi gagner son revenu. Essohanam s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché local. Pour commander des sacs de riz et des bidons d'huile, Essohanam demande ce crédit pour réaliser son achat et trouver le gain nécessaire pour aider son mari à soutenir les charges de la famille.
texts.en: Essohanam is 32 years old, married, and the mother of two children.  She lives and works in Doumassesse and sells rice and oil in her neighborhood, as a way to get an income.  She stocks up twice a month at the local market.  She is taking this loan to order some bags of rice and cans of oil and to make enough money to help her husband take care of the family's expenses.

loans.use: to buy three bags of rice and three cans of oil.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to cover the cost of attending Spire Education's six-week career accelerator programme.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase spices/vegetables.

loans.name: Ernestina

texts.es:
La socia Ernestina pertenece al banco comunal  CHASKA ÑAHUI,la socia continua  dedicándose a su negocio de agencia de viajes, la socia se siente agradecida con el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota, la socia continua vendiendo boletos y tours para los distintos tours que le solicitan, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de  esta manera  sacar  adelante a su familia.
 La socia solicita el crédito para comprar boletos turísticos.
texts.en:
Ernestina is a member of the Communal Bank "Chaska Ñahui". She continues to manage her travel agency. Ernestina is grateful for the loan that has been issued and promises to complete her payments. She continues to sell tickets for specific tours that are requested. Ernestina wants to keep working so that her family can get ahead.

She is requesting a loan in order to buy tour tickets.

loans.use: to buy tour tickets to sell.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is a married man. He has two children and he describes himself as a passionate person. He operates a butchery business. He has been in this business for four years. The business is located in a busy and promising place. His business challenge is inadequate working capital. 

He will use the loan of KES 40,000 to buy more stock of meat. He hopes that in the future, he will be a successful supplier of meat. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. His previous loan was repaid successfully. He will use the anticipated profits to invest and improve his standard of living.

loans.use: to buy more stock of meat.

loans.name: Gie

texts.en:
Gie is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 40 years old and has three children who are in school. She has a food vending business in the Philippines. 

Gie has requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business. She has been in this business for five years. In the future, Gie would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Nahum

texts.en:
Nahum is a smallholder farmer based in Kabirer village in Nandi Hills, Kenya. She owns a 4-acre piece of land that she uses to grow tea and to keep three dairy animals. She has also planted 100 trees on it for aesthetic appearance and environmental health. Not only does the land provide her with capital for her business, but also a home for her family. She is blessed to have three children with a husband to whom she has stayed married for 35 years! 

Nahum is seeking a loan to purchase cereals. The cereals she is seeking serve to replenish stock for food and business. The demand for cereals in the Nandi Hills market, only a few kilometers from Nahum’s home, is up. Farmers in the area are rushing to grow more cereal crops. By placing herself in a position of supplying cereal seeds and still being a cereal farmer, she gets to enjoy profits from selling inputs and crop harvests. She is very pragmatic and considers herself more hardworking than others. Your loan will directly elevate Nahum’s livelihood. She strives to give her children a better life than the tough upbringing she had.

loans.use: to purchase cereal seeds.

loans.name: Ruzanna

texts.en:
Ruzanna is a divorced woman with two children from Kapan town. Her son (15-years-old) and daughter (10-years-old) attend the local school. To be able to sustain her family's living, Ruzanna has been selling clothing from her house for 10 years already. She also works as a waiter in a local restaurant. 

The requested loan will be very helpful for Ruzanna to purchase a new stock of clothing supplies for the spring and summer seasons. She currently receives many new orders from her customers, but because of lack of funds, is not able to meet those needs. Her loan has been approved within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. This program provides business start-up loans to informal businesses that do not qualify through normal channels.

loans.use: to pay for a new stock of clothing supplies for the spring and summer seasons.

loans.name: Nazia

texts.en:
Nazia is a 36-year-old woman and the mother of four children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been running a milk shop and is solely responsible for feeding the entire family and managing the household.

Nazia's husband needs to purchase milk and other items for his business purpose so that he can increase the size of his business, improve his sales growth, and earn maximum profits. But due to his unfavorable financial position, her husband is not in condition to purchase milk for his business purpose.

Therefore Nazia has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan so that she can help her husband to purchase the milk for his business purpose. She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to enable her husband to purchase milk to sell through his business

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is 55 years old and married. She works very hard to provide for her family.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy to buy items to sell in her general store, like canned goods, shampoo, home care products, and other groceries.

Emma has been in this business for 20 years now. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her general store, like canned goods, shampoo, home care products, and other groceries

loans.name: Maguli

texts.en:
Maguli is a 65-year-old married woman, from the village of Banoja. She has a husband, son, daughter and son-in-law. In spite of her high education Maguli was unable to have a stable job. Two family members are private artisans and earn approximately 400 GEL, which is the main source of income for family. Maguli developed her own agribusiness and is engaged in cattle breeding, beekeeping and viticulture. She sells agricultural products at the local market.

In order to increase her support to the family's welfare and have an additional source of income, Maguli decided to open an auto service. She requested a loan to local financial institutions and was approved within the joint initiative between Kiva and Credo, that enables people to start or re-start their own businesses. Maguli plans to purchase a special device of vehicle diagnostic and will open the service. Her husband will control the business and will get the chance to make significant income. Their customers will be mostly locals.

The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva startup loan, will significantly increase the family's income. Their income will be doubled, and the family members will be able to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a vehicle diagnostic device and open an auto service.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to make the second floor of her house livable by putting in a toilet and a tile floor, and in this way, improve the condition of her home.

loans.name: Azimahon

texts.en: This is Azimahon's 49th loan. She was born to a family of workers in 1957. She lives in a village. She is married and has four children. For almost 40 years she has done a business of trading men’s shoes. She is well known among clients and does her duty very well. She tries to buy a new collection of shoes according to each season. She plans to attract more clients and buy new shoes. Azimahon requested financial support from KIVA lenders to buy a new collection of shoes. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To buy a new collection of shoes

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en:
Hello Kiva lenders meet Juliana. With the little time Juliana has, she sells crops from her small farm and also keeps dairy cows and poultry. From Kiva lenders, Juliana is seeking a loan worth 20,000 KES to grow her horticulture business. Horticultural produce and processed products from the developing world are becoming increasingly popular in international markets, evident by the steadily rising exports. While experience shows that horticulture offers good opportunities for poverty reduction, because it increases employment and generates income, the government takes little care to ensure that small and poor farmers are not excluded from the opportunities in this market sector.

It is against this backdrop that Juhudi has teamed up with Kiva to give Juliana access to a loan facility that will aid her to grow her horticulture farm into a highly profitable business, increase employment opportunities, and bring about increasing commercialization of the rural sector. With your loan, Juliana’s family will benefit from the growth and diversification of their family business. This will not only increase their income, but also reduce their income vulnerability.

loans.use: To grow her horticulture business

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy rams to fatten and sell at a profit.

loans.name: Norah

texts.en:
Hello, wonderful lenders! Meet Norah, a 30-year-old, energetic, self-driven and hard-working small-scale farmer who is based in Belgut, a remote village in the Kericho area of Kenya. She is a proud mother and through hard work she has raised her family whom she refers to as “my pride.” She has been actively involved in mixed farming for the past 5 years and has never looked back. Her primary income sources have been egg-selling and crop-selling. Norah also engages in small personal business or, as she likes to put it, “side hustle” to make ends meet. Norah passionately loves poultry farming and wakes up early every morning to feed her poultry and collect eggs. Demand for eggs and poultry meat has been overwhelming and she has been unable to satisfy the demand. So, she is seeking a loan to buy additional poultry.

When asked what is the biggest challenge she faces, Norah replied, “being unable to access funds.” Women have a bigger challenge accessing financial solutions, but Norah feels relieved that there are partners such as Kiva lenders who assist aspiring women to achieve their goals. Through your loan she will be able to buy good breeds of poultry that have high productivity and high resistance to diseases. Increased productivity will immediately translate to more income and improved living standards. Her crops will benefit from poultry manure, which has a high amount of nitrogen as compared to any other livestock manure. Norah will save more money by not having to buy fertilizer. The extra income will be used to repay the loan and secure the future of her family since she is the breadwinner.

loans.use: To pay for poultry

loans.name: Artur

texts.en:
Artur, father of two, lives with his family in Yeghvard town. Three years ago, Artur started providing construction service for locals in town. He is specialized in interior design and construction and receives many orders during the month.

To be able to purchase a rotary hammer drill and drill needed for his construction work, Artur has applied for this loan. His loan has been approved within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. This program provides business start-up loans to informal businesses that do not qualify through normal channels.

loans.use: to pay for a rotary hammer drill and drill needed for his construction work.

loans.name: Elizamer

texts.en:
Thirty years ago Elizamer started farming on a small inherited piece of land in Koilot, a remote village in the Nandi Hills area of Kenya. Today, this humble mother of four children sells milk, eggs and a variety of crops. She is a passionate farmer and, because of her immense knowledge of farming, she commands a lot of respect from other farmers in her village.

Taking care of her poultry is an activity that she finds very enjoyable, and feeding her poultry is her hobby. Poultry farming is a very profitable business venture in the Nandi Hills area. Elizamer has good knowledge of the market and has been taking advantage of the ready market--the demand is very high. Being a visionary woman, she has always wanted to increase her poultry flock, so now she is seeking a loan to buy additional poultry.

Accessing financial services for women is very difficult, but through institutions such as Kiva, enterprising women like Elizamer can achieve their dreams and goals.

Elizamer believes that the key to increased egg production is proper feeding and good care. By ensuring that the poultry are fed well, she is guaranteed to reap the benefits. In addition to selling eggs and poultry, she will also sell poultry feathers that are commonly used to make earrings.

The increased income will be used to improve her living conditions and to repay the loan.

loans.use: to buy poultry.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a blender, a juicer and fruit at wholesale.

loans.name: Jean Bosco

texts.en: Jean Bosco is turning into one of Rwanda's best and most impactful rice processors. Over the past year he has grown from running his business at 30% capacity to 60% capacity. He has increased his paddy rice suppliers from 10 cooperatives to 17 cooperatives. And, by providing agronomists to work directly with these cooperatives, he has seen the average yield per farm double. Check out this video to hear directly from Jean Bosco and see his factory. Jean Bosco is a four time borrower with AEC, starting with a $10,000 loan and increasing to $25,000 with each successful repayment. Now, Jean Bosco is looking for $50,000 so that he can buy more paddy rice inputs to run his factory at full capacity. We are fully confident that he will repay this loan on time, like all of the previous ones. Jean Bosco is so certain that he will repay the loan on time, that he has already submitted a check dated October 1, 2015. In Rwanda, bouncing a check is punishable by prison time, that's how confident Jean Bosco is. We are so pleased to continue to support Jean Bosco as he continues to grow his business, and we are so thankful for any support of this loan. He truly is pushing forward one step at a time and his business is thriving.

loans.use: To work with 17 farming cooperatives to process long-grain rice during the January harvest

loans.name: Gegham

texts.en:
Gegham is a constructor and father of two children. He has been providing interior construction services to local people for three years. This is the only source of income which helps Gegham to sustain his family's living.

Lack of needed tools and equipment are an obstacle and challenge for Gegham and his work. He has now applied for this loan to purchase a rotary hammer drill, a welding machine and other tools for construction work.

His loan has been approved within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. This program provides business start-up loans to informal businesses that do not qualify through normal channels.

loans.use: to pay for a rotary hammer drill, a welding machine and other tools for construction work.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en: Joyce is a hardworking mother who lives in Yemit in the north rift region of Kenya. She is a hardened crop farmer who is struggling with farm related expenses. She has been doing this work for 15 years. Joyce noted that the crop's performance is heavily reliant on external factors such as weather. For this reason, farmers usually realize they have lost a great percentage of their crops during harvest. To make the investment worthwhile, a farmer has to make up for the foreseeable crop losses by working on a significant area of land. Joyce is seeking a loan of KES 30,000 that will enable her to buy seedlings and fertilizers to grow more crops in the coming season. She believes this loan will increase food security in her home.

loans.use: To buy seedlings and fertilizer to increase her crop cultivation

loans.name: Skender

texts.en: Skender is 53 years old, married and a father of two children. He is the main source of income for his family and is involved in agriculture, together with his wife. They plant peppers to sell in the market for income and enjoy their work. For the first time, Skender is requesting a loan in order to purchase guano and to pay for others to work on his land. This loan will help him to be able to increase his profit and offer his children better living conditions and health. He is hoping that in the future he will be able to have his own small farm, but for the moment, his financial situation will not allow this. His more immediate goal is to add more vegetables to his land, to sell and increase his income. He promises to pay on time and wants to thank all of the lenders for their support.

loans.use: to purchase guano and to pay for others to work on his land

loans.name: Fakete

texts.en: Fakete is 44 years old and a mother of four children. Her husband has paralysis and is an invalid, unable to work or contribute to the family. She has to work hard in order to support her family and is involved in agriculture as her way to be able to provide. She keeps a cow and plants corn so that she can sell the products to others and use them for her own family needs. Currently, she has one cow and is requesting a loan for the first time so that she can purchase another to increase the supply she has to sell the milk and dairy products. She is a very hardworking woman who wants to offer her children a better life and living conditions and hopes that this loan will help her increase her income, making her goals more of a reality. She is very grateful for the opportunity and wants to thank all of the lenders for their support.

loans.use: to purchase another milk cow to increase the supply she has to sell the milk and dairy products

loans.name: Johana Guadalupe

texts.es:
Johana, de 19 años de edad, está acompañada y su pareja es mecánico de profesión y trabaja en un pueblo cercano y tiene un niño de 1 año de edad. 
 
Johana, se dedica a la venta de ropa y enchape y es para eso que necesita el préstamo, todo con el fin de aumentar su inversión y mejorar sus ingresos. 

Ella necesita el crédito para comprar más ropa y más enchape para la venta, ya que actualmente su inventario es muy reducido. 

Ella sueña en el futuro que su pareja tenga su propio taller y ella sueña con tener un puesto de venta de ropa, para mejorar sus ingresos y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Johana, 19, lives with her partner, who is a mechanic by profession and works in a nearby town, and has a one-year-old baby.

Johana sells clothing and costume jewelry, so she needs the loan in order to increase her investment and improve her income.

She needs the loan to purchase more clothing and costume jewelry to sell, as currently her inventory is very low.

Her dream for the future is that her partner may have his own shop, and she dreams of having a little clothing shop, in order to improve their income and quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase more clothing and costume jewelry.

loans.name: Titus

texts.en:
Titus is 27 years old. He is married and blessed with two children. 

He transports customers via his motorcycle, a business he has done for the last 13 years. 

He has requested for a loan which he will be using to purchase a motorcycle and hopes this will help him to pay school fees for his children.

His hopes and dreams for the future are to have a prosperous business and better the life of his family.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle to help him to pay school fees for his children

loans.name: Teopista

texts.en: Teopista is married with six children, three of whom go to school. She also takes care of additional family members (grandchildren). She sells local brew from home. She has been in this business for the last 12 years. She has applied for a loan of 1,000,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy crates of beer and jerrycans of local gin and other spirits. She generates additional income through poultry farming and from rental rooms. She works from home seven days a week and sells to all categories of people, but on a retail basis. Her major business challenges include transportation of her merchandise from the village to her home and defaulters. She is aspiring on owning a fully stocked pub. She resides in the family house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: to buy crates of beer and jerrycans of local gin and other spirits.

loans.name: Armen

texts.en:
Armen lives in Nor Kharberd village with his elderly retired parents, wife and two kids.

Armen is a 49 years old hairdresser. He has been involved in this service for ten years and is well known among people living in the region. Armen owns a small space which he uses as a beauty salon. He is the only hairdresser there, so he has to work hard to manage to serve all clients coming to the salon. 
Realizing that the gathered professional skills and experience allow him to enlarge his business, Armen has applied for this loan. He asks lenders to support him to  pay for renovation of the salon and purchase tools for providing hairdressing services (hair dryer, accessories, paints).

His loan has been approved within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. This program provides business start-up loans to informal businesses that do not qualify through normal channels. 

Armen hopes for lenders' support to his small but perspective business.

loans.use: to pay for renovation of the salon and purchase tools for providing hairdressing services (hair dryer, accessories, paints)

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es:
Vilma, de 42 años de edad, creció con su madre, está casada y tiene dos hijos y una hija, son una familia muy unida que juntos trabajan para salir adelante y satisfacer las necesidades de su hogar.

Vilma, se dedica a administrar su propia panadería, con ayuda de su esposo y sus hijos, ella y su esposo son los encargados de elaborar el pan y sus hijos se encargar de la distribución en las comunidades de su cantón; de esta manera todos trabajan para cumplir con sus compromisos.

El dinero será utilizado para comprar latas y moldes para hacer pan y también se reparará una motocicleta, la cual es usada por su hijo para la distribución del pan.

Las proyecciones que Vilma, tiene para un futuro son las de establecer una cafetería, para que la administre su hija y también desea comprar un vehículo, para la distribución de pan por diferentes cantones y municipios.
texts.en:
Vilma, age 42, grew up with her mother, and she is married, with two sons and a daughter.  They are a very united family, who work together to get ahead and provide for their household needs.

Vilma runs her own bakery with the help of her husband and children; she and her husband are in charge of making the bread and her children are in charge of distributing it in the communities in their canton.  In this way, everyone works to fulfill their commitments.

The money will be used to purchase bread-making pans and molds, and to repair a motorcycle that is used by her son for the distribution of the bread.

Vilma’s plans for the future are to establish a café for her daughter to run; and she also wants to purchase a vehicle in order to distribute bread throughout different cantons and municipalities.

loans.use: to purchase bread-making pans and molds, and to repair a motorcycle that is used by her son for the distribution of the bread.

loans.name: Yehowa Dzi Group

texts.en:
These ladies are part of the group called Yehowa Dzi who are into the trade of underwear, ladies and gents tops, grocery, fry yam and chicken, kids wear and charcoal. They have been in the loan business with ID-Ghana for some time now and are very hardworking and extremely competent in their very trade.

Monica is the group representative and she is taking a loan from Kiva for the first time. She has been very instrumental in the creation of the group. She is in her forth loan cycle with ID-Ghana and standing second from the right in the photograph. She has been selling underwear, ladies and gents tops for four years. She is now 28 years married with two children and they are all living together in a hiring apartment. Together with her colleagues, they will need GHS 4000 to expand their businesses and Monica will use her share of the loan to buy more underwear, ladies and gents tops to sell to customers. They will hold each other responsible for the repayment of the loan.

loans.use: To buy more underwear, ladies and gents tops to sell to customers.

loans.name: God Is Able Group

texts.en:
This group is composed of six people, who all live in the same neighborhood. They are selling smoked fish, shea-butter, spices, palm and cooking oil and cooking items.

The group’s representative, Diana (standing third from left in the photograph), is 43 years old; she did not go to school much. Diana lives with her husband and children, all of whom go to school. Diana takes care of the household’s varied expenses and supports her husband to take care of the children. To support her family, she has been selling spices, palm and cooking oil in her region for 12 years. Diana gets her supplies from a market in Accra. To strengthen her business and meet her clients' demands, Diana, together with her group, is requesting financial support from ID-Ghana for the eighth time. They will hold each other accountable for the repayment of the loan.

Diana needs this loan to buy more spices, palm and cooking oil to sell to her customers.

loans.use: To buy more spices, palm and cooking oil to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 44-year-old married father of three children. He works hard in a cars' spare parts company, selling since 2005 to provide his family with a better living. Ahmad is a hard worker, but unfortunately his limited income isn't enough to cover his family's increasing needs. Thus, for this reason, he is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to pay for his children's school tuition fees.

This is Ahmad's forth loan cycle at Al Majmoua; his previous loans were invested in developing his family's living, with a good standing payback history. He hopes that in the future he can develop his own business and provide his children with the necessary education to start their own career paths.

loans.use: to pay for his children's school tuition fees.

loans.name: Maria Eva

texts.es: Maria de 57 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus tres hijos, ella se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y frijol, tiene 20 años de experiencia en la actividad, comercializa sus productos en los diferentes mercados que están cerca de su casa y ya tiene muchos clientes fijos pro los buenos precios, ella esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de pesticidas, herbicidas, controles de plagas, semillas, etc. preparación del terreno donde sea hacer sus siembra y así poder tener buenas cosechas para tener mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
María, 57, lives in her own house with her husband and her three children.  She works in agriculture, growing corn and beans.  She has 20 years’ experience in this occupation, selling her produce in different markets near her house, and she now has many regular customers because of her good prices.

She is requesting a loan for the purchase of pesticide, herbicide, pest control, seed, etc., and to prepare the land wherever she plants her crops. In this way she will be able to have a good harvest in order to have better earnings.

loans.use: to purchase pesticide, herbicide, pest control, seed, etc.

loans.name: Bernadeth

texts.en:
Bernadeth has mastered her hog-raising business in Sindangan. This is how she makes a living and is able to provide for her family, in addition to her husband. She was at her weakest point when she didn't have enough capital for her business. When she joined PMPC, she was truly grateful to use the credit to fully support her business. 

Just as how she takes care of her hog-raising business, she also does so with her membership with PMPC. She wants to maintain her membership in good standing so she can always turn to PMPC for any financing needs. Now, the loan of Php 7,000 will help her with purchasing bags of hog finisher feeds. She deeply wishes to live a better life with her family.

loans.use: to purchase bags of hog finisher feeds

loans.name: Jonalyn

texts.en:
Jonalyn is 38 years old, married, and blessed with three children. She lives in Solano, Nueva Vizcaya. 

One of her children is Exequiel, who is in college pursuing a BS degree in Agricultural Biotechnology. He chose this course because he believes that he can serve his country this way while being able to help his family.

However, Jonalyn cannot afford Exequiel's schooling, so she is seeking financial assistance from Kiva lenders with a PHP 200,000 loan. She is hopeful that lenders will approve her loan so she can continue to send his to school.

loans.use: to pay her son's tuition fee.

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Letecia is 27 years old, all of her children are in school.

Letecia has a buy and sell ready to wear business in the Philippines. She requested a loan of 13,000 PHP through NWTF to buy items to sell like t-shirts, dresses, etc.

Letecia has been in this business for 8 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like t-shirts, dresses, etc.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
Francisco, de 67 años de edad, es agricultor, está casado y tiene 7 hijos.
Francisco, es un campesino muy reconocido en la zona, por su dedicación en el sector agrícola y por hacer pan en horno artesanal, fabricado a base de tierra especial llama “barro”. 

Francisco, necesita el préstamo para reparar su horno artesanal y construir un techo para cubrir el horno, porque se acerca el invierno y se va a dañar más. 

El desea enseñarle a su nieto y a sus hijos, todo el proceso de la elaboración del pan en horno artesanal, para que se mantenga el patrimonio familiar y todo el esfuerzo hecho, quede como legado de un campesino salvadoreño laborioso, que tras el sol intenso lucha día a día para salir adelante.
texts.en:
Francisco, age 67, is a farmer.  He is married and has seven children.  He is a countryman who is very well-known in the area for his devotion to farming and for making bread in a homemade oven.  The oven is made from a base of special earth called “barro”.

Francisco needs the loan to repair his homemade oven and to build a roof to cover the oven.  This is because winter is coming, which will damage it more.

He wants to teach his grandson and his children all about the process of making bread in the homemade oven so that the family heritage can be preserved.  All of the effort he has made will remain as a legacy from a hard-working Salvadorian man from the country.  He struggles under the intense sun day to day in order to get ahead.

loans.use: to repair his homemade oven and to build a roof to cover the oven.

loans.name: Seval

texts.en:
Seval is married and has three children. She  sells kitchenware at the city and provincial markets. She helps her husband and contributes to the family income. She says the markets are a difficult workplace and wants to provide her children with a good future. She says they will need to work to be able to stand on their own feet. This is her third loan from Maya; she will buy kitchenware (plastic and glass crisper, plates, pots and pans, tableware) to sell. Seval wants to open a shop.

Translated from Turkish by Maya Staff

Seval Hanım evli ve 3 çocuk annesi.  Semt ve ilçe pazarlarında mutfak ürünleri satıyor. Seval Hanım hem eşine destek oluyor hem de aile bütçesine katkı sağlıyor. Pazarcılığın zor bir iş alanı olduğunu söyleyen Seval Hanım çocuklarına iyi bir gelecek sağlayabilmek ve kendi ayakları üzerinde durabilmek için çalışmasının gerektiğini de söylüyor. MAYA’dan 3’üncü kredisi ile satmak için mutfak eşyası, yani plastik ve cam kaplar, tabak, tencere, tava, çatal bıçak alacak. Seval hanım dükkân açmak istiyor.

loans.use: to buy kitchenware (plastic and glass crisper, plates, pots and pans) to sell

loans.name: Pheap

texts.en:
Originally from a rural village of the Kos Krolo district of Battambang province, Pheap is a 44-year-old married mother of three children who are dependent. Rice farming and corn planting have been the main source of her family’s income for two years. 

Pheap has been with VisionFund for two cycles already. Now she is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and rice seeds for her farmland, and to use a portion of it to pay for labor. 

With this loan, she hopes to grow her rice fruitfully and healthily, and also hopes to make more income to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and rice seeds for her farmland

loans.name: Nyonmo Group

texts.en:
These three women comprise Nyonmo bei Group and they sell ready-made school bags, perfume, paragon, air refreshers, pegs and food joint. 
Emelia, who is in her mid 20s, is single with one child. She has been selling ready-made school bags and perfume for four years now. She works from 8 am to 5 pm, walking from door-to-door every day and she is able to make a fair monthly profit. This will be Emelia's third loan from ID Ghana, which she wants to use to buy ready-made school bags and perfume to sell to customers. Emelia will share this loan with her colleagues who will hold each other accountable for repaying the loan. The entire group will need a total of GHS 2,900 to invest into their businesses.

loans.use: to buy ready-made school bags and perfume to sell to customers.

loans.name: Grelyn

texts.en:
Grelyn is 36 years old, with 2 children and a hardworking entrepreneur.
She does not mind the difficult work as long it would earn her an extra income. She experienced working as a passenger bus inspector, where she hops from one bus to another for 12 hours a day while earning only a below-minimum wage salary. To earn more, she took consigned household products such as shampoo and laundry soap from a friend and sells in her neighborhood.

As her customers grew, Grelyn decided to resign from her job and go full time with her business buying from manufacturer. Grelyn is now able to cover other localities near her. Today, she is requesting for a PhP 30,000 loan to buy 10 boxes each of shampoo, bar laundry soap, powder laundry soap and fabric conditioner to meet the demands of her customers now in other nearby cities.

Grelyn says that seeing her business and income grow is proof that her hard work is paying off. She however says that she can only rest when she sees all her four children finish their education.

loans.use: To buy 10 boxes of shampoo, 10 boxes of bar laundry soap, 10 boxes powder laundry soap and fabric conditioners to fill the orders of customers

loans.name: Asia

texts.en:
Asia is a responsible mother of four children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been providing transport facilities to people for 25 years. He is responsible for fulfilling the needs of the entire family. 

Her husband needs to make more and that is why he needs to increase the transport business. Due to insufficient financial means, he is unable to make increases in the transport business. Therefore Asia has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

With the help of this loan, Asia's husband can increase his business easily. This will mean he can provide better transport facilities to earn a profitable income. Asia also plans to make savings with the profit from her husband's income to meet her family's needs in future.

Asia is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her husband's transport business.

loans.name: Suriya

texts.en:
Suriya is a 48-year-old married woman and a mother of 7 children.
