She has been stitching clothes for 5 years. She stitches to meet the expenses of her family. However, due to a lack of availability of resources she is unable to provide stitching facilities to more customers.

For this reason, she requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to Kashf Foundation to buy more spools of threads in different colors with packs of laces, zippers and buttons to create a means of increasing revenues. In this way she will be able to generate a healthier source of income for her family. Her dream is to provide quality education to her children.

loans.use: to buy more spools of threads in different colors with packs of laces, zippers and buttons to create a means of increasing revenues

loans.name: Sea

texts.en:
Residing in a rural village of the Kos krolo district of Battambang province, Sea is aged 29 years and married. She has three dependent children; two are in school while another one is too young for school. To support the family, she and her husband have been growing corn for four years. The current business earns her family about 20,000KHR per day to meet her family’s needs. 

Sea has been a member of Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, for two cycles already. She successfully used the past loans to better support her family to have sufficient food and for her children’s education. 

Now she is seeking for a loan to buy fertilizer for her farmland. With this loan, she hopes to increase her current business to earn a larger income to improve her family’s living condition and keep their children in school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farmland

loans.name: Alaa

texts.en:
Alaa is a 30-year-old single man from Jabalia city. He lives with his family in a small house. Alaa works as an employee in the public sector, where he gets a low income. He wants to improve the family's living conditions, and buy all the needed stuff.

Alaa took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new solar system for heating water. By taking this loan, Alaa will be able to provide hot water for the house without using electricity, and also clean water.

Alaa appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a new solar system for heating water.

loans.name: Vusal

texts.en:
Vusal is a tractor driver. He is single and is 31 years old. He is living in Absheron region with his parents, who have been IDP (Internally Displaced Persons) from Cabrail city for 22 years already.

Today he needs help. His tractor is broken and he can’t work. Today he needs 1,200 AZN to repair his tractor. Vusal is sure that if his tractor can be repaired, his monthly income will be increased so he can help his parents and their quality of life will be better.

Vusal is thankful to Komak and Kiva for the aid. In the future he wants to get married and have a lovely family.

loans.use: to repair tractor and increase business

loans.name: Tuichiboi

texts.en:
Tuichiboi is a hardworking man. Born in 1983, he lives in a rural area. Tuichiboi is married and has four children. He is a responsible, bright, honest and goal-oriented businessman. He is an agrarian person and plants wheat, cereals and potatoes in his yard. His wife supports him and helps to plant and grow the crops. 

Tuichiboi is also busy keeping livestock and selling them at the animal market. Each honored cattle brings 450-500 TJS profit. Tuichiboi decided to improve his business and wants to buy forage for the cattle. He considers that if he would feed the animals until they are grown up, he can sell them in the market at a higher price. Tuichiboi has requested a loan of 4,000 TJS to buy forage for the livestock. He awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy forage

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
Elizabeth pertenece al banco comunal “Patron de San Sebastian” .
La socia continua  vendiendo diferentes tipos de productos como jaboncillos, pasadores, cremas, cuerdas, lana y otras cosas más, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para  de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicito el crédito para la compra de jaboncillos entre otros.
La socia se siente agradecida por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Elizabeth belongs to the “Patron de San Sebastian” communal bank.  She continues selling various types of products such as small bars of soap, hair clips, creams, strings, wool, and other things.  The member has been in her business a good amount of time, and it is going well for her thanks to the effort that she puts into her business every day.

She wishes to be able to continue working in this way in order to continue supporting her family.

She is requesting the loan in order to buy bars of soap, among other items.

She is grateful for the loan, and she pledges to make her payments.

loans.use: to buy bars of soap, among other items.

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en:
Harriet is single and has four children, two of whom go to school. She has no additional family members. She operates a restaurant at the market on a retail basis. She has been in this business for eight years. She works seven days a week. She gets additional income from selling piped water and also sweeping roads. She has applied for a loan of UGX 800,000 from MCDT SACCO to buy green bananas, rice, flour, cooking oil, cabbages, and beef. Her major business challenges include transportation and seasonality of food prices. She aspires to buy a fridge to start selling cold drinks.

She resides in a rented house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: to buy green bananas, rice, flour, cooking oil, and cabbages

loans.name: Zeinab

texts.en:
Zeinab is a 23-year-old Lebanese married woman living with her husband and only child.

Two years ago, after being through difficult circumstances, she started to work at her house as a beautician. The photo here shows Zeinab while working with one of her customer. She is a skilled woman always pleasing her customers. Now, Zeinab says that she requires more tools and equipment which she will acquire with the youth loan requested from Kiva's partner Vitas s.a.l.

Zeinab is eager to receive the funds, hoping that it will help her improve her business as well as her way of living.

loans.use: to acquire more tools and equipment for her beautician business.

loans.name: Rodel

texts.en:
Rodel is a fisherman from Carles, Iloilo. He is 33 years old and has five children. Rodel has been in the fishing business for more than two years now. This is the source of his income.

Rodel is asking to take a loan to buy a new boat engine, lead weights, and floaters. A loan will help Rodel in improving his fishing business as well as his income. He dreams of expanding his fishing venture and making it a success. He also wants to save money for the schooling of his children.

loans.use: to buy a new boat engine, boat engine, lead weights, and floaters

loans.name: Brenda

texts.en: Brenda is a 53-year-old married woman and the mother of four grown up children, from Carles, Iloilo. She and her husband have been engaged in the fishing business for more than 20 years now. This is their main source of income. Brenda is asking for a loan to buy a new boat engine, fishing nets, lead weights, outriggers and others. This loan will enable them to improve their fishing business as well as their income.

loans.use: to buy a new boat engine, fishing nets, lead weights, outriggers and others.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is 62 years old widowed with five children. She works very hard to provide for her family.

Myrna runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more merchandise to sell, like shampoo, canned goods, noodles, sugar, etc.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her business.

Myrna has been in this business for 42 years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more mercandise to sell, like shampoo, canned goods, noodles, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is 63 years old and married with two children. She works hard to provide for her family. She has run a general store in the Philippines for three years and ears additional income from abaca weaving.

Gloria has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock for her store. She has already borrowed and repaid five loans from NWTF. She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is married and she works hard to support her family. She earns a living by selling livestock in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from her work in the general store. Vilma is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy additional livestock to sell.

Vilma has been sustaining her business activities through her past 10 loans from NWTF and, more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional livestock to sell.

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en: Many people have chicken farms in Kenya, but few start a business out of it. Jackline is a small landholder and mixed farmer based in Nyabite village. She is the mother of four and has practiced mixed farming for fourteen years. To earn a decent living, she sells milk, poultry, and tea and engages in numerous small personal businesses. Recently, she started seeing how she could make money out of poultry farming. Raising hens to Jackline is something close to a hobby. She wants to sell eggs but figures it won't make economic sense unless she buys more poultry. However, her biggest challenge today is limited funds to expand. Jackline is seeking a loan from Kiva lenders via Juhudi Kilimo to buy hens. Future proceeds from the commercialization of her farm are already committed to pay for her children's education. In the long run, she is confident her efforts will translate into her family having a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy poultry.

loans.name: Karine

texts.en: Karine has been involved in clothing sales for six years. She sells from her house. Her husband is a migrant worker in a neighboring country and their only son works and lives in another Armenian town. Karine's retail business helps her pay her bills and save money to improve her family's life. To buy a new stock of spring-summer clothing for her customers, Karine has applied for this loan, which has been approved within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. This program provides business start-up loans to informal businesses that do not qualify through normal channels. She hopes that support from Kiva lenders will allow her to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy new clothing to sell.

loans.name: Mona

texts.en: Mona is a simple girl, who lives with her family in Zarqa. She does not exceed 23 years old. Mona is studying at the university majoring in the French language. Mona chose this major as she believes that there are many job opportunities in this field. Her current goal is to graduate from college and start a new life, but the financial problems that are faced by her family is an obstacle standing in front of her. Therefore, she decided to apply for an education loan to be able to cover her university fees.

loans.use: To be able to cover her university fees.

loans.name: Edda

texts.en:
Edda is 38-year-old, married woman with four children. She lives outside the Honiara city.

She makes and sells sweet cakes and muffins in her community to provide for her family. She has five years’ experience with this business, and that makes her confident in it. With four children, it’s very difficult to pay for their school fees.

Edda needs a loan to pay for her children's school fees and also buy plain flour, oil, sugar, baking powder and yeast for her business.

She plans to use her profit to support her family and also meet her children's schooling expenses. She believes that taking future loans will enable her to reach her goals and dreams. She has been a member of SPBD since 2013.

loans.use: To pay for her children's school fees and improve her bakery business

loans.name: Thoern

texts.en:
Thoern, 31, is married with one dependent son, who is still in school. His family lives in a house with a thatched roof located in Kampong Spue province’s Borseth district.   

The main source of his family’s income is farming rice in his village. He has been running his business for 12 years, earning about KHR 30,000 per day to support his family’s needs.  Thoern received his first loan with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, two cycles ago, and has effectively used it to sustain his family’s business and support his family’s needs. 

He is now asking for a loan to buy more household supplies for his family to use. He hopes to have enough supplies for his family to use.

loans.use: to buy more household supplies for his family to use.

loans.name: Khim

texts.en:
Khim is aged 45 and widowed. She has two dependent children. Living in a village of the Borseth district, Khim farms rice to make a living. Having been in this rice farming for twenty-seven years, she manages to earn about 30,000 KHR per day to feed her children.

This is the sixth loan for Khim with VisionFund. She completely repaid the past loans, which have enabled her to feed her family with enough food.

She is now asking for a loan to buy fertilizers for her farmland. She hopes to make a living better.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her farmland.

loans.name: Claudetta

texts.en:
Claudetta is 55 years old, and married with five children; they live out of the main city.

She runs a business selling canned food and other household item like toothpaste, soap, toiletries in her community. She has two years of experience with this business.Her business really help her to meet other household demands and children school expense.

Claudetta has requested a loan to buy a refrigerator and a gas cylinder for her business so that drinks and other frozen items can be sold in her canteen.

She plan to use her profit to meet her children's school fee and other family needs.

She has been a SPBD member since 2013, and believes that taking future loans will help her to build a good home for her children and provide a better education for them.

loans.use: To buy a refrigerator and a gas cylinder

loans.name: Chentha

texts.en:
Chentha, 32, is married and lives with her family in a village of the Borseth district. She has three children to take care of; one is still too young for school, while the other two are in school already.

To make a living, she has been farming rice and working for others for a fee. The current business earns her family about 30,000 KHR per day.

Chentha has been with VisionFund for two cycles. Now she is applying for a loan to buy a plot of farmland and will use a portion of it to spend on buying household supplies.

She hopes to increase her family’s income from her current business so as to make a living better.

loans.use: to buy a plot of farmland.

loans.name: Rachael

texts.en:
Rachael is a 52-year-old married woman with six children who lives outside of Honiara city.

She runs a small business selling BBQ fish, chicken, potatoes and rice in her community and has been doing this for five years. Her income enables her to meet whatever her family needs.

Rachael has requested a loan to buy a deep freezer and Esky (cooler) to store her fish and chickens for her business. She has been a member of SPBD since 2013.

With her earnings Rachael will provide school expenses for her children, repair her home, and help her daughter to build her home. She believes that accessing a loan will help her pursue her dreams to become a successful businesswoman

loans.use: To buy a deep freezer and Esky (cooler) for her business

loans.name: Rukhsana Bibi

texts.en:
Rukhsana bibi is 42 years old woman, and mother of 3 children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been running a food stall, her husband sells different types of eatable items e.g samosa, vegetable rolls, chicken tikka, Kabab paratha and etc. Her husband is only responsible to feed the entire family and manage house hold.
Rukhsana bibi's husband needs to purchase different types of eatable and other items for his business purpose so that he can increase the size of business, improve his sales growth and earn maximum profit. But due to unfavorable financial position her husband is not in condition to purchase these items for his business purpose.
Therefore Rukhsana bibi has applied for Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. So that she can help her husband to purchase the above items for business purpose. 
She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to to purchase different types of food and other items for her husband's business

loans.name: Jacinta

texts.en:
Jacinta is 49 years old and married with 4 children. She lives in the Honiara City.

She runs and operates a small canteen, selling items like rice, cooking oil, sugar, noodles, biscuits and other food items. She has been doing this for two years. With her profits she provides for her family's needs and children's education.

Jacinta wants to increase her products so she requested a loan to buy additional food items to sell.

She believes that with her profit and a loan will allowed her to improve her business and also provide a better future for her family and to become a successful business woman. She has been a member of SPBD since 2013.

loans.use: To buy food items such as biscuits, rice, flour, noodles, sugar and canned foods

loans.name: Sovann

texts.en:
Sovann is from  Banteay Chmar, a village in the North-West of Cambodia. She is 29 years old. She lives in a wooden house with one floor with her husband, her 4 years old son and her smaller sister, who is studying in high school. Her family owns 6 hectares of rice field and 2,5 hectares of cassava. In 2002 she was trained by Soieries du Mékong,  a social enterprise which fights against rural exodus and for empowerment of women by training them and offering them sustainable work in the village. 
Sovann makes scarves which are sold in Cambodia and Europe. Throughout the years, she gained valuable experience in weaving and helps many other weavers to progress in their work. She uses her weaving income to pay for her family expenses. 
Thanks to the loan,  she will buy the silk and pay for the dyeing and preparation of the loom. 
Please support her so she can keep making beautiful traditional hand woven scarves!

loans.use: To buy silk and pay for loom preparation related fees

loans.name: Linda

texts.en:
Linda is a 25-year-old married mother of two living within the city of Honiara. For the past year Linda has operated a business selling canned food, noodles, cooking oil and other food items in her community. She has managed to pay for her children's school fees and other household needs with her profits.

A member of SPBD since 2013, Linda has requested a loan to buy more food items to increase her canteen stocks and profits. She believes that her profits and accessing future loans will enable her to provide a better education for her children and improve her family's living standards.

loans.use: to pay for more food items for her small canteen

loans.name: Nester

texts.en:
Nester is 23 years old and married with three children. 

She owns and operates a small canteen, selling items such as canned food, rice, noodles, sugar, biscuits and soft drinks and has been doing this for years now. With her profit, she managed to meet some household needs and pay her children's school daily expense.

She needs a loan to buy food items such as white tuna flakes, curry flakes, sandwich tuna, steaks onion, Ox and Palm corned beef and other general goods, to increase her stock to make more profit.

Nester believes that her profit and future loan will enable her to expand her business and provide a better living for her family. She has been a member of SPBD since 2013.

loans.use: To pay for food items such as white tuna flakes, curry flakes, sandwich tuna, steaks onions, Ox and Palm corned beef and other general goods

loans.name: Kong

texts.en:
Kong is from  Banteay Chmar, a village in the North-West of Cambodia. 

She is 51 years old. 

She lives in a wooden pile house with her husband (who is also a weaver) and her 15 years old son. Her 3 other children are already working and/or married. Her family owns 1.5 hectares of cassava field. 

In 2001, she was trained by Soieries du Mékong, a social enterprise which fights against rural exodus and for empowerment of women by training them and offering them sustainable work in the village. 

Kong makes scarves which are sold in Cambodia and Europe. She uses her weaving income to pay for the family expenses, to buy diesel and fertilizer for the field and to extend her lending business.  

Thanks to the loan,  she will buy the silk and pay for the dyeing and preparation of the loom. 
Please support Kong so she can keep making beautiful traditional hand woven scarves!

loans.use: To buy silk in order to weave her loom

loans.name: Ilhama

texts.en:
Ilhama is a 49-year-old woman. She is married and has two sons. Her husband is a labourer and the family lives in an IDP settlement because they are refugees. 

Ilhama is a housewife but earns money for family raising and selling seasonal fruit. She sells it at the local bazaar and her sons help her in this. Ilhama has worked in gardening for 12 years and her monthly income is 140 AZN. Her income doesn't allow her to renew old garden tools. She applied for a 1,200 AZN loan in order to buy new garden tools and take proper care of her garden.

loans.use: to buy new garden tools and take proper care of her garden

loans.name: Samira

texts.en:
Samira is a 35 year old refugee. She is married and has two sons. Her husband is a labourer and the family lives in an IDP settlement. Samira has a garden. There, she raises greens, vegetables and fruit. She raises them and sells to neighbours, earning 147 AZN monthly. This income can hardly cover the family demands.

Samira loves her family very much and wishes a happy life and bright future for her children. Now one of her sons is studying at university in the capital of Azerbaijan. The life in the city is very expensive so Samira applied for a 1,500 AZN loan in order to pay the monthly education fee for her son.

loans.use: to pay the monthly education fees for her son.

loans.name: Parvana

texts.en:
Parvana is a 38-year-old woman from Agdash. She is married and has two sons and three daughters. She is a farmer and keeps livestock. Her husband is a teacher at a local school but his income is very low. Parvana raises and fattens goats and calves and then uses their milk, meat and wool. Her daughters help her to make milk, cheese and yogurt from goat and cow milk. They sell wool and woolen things such as jackets, gloves, warm hats, etc. 

Parvana has worked as a farmer for 20 years and knows many interesting things about farming. Her monthly income is 150 AZN. Parvana applied for a 1,500 AZN loan in order to buy fodder for livestock. She always takes care of her livestock properly and wants to expand her farm.

loans.use: to buy fodder for livestock

loans.name: Melvin Yanira

texts.es: Melvin Yanira vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus tres hijos, posee una tienda ubicada en su lugar de residencia donde vende una variedad de productos a buen precio, tiene 5 años de tener el negocio el cual inicio con capital propio, con las ventas que realiza logra salir adelante, ella está solicitando nuevamente un crédito para la compra de huevos, frijoles, aceite, azúcar, café, sopas, etc. todo por mayor para seguir con sus ventas y así tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: Melvin Yanira lives in her own house with her husband and their three children. She owns a store located in her home, where she sells a variety of products at a good price. She has had this business for five years and she started it with her own capital. She manages to support herself with the sales that she makes. She is requesting another loan in order to buy eggs, beans, oil, sugar, coffee, soups, and other things wholesale so she can continue with her business and thereby have a better income.

loans.use: to buy eggs, beans, oil, sugar, coffee, soups, etc

loans.name: Gerber Antonio

texts.es: Gerber de 62 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y su  hija, el se dedica al cultivo de maíz y maicillo, su esposa le ayuda en el cultivos, tiene mas de 20 años de dedicarse a esa actividad la cual inicio con capital propio, el vende sus productos en los alrededores de la zona donde el reside, con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar,  el esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, pesticidas, etc. y el pago de alquiler de parcela ya que no cuenta con terreno propio y asi podrá seguir con sus siembras y tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: 62-year-old Gerber lives in his own house with his wife and his daughter. He makes a living by growing maize and sorghum. His wife helps him with the crops. He has been doing this work for more than 20 years, and he started it with his own capital. He sells his products in the areas surrounding the place where he lives. He manages to settle some of his household expenses with the profits he obtains from his work. He is requesting a loan in order to buy seeds, fertilisers, compost, pest control measures, pesticides, etc. He will also use it to pay the rent on the parcel of land since he does not have his own piece of land. In this way, he will be able to continue sowing his crops and have greater earnings.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilisers, compost, pest control measures, pesticides, and other things. He will also use it to pay the rent on his parcel of land

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es: Carlos de 56 años de edad vive en casa propia con su hijo, el se dedica desde hace varios años a la siembra de maíz y maicillo adicional a eso también trabaja como jornal en una finca cerca de su casa, tiene 12 años de dedicarse a esa actividad la cual inicio con capital propio, vende sus productos en las agencias de compra-venta de granos básicos, con lo que obtiene de su trabajo logra cubrir algunos gastos de su hogar, Carlos esta solicitando nuevamente  un crédito a INTEGRAL para la compra de mas fertilizantes, semillas, abonos, controles de plagas, herbicidas, etc. y mejorar el terreno que es el que muestra la fotografía para tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Carlos is 56 years old and lives in his own home with his son. For several years he has been growing corn and sorghum, and also works as a day laborer at a farm near his home. He has been engaged in this business for 12 years, which he started with his own capital. He sells his crops to the middlemen who buy and sell staple grains. With what he gets from his work he manages to cover some of his household expenses.

Carlos is again requesting a loan from Integral to buy more fertilizers, seed, manure, pest control agents, herbicides, etc. and to improve the land shown in the photo, so that he can have better income.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers, seed, manure, pest control agents, herbicides, etc. and to improve the land.

loans.name: Dúo Un Amor Verdadero Group

texts.es:
Dúo Un Amor Verdadero
Este dúo lo forma María Angelina ella es originaria del área de san Martin. María Angelina se dedica a la venta de comales de barro es una persona que se esfuerza por seguir adelante y darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y con el apoyo de Fape lo está logrando. Solicita el crédito para comprar más materia prima y surtir aun más su negocio. Sus pagos los ha realizado puntualmente. Y agradece a la fundación la ayuda que le brindan ya que para ella cada crédito es una inversión y una oportunidad.
texts.en:
Dúo Un Amor Verdadero

María Angelina is part of this duo.  She is from the San Martin area.  María Angelina sells clay cookware.  She is a person who puts forth great effort in order to get ahead and give her family a better quality of life.  With Fape’s support she is achieving it.

She is requesting the loan to buy more raw material and stock her business even more.  She has made her payments punctually.  She is grateful for the help the foundation has provided because, to her, each loan is an investment and an opportunity.

loans.use: to buy raw material to make cookware to sell.

loans.name: Javier

texts.es:
El socio Javier pertenece al banco comunal “Patrón de San Sebastián” de la ciudad del Cusco. 
El socio sigue trabajando en  una institución pública, el socio lleva buen tiempo con su trabajo el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su trabajo, el socio se siente agradecido por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas, a la vez el socio continua con su negocio  de pasamanería, el socio es una persona responsable y empeñoso siendo de esta manera que el socio saca adelante a su familia.
El socio solicito el crédito para la compra de cepillos, aguijas, entre otros.
texts.en:
Javier belongs to the “Patrón de San Sebastián” communal bank in the city of Cusco.

He continues to work at a public institution. He has had his job for quite a while and it is going well for him thanks to the effort that he puts into his work every day. He is grateful for the loan granted to him and he is committed to making his repayments on time. He is also continuing with his passementerie business. He is a responsible and persevering person who supports his family with his work.

He requested the loan in order to buy brushes, needles, and other things.

loans.use: to buy brushes, needles, and other things

loans.name: Dúo Monte Carmelo Patzicia Group

texts.es: Dúo Monte Carmelo Patzicia La señora lucia es originaria de la aldea el caman, ellas se dedica a la venta de verduras y al cultivo aprendio el trabajo con sus padres y ahora que ella es mayor de edad se dedico a ese mismo trabajo, ha estado sobresaliendo con su familia y ahora que logro comprar terreno propio ella solicita su crédito para poder comprar lo que necesita para seguir cultivando, ya que solo de esa manera está dando a sus hijos lo que necesitan y su anhelo es dejarle una propiedad a cada uno de sus hijo como herencia y va a seguir trabajando arduamente para poder lograrlo.
texts.en:
This is the Dúo Monte Carmelo Patzicia Group. Señora Lucia comes from the village of El Caman. These ladies grow and sell green vegetables.  She learned this work with her parents, and now that she is grown, she does the same work. 

She has been getting ahead, along with her family, and now that she has been able to purchase her own land, she is requesting a loan to be able to purchase what she needs to continue planting crops, as this is the only way she provides for her children’s needs. 

Her desire is to leave property to each one of her children as an inheritance, and she will continue working hard to fulfill it.

loans.use: to purchase seeds to plant green vegetables.

loans.name: Cecelia

texts.en:
Cecelia, a mother of six boys and a girl, sustains her big family through fishing. She has been in the fishing business with her husband for more several years now. She is asking for a loan to buy fishing nets. 

They have been in this business for 25 years and plan to buy another pumpboat in the future to help secure their children’s future.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy shoes and clothes to sell to her customers

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Evangeline works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and-sell nipa roofing business in the Philippines. She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her business. She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase more stocks of nipa roofing to sell for her business.

Evangeline has been sustaining her business activities through her past 11 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of nipa roofing to sell

loans.name: Gayane

texts.en:
Gayane lives with her big family in Kapan city in Syunik region. She has three sons: the eldest works as a locksmith, the second son is passing his military service in the army, and the smallest is school-aged.

Gayane’s husband works as a crane operator. Gayane is also employed and for many years she has worked at the kindergarten. Being so busy, Ganey’s family is also engaged in farming and agriculture (potato and fruit cultivation). She says that she cannot stop admiring her orchard that she established herself planting her apple, persimmon, pear and mulberry trees, and this harvest, with potatoes from her land, she manages to sell wholesale. With her husband she also breeds rabbits and poultry. The meat of rabbits and poultry she sells to city markets and eggs she sells mainly to her neighbors.

This loan from Kiva is very important for Gayane as she has simultaneously several plans that need financial support, that is to buy potato seedlings, apple and pear tree layers, and also fodder for her chickens.

loans.use: to buy potato seedlings, apple and pear tree layers, and also fodder for her chickens

loans.name: Nolvis

texts.es: Nolvis de 38 años, ofrece el servicio de internet llamadas telefonicas, fotocopiaje  e impresión a sus clientes estudiantes y profesores entre algunos vecinos del sector, que dia a dia se acercan a obtener todo lo que requieren al local de Nolvis. Desde Junio del año 2006, ella emprendió su aventura de negocios, cuando su esposo le propuso hacerlo, y para ello fue comprando a crédito dos computadores con los que inició y luego fue agregando 2 mas, fotocopiadora, impresora, telefonos etc. todo esto con el fin de generar ingresos adicionales a su hogar, aprovechando que habia obtenido esta experiencia desde sus 17 años de edad, cuando administró un negocio de computos frente a una prestigiosa universidd den la ciudad de Barranquilla. Su oferta de servicios la realiza de contado y para ello compra los insumos tambien de contado, y trabaja todos los dias desde las 7 de la mañana ahsta las 9 de la noche con el fin de lograr mas adelante hacer su casa de dos pisos para separar el espacio familiar del espacio empresarial. Su meta a mediano plazo es lograr el acceso de sus hijos a la universidad, ellos hoy cuentan con las edades de 12 y 10 años. Enla actualidad está aplicando aun crediiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual actualizará los computadores con los que cuenta, para incrementar un número de clientes superior al de su competencia, tal cual es su propósito.
texts.en:
Nolvis is 38 years old and provides Internet service, telephone calls, photocopying and printing to her customers: students, teachers and people who live in  the area, who day after day come in to obtain everything they require at Nolvis' shop.

She launched her business venture in June 2006 when her husband suggested she do so, and for this gradually bought two computers on credit, with which she started and then gradually added two more, a photocopier, printer, telephones etc., all this with the aim of generating additional income for her household, taking advantage of the fact that she had acquired this experience from the age of 17, when she ran an internet café across from a prestigious university in the city of Barranquilla. 

She provides her services for cash, and therefore buys her supplies for cash also. She works every day from 7 in the morning until 9 at night, with the aim of succeeding in someday building  the second story of her home, in order to separate the family space from the business space. Her medium-term goal is to succeed in having her children attend university, as today they are 12 and 10 years old.

Currently she is applying for a Kiva loan, her first from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, which she will use to update the computers that she has, in order to attract a greater number of customers than her competition, which is her intention.

loans.use: To update the computers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her business by purchasing poultry

loans.name: Asesewa Group

texts.en: Salomey, a member of Asesawa group, is 39 and a married mother with three children who are between 16 and 6 years old. All of her children go to school. She is standing first from the left in the photograph and earns a living by selling electrical appliances and providing sewing services from her residence. She has been doing this for 10 years to help her husband, who is a electrician. As a mother, she could not sit back and leave all responsibilities to her husband, so she saved some money from her previous trades and began selling electrical parts in town. This has allowed her to meet her family's needs. Salomey dreams of expanding her business and educating her children to higher levels of learning so that they will have a bright future. She lacks enough capital to expand her business, which has led to sluggish growth, and that's why she is requesting this loan to boost her business. Together with Gladys, Grace A. and Grace D., the group needs a total of 1,500 GHS to expand their businesses.

loans.use: to sell electrical appliances and provide sewing services in her home.

loans.name: Abdullah

texts.en: Little by little, Abdullah worked hard over many years to open a furniture store because he believed this could guarantee a good life for his children. He works for the army as well as in his store, but this not enough to cover the cost of necessities. He has applied for a loan of 199,980 YER from AMB to buy new and stylish furniture for his store, expand his business, and increase his profits. Abdullah lives with his family, which consists of eight members, in a small apartment. The profits from this loan will help him rent a large and suitable apartment as well as create a better life for his family and pay for the items his children need. In the future, Abdullah hopes to buy a piece of land and build his own house on it.

loans.use: To buy new and stylish furniture for his store

loans.name: Asha

texts.en: Hello Kiva lenders! Meet Asha, an ever-smiling young farmer from Litein County in Kenya who has defied the common thinking of most Kenyans about agriculture. She is a proud owner of a small parcel of land on which she has been practicing mixed farming for the past five years. Her primary sources of income are selling eggs and milk, and through this venture, she has earned a decent income. She also engages in personal business in order to make ends meet. Asha passionately loves dairy farming, and taking care of her cows gives her great joy. She is an early riser and wakes up every day in the morning to go and milk her cow. Although this humble woman has been making profits by selling milk to her neighbors and the local market, she is faced with the challenge of meeting the demand. She is known for having the best quality milk. Through word of mouth, customers have been flocking to her farm for milk. Asha is seeking a loan to buy a quality dairy cow that will produce milk that is high in nutrients and will be able to satisfy the demand. Through the loan she will buy a dairy cow that will produce between 10 and 20 liters of milk a day. This will help fully satisfy the demand. Through Juhudi Kilimo, which is a field partner, she attended training sessions and was taught the best financial management skills. This will help her save more money to repay the loan fully and to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To buy a quality dairy cow.

loans.name: Saudah

texts.en:
Saudah is married with four children, three of whom go to school. She lives in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and food. 

Saudah has a business selling fruits and vegetables at the market on a retail basis, and has been in this business for 12 years. She sells seven days a week. She has applied for a loan of 600,000 UGX from MCDT-SACCO to buy oranges, onions, cabbages, tomatoes, pineapples, jack fruit, and sweet potatoes. Her major business challenges include seasonality and the perish-ability of fruits. She aspires to growing fruit.

loans.use: to buy oranges, onions, cabbages, tomatoes, pineapples, jack fruit, and sweet potatoes.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with 2 children and both go to school. She also takes care of additional family members. She lives in a rented house and the family has no access to piped water or electricity. Her major monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

Mariam sells green bananas at the market on a retail basis. She has been in this business for the last 2 years. She works six days a week. She has requested a loan of 400,000 UGX from MCDT – SACCO to buy bunches of green bananas. Her major challenges include seasonality and transportation. Her goal and aspiration is to buy a plot of land.

loans.use: to buy bunches of green bananas.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Lucia works hard to support her family. She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming rice, raising pigs and selling veterinary products.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses. Lucia is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase more stocks of household goods to sell for her general store business.

Lucia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 20 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her businesses to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of household goods to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy poultry

loans.name: Felisa

texts.en:
Felisa is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a coconut farming business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 10 years. Felisa earns additional income from raising pigs.

Felisa successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses. She is borrowing PHP 17000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies for her coconut farming business.

Felisa has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Maa Bhairabi Group-B

texts.en:
Rasmilata is a 30-year-old woman living with her husband, son and daughter in a small village of Odisha, India. She has been engaged in the activity of selling bangles at a nearby market for the last two years. She is planning to open a ladies’ cosmetics variety store, and for that, she needs some financial help. She hopes it will be very helpful to earn some more income so she can manage her family's expenses smoothly. 

Rasmilata, along with her group, has requested a loan amount of 36,000 INR, and she will use her portion for purchasing cosmetic items and new designs of bangles, so she can increase her customer base. She wants her son to complete his graduation from a good college and to save some money for her daughter’s marriage.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetic items and new designs of bangles.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy construction materials for the house expansion

loans.name: Sibora

texts.en: Hello, Kiva lenders! Meet Sibora, a 46 year-old, very hardworking, honest and ever smiling mother of 4 children. She lives in the Nandihills area of Kenya - an area that is close to the famous Rift valley of Kenya. Sibora passionately loves farming. She has been farming for the past 24 years and has always managed to provide for her family. Her primary source of income has been crops and some personal business that she does in order to provide food for her family. In farming, she enjoys the returns she gets, but is challenged to maintain a good standard of living. Sibora has identified free space on her farm and wants to fully utilize this space by keeping a good quality dairy cow. Dairy farming in Kenya is a very profitable venture and milk prices in the recent past have been going up, so Sibora, being a visionary and entrepreneurial woman, wants to take full advantage of this. She has chosen the breed of cow that she will keep, and she knows that she will not only get milk from the cow but also manure, and this will boost the fertility of her farm. Selling her milk will never be a problem because there is a ready market and she will also be selling to big dairy processing firms. Sibora said she chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan because they offer agricultural based loans and their interest rate is low and is on a reducing basis. She underwent training through Juhudi Kilimo, and from this training she learned that saving is a continuous process in many microfinance institutions. Sibora hopes that through the accumulated profit she will be able to start adding value to her milk by starting services such as packaging and the production of other dairy products. This loan will change her life and will secure the future of her school-going children. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Sevinjh

texts.en:
Sevinjh Rasim is a 29-year-old married woman. She has a daughter, and her husband is a farmer. He raises crops and supplies them to the local bazaar. Sevinc is a houskeeper. She is a very positive and kind woman. She does her best in order to provide her little daughter a happy childhood. Her husband's earnings are very small and hardly cover the family demands. 

Sevinc loves her daughter very much. She wants to prepare her for school life. She applied for 1,500 AZN loan in order to prepare her daughter for school. Her daughter is little and Sevinc will call the teacher and pay her in order to prepare the girl for the upcoming school year.

loans.use: to hire a teacher to prepare her daughter for the upcoming school year

loans.name: Konul

texts.en:
Konul is a 40-year-old married woman. Her husband is a farmer, and they have a son and a daughter. She is a housekeeper, and her family lives with her parents and brother's family. She has a small garden, and together with her brother and husband, raises seasonal fruits and vegetables. She joined farming 10 years ago and started to help her husband and brother. 

Konul makes different kinds of jam and juice and sells them to local markets and neighbors. Her monthly income is 160 AZN. The family is very big and Konul's monthly income doesn't cover the big family's demands. 

Konul, together with her brother and husband, wants to expand their small business. They bought a small place next to their house, and now they want to use it as a grocery. She applied for 1,000 AZN in order to build a small grocery near their house and sell fresh fruits and vegetables there.

loans.use: to build a grocery near her house and sell fresh fruits and vegetables there

loans.name: Mehman

texts.en:
Mehman is 44 years old. He is married; his wife is a housekeeper; and they have a son and a daughter. They live with Mehman's parents and sister's family. Mehman has a common small business with his sister and her husband. They raise fresh fruits and crops and sell them to local markets and bazaars. The big family is very friendly, and all members of the family support each other with every step. 

Mehman has small place near their house. Now Mehman's sister wants to open a small grocery there and Mehman supports her. Additionally, they decided to make renovations in the house they stay in because it's very old. 

He applied for a 1,000 AZN loan in order to provide the house with a new water system. The whole family does its best in order to provide themselves a happy life in a cozy house.

loans.use: to provide the house with a new water system

loans.name: Abdulhasan

texts.en:
Abdulhasan is 53 years old and married with a son and two daughters. His wife is a housekeeper, and his children are married and live seperately. They help their old parents when they earn money, but the main income Abdulhasan gets is from repairing water systems in his region. He has worked in this area for 15 years, and his monthly income is 190 AZN. 

He is very interested in his job and is always ready to help someone, even at night. He applied for a 600 AZN loan in order to buy himself new and quality coveralls and tools.

loans.use: to buy himself new and quality coveralls and tools for repairing water systems

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 25-year-old single man from Jabalia, Palestine. 

Mohammad has opened a small cafe in the city where he sells hot drinks like coffee and tea at very low prices. It is a good business, and he has his own loyal clients. 

Mohammad has taken a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy more building materials as well as a machine for making coffee for his cafe. This will increase both his sales and income. 

Mohammad appears in the photo above.

loans.use: to buy more building materials as well as a machine for making coffee in his cafe.

loans.name: Firas

texts.en:
Firas is a 24-year-old single man from Dier Al-Balah city. He is a student at a local university. Firas also has a store selling shoes in the city. He earns a good income which covers his education expenses and also his family needs. 

Firas would like to improve his store and expand it in the future. He has taken a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new collection of shoes for his store. By taking this loan, Firas' sales will be increased and so will his income.

loans.use: to buy a new collection of shoes for his store.

loans.name: Dúo Concepción Group

texts.es: El Dúo Concepción está integrado por doña María Luisa quien se dedica a la venta de tortillería hace mas de 5 años en un pequeño local en la zona 1 de ciudad vieja ya que su local lo mantiene abierto todo el día ella está solicitando su 5to crédito kiva para la compra de mercadería y leña (maíz, cal, leña, ollas, bolsas, etc.) ya que actualmente no cuenta con suficiente efectivo porque sufrió un robo en su pequeño local y ella solicita su apoyo para seguir trabajando para que en un futuro ella pueda tener un ahorro para vivir sin pasar necesidad.
texts.en:
The Conception Duo is made up of Doña María Luisa who has made a living selling tortillas for more than five years in a small shop that she keeps open all day in zone one in the old city. She is applying for her fifth Kiva loan to purchase goods and firewood (including corn, lime, wood, pots, bags, etc.)

She currently does have not enough money because her small shop was robbed. She is asking for your support in order to keep working so that in the future she can have enough savings to live decently.

loans.use: to buy corn and firewood for a tortilla shop.

loans.name: Housin

texts.en:
Housin is a 24-year-old single man from Rafah city. He works as an employee in the public sector where he gets a low income. He also works in a grocery store where he sells basic products. It is a good business and provides a good income.

Housin took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy two refrigerators for his grocery store. This will help him to buy more products with lower prices.

loans.use: to buy two refrigerators for his grocery store.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 29-year-old married man from Khanyounis. He is a father of two kids, a son and a daughter. Mohammad has a grocery store which has been opened for the past five years. It is a very good business and the demand is high. 

Mohammad took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy more grocery products for his store to resell. This will increase his sales and also his income. 

Mohammad appears in the photo in his grocery store.

loans.use: to buy more grocery products for his store to resell.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
This is Erlinda. She sends you her thanks for your generosity because her previous loan has entrenched her business. She was able to buy spare parts and accessories for the vehicle. The loan also helped her provide for her daily needs and expenditures.

She is very positive that she could improve her business more if you will let her borrow again an amount of 50,000 PHP. This new loan will go to additional supplies of accessories and spare parts for her tricycle. Simultaneously, she could sustain the needs of her family if the unit is regularly maintained and in good condition.

Erlinda wants to buy another unit of tricycle for her transportation business. She only dreams of a simple yet healthy life for her family. She meets every week with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for spare parts and maintenance of her tricycle unit.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is a 30-year-old married woman and a mother of four children from Leyte, Philippines. She makes a living through a hog raising business. This has been her source of income for more than 10 years now. 

Gemma would like a loan to buy additional piglets to raise and animal feed for them. She believes that this loan will help her improve her hog raising business as well as her income.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets to raise and animal feed for them.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Josephine is 45 years old and has two children who are still in school.

Josephine has a fishing business in the Philippines. Josephine requested a PHP 20,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional fish net and bamboo.

Josephine has been in this business for 13 years. She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchse additional fish net and bamboos

loans.name: Guadalupe

texts.en:
Guadalupe is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Guadalupe is 36 years old and her children are in school.

Guadalupe has a retail coconut wine business in the Philippines. Guadalupe requested a PHP 5,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy containers of coconut wine to sell.

Guadalupe has been in this business for three years. In the future, Guadalupe would like to save enough money to afford sending her children to college.

loans.use: to buy containers of coconut wine to sell

loans.name: Mary Grace

texts.en:
Mary Grace is 20 years old and married. Mary Grace works very hard to provide for the family.

Mary Grace runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 5,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like coffee, canned goods, shampoo, groceries, etc.

Mary Grace has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items such as soft drinks, tuba, coffee, juices, noodles, biscuits, canned goods, condiments and other groceries. 

In the future, Mary Grace would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like coffee, canned goods, shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Sulficia

texts.en:
Sulficia is 53 years old and has two children.  Sulficia is married and has two children who are still in school.

Sulficia is in the agricultural business in the Philippines. Sulficia requested a PHP 7000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Sulficia has been in her business for 20 years, and has borrowed 1 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Cheryl

texts.en:
Cheryl is 21 years old and has one child. Cheryl is married and has one child presently in school.

Cheryl is in the agricultural business in the Philippines. Cheryl requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Cheryl has been in her business for 3 years. She also earn additional income from motorcycle transportation and has borrowed 2 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Cheryl would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Sabitri Group-A

texts.en:
These three women from a small village of Odisha came together and formed Sabitri Group-A in 2014. Namita was selected as the featured borrower of this group. She is 24 years old and lives with her husband and her one child. 

She has been involved in vegetable cultivation for two years, and her husband has been involved in paddy cultivation for five years. As a farmer, her husband has sound knowledge of vegetable cultivation, and he is helping her in this activity. Whatever they earn is not sufficient to manage their family expenses. 

She, along with her group, has requested a loan amount of 36,000 INR to purchase hybrid seed, fertilizer and pesticides and to pay labor charges. It would be helpful to increase their income so they will be inspired and will do more. She says that she wants to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to pay for purchasing hybrid seeds, fertilizers and pesticides for vegetable cultivation

loans.name: Maa Bhairabi Group-C

texts.en:
The responsible Maa Bhairabi Group-C is made up of two members. Both the members of this group are women from the district of Boudh in Odisha, India. One of them is Rodana, who was selected as the featured borrower. Rodana is 50 years old and a widow woman who lives with her two children. She is engaged in the activity of selling goats and cow’s milk in her village and the nearby market. She purchases goat kids and rears them, and when they grow up, she sells them to the butcher. 

She, along with her fellow group member, has requested a loan of 24,000 INR. She will purchase more goat kids and a cow for getting a greater amount of milk to earn more profit. She has a very good relationship with her customers because she completes their orders on time. 

She and Jarata want to give a better standard of life to their family and also want to save some money for their future.

loans.use: to purchase goat kids and a cow.

loans.name: Norlanie

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Norlanie works hard to support her family.

She has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from general store. Norlanie is borrowing PHP 8000 through NWTF to buy vegetables to sell in her stall for her vegetable vending business.

Norlanie has been sustaining her business activities through her past 1 loan from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy vegetables to sell in her stall

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah works hard to support her family. Sarah is widowed and has a fish vending business in the Philippines. With her are her friends and also fish vendors in the market.

Sarah requested a 20,000 Philippines Peso (PHP) loan through NWTF to buy more fish to sell in her fish stall. She can be seen in the picture with other fish vendors in the market.

Sarah has been in this business for 28 years now.

Sarah would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell in her fish stall

loans.name: Sabitri Group-B

texts.en:
Sabitri Group-B is a group consisting of three members, all of whom are women. These entrepreneurs are very humble, hardworking and responsible people with good manners and lots of enthusiasm to improve their lives. A few years back, they were all facing the same poverty, so they planned to start a vegetable business where they can provide fresh, quality vegetables to their customers. 

One of them is Mrs. Dipali, who was selected as their president. Dipali, the lady standing in middle in the photo, is a 25-year-old lady living with her husband and her two children. Her husband works as a farmer. She produces and sells vegetables to her customers and has developed a very good relationship with her customers in the village and nearby market. She likes the fact that she can cater to the needs of the people in her village and the nearby market. She has a plan to make her vegetable business bigger and produce more higher quality vegetables to satisfy her customers. 

She, along with her group, has requested a loan amount of 36,000 INR, from which she will use her portion to purchase high quality seeds and fertilizers.

loans.use: to pay for purchasing high quality seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Nyame Tse Group

texts.en:
These members are part of the group called Nyame Tse and sell phone credit cards, diapers, disposable plates, cups, tissues, second-hand clothing and barbering accessories. They have known each for many years and are still together living in the same neighbourhood.

Shella, who is the group representative, is 35 years and a tenant who lives with her husband and children. She attended school to the secondary level. She is married to a mechanic and they have three dependant children. 

Shella has sold diapers, disposable cups, plates and tissues for the past three years, which she uses to take care of the family financially. She is taking this loan amount of GHS 2,500 together with her colleagues. 

Shella will use her portion to purchase more diapers, disposable cups, plates and tissues to sell to her customers.

They will hold each other responsible for the repayment of the loan.

loans.use: To purchase more diapers, disposable cups, plates and tissues to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Khatuna

texts.en:
Khatuna is a 36-year-old young woman, from the village, Mamati. She has four little children and a husband who is a private worker in the village and gets insignificant income. The family was exiled and gets persecution pension from the local government. 

As the income wasn't enough to even cover the basic needs of this large family, Khatuna started a small agribusiness. She seasonally cultivates nuts and mandarin and generates a small income. To satisfy her children's increased needs, Khatuna is eager to start a trading business that will give her a chance to make a more stable income. 

Several times, Khatuna requested a loan from local financial institutions for her trading business startup, but without any success. Her loan request was rejected each time because the creditors did not find the existing family income to be sufficient to approve the loan. According to LLC Micro Finance Organization Credo's (Credo) estimations, the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

Khatuna requested a loan from Credo to start a trading business. Her loan request was approved in the framework of a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The startup loan program envisages provisions for business startups and re-startup credits, with soft conditions for the country's rural poor who were regarded as "high risk borrowers" because of their low income and lack of access to credit products. 

With the received credit, she will purchase stocks of food products that she will sell with increased prices from her house. 

The family's living conditions will significantly improve and the family will have enough income to access regular credit products available on the country’s capital market, in case of need. Katuna will be very grateful for having a chance to make better living conditions for her four children.

loans.use: to start trading with food products to get a stable source of income.

loans.name: Shamim

texts.en:
Shamim is 42 years old, married and the mother of four children. The family lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been runing a restaurant where he sells different foods such as chicken, tea, daals, etc. Her husband is responsible for feeding the entire family and covering household expenses.
Shamim's husband needs to buy different types of food to offer so that he can increase business, improve sales and earn the maximum in profit. But due to his tight financial position, he is unable to do so.
Therefore, Shamim has applied for a Kiva loan through its field partner BRAC Pakistan. With this she can help her husband buy more food to sell in his place of business. She is very thankful for Kiva and BRAC Pakistan’s assistance.

loans.use: her husband wanted to increase his resturant business

loans.name: Gerlie Jo-Ann

texts.en:
Gerlie Jo-Ann is a 30-year-old high school graduate and lives in Bago City. She is married to Allen, who works as a laborer in a sugarcane plantation. They have 1 child aged 9. Their total monthly family income is only 4,000 PHP ($91).

Girlie Jo-Ann has long seen the need to help her husband build a better life, but didn’t have the means until she learned about the 2-month training program from Bagosphere that could lead to a call center job.

Now that she has passed Bagosphere’s selection process, she needs your help to finance her tuition. Once Girlie Jo-Ann starts earning, she can provide for her family’s basic needs and then save some money for her child's education and have a better, happy and stable family life.

loans.use: to pay for tuition for a 2-month call center training program that can get her a job paying about $270 monthly

loans.name: Divina

texts.en:
Divina buys bread and other popular pastries such as "hopia" (a pastry filled with bean paste) in big volumes and sells it in retail to stores in her community and other nearby place. Her husband, a former bakery driver, helps her with the business. The couple works hard together to support their family's needs specially the education of their children who are aged 15 and 14.  

Divina is requesting a loan amounting to PhP 20,000 to buy an additional 5 boxes of biscuits, breads and pastries to meet the increasing demands of her customers. Part of the amount to be loaned will also be used to buy materials such as paper boxes to repack the baked goods. Divina believes that the loan amount, when granted, could further boost her sales and income. 

In the future, Divina and husband wants to set up a grocery store on top of their bread and pastries buy and sell business.

loans.use: To buy additional boxes of biscuits, breads and pastries and packaging materials for her bread delivery business

loans.name: Najma

texts.en: Najma is a 38-year-old widow woman. She has been doing a business of bangles sales for many years. She buys bangles from the wholesale markets at lower rates and then sells them to the people of her community at a profit. She earns enough to contribute in the family income to bear her household expenditures. Najma  has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR  to buy the latest variety of bangles in different colors and designs to increase her sales to generate a healthier source of income. She has a good repayment history. She wants to expand her business to provide a better standard of living for her family.

loans.use: to buy the latest variety of bangles in different colors and designs to increase her sales to generate a healthier source of income.

loans.name: Shaheen

texts.en:
Shaheen is a 51-year-old active borrower of BRAC Pakistan, residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her spouse and five children. Her husband has been running his own shuttering shop in the local market for 20 years. He is only responsible to fulfill the needs of the entire family.

Shaheen's husband needs to buy different types of shuttering accessories, e.g., steel, keels, and tool accessories. But due to some financial constraints, her husband is not in a suitable position to buy these items for his business purposes. Therefore Shaheen has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan, she will financially assist her husband to buy these shuttering accessories to fulfill his business needs, so that he can earn a more profitable income.

Shaheen is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan for this financial assistance.

loans.use: her husband wanted to increase his shuttering business

loans.name: Sanket Group

texts.en:
Sanket Group was formed in the year 2014 in Baramunda, Bhubaneswar, Khurdha, Odisha, India, by six active, self-dependent village women, with an objective for developing their existing businesses, as well as their livelihood. All the members of the concerned group have their own professions and businesses. Sukanti is one of them who has taken a great role for her development and the group members' livelihood improvement. 

The middle person standing in the row in the photo is Sukanti. She is about 40 years old and is living with her small family, as she has a husband and only one son. 

Sukanti has been engaged with a variety store at her own home in Baramunda village since eight years ago. Through the concerned business she earns a monthly income of 9,000 INR. Her opinion is that the income is not sufficient to maintain her family, with sufficient surplus for a total investment in the business to materialize her dreams. So to get more and more income by expansion of her business, she planned to improve her business in the course of loan. With the loan, she will purchase different varieties of products like bangles, threads, face wash creams, clothes and other items concerning ladies for her store. She hopes to get more and more profit from her business expansion and save money for the construction of a house and to provide a better education to her son.

The other five members of her group are also smart at their professions, like vegetable vending, a saree business, a milk business, a Papad business and a breakfast store. With this loan, they hope to boost their livelihoods after disbursement of the loan.

loans.use: to purchase bangles, threads, face wash creams, clothes and items concerning ladies

loans.name: Jose Adalberto

texts.es: Jose de 49 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus dos hijos, el se dedica al cultivo de maíz y maicillo, su esposa le ayuda en las siembras, el tiene más de 20 años de dedicarse a esa  actividad la cual inicio con sus padres desde muy joven, comercializa sus productos en los pueblos aledaños y con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, el esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de insumos agrícolas como: fertilizantes, semillas, abonos, controles de plagas, herbicidas, etc. y mejorar el terreno y así seguir con su trabajo que le genera buenos ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Jose, 49 years old, lives in his own home with his wife and two children. He makes a living growing corn and sorghum, and his wife helps him with the planting. He has more than 20 years of experience in the business, which started with his parents when he was very young. Jose sells his products in the surrounding towns, and he pays household expenses with the profit he earns.  

He is requesting a loan in order to buy farming supplies such as fertilizers, seeds, pest controls, herbicides, etc. to improve the soil – and thus continue with his work that provides him with a good income.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies such as fertilizers, seeds, pest controls, herbicides, etc. to improve the soil.

loans.name: Mariama

texts.en:
This is 35-year-old Mariama.  She is single and has three children, ages 8 years, 14, and 18. 

In 2012, Mariama established her business selling exercise books, ledgers, pens, and general stationery. She began her business because she wanted to take care of her children properly, more especially to see them through their education. 

Mariama's business is located in the city center, and her main customers are school children and workers. Working 7 days a week and 12 hours a day, she earns about SLL 1,030,000 every month. She would like a loan of SLL 5,000,000. 

Mariama requires a loan in order to buy more exercise books and other stationery items to sell. She hopes that this loan will motivate her to put more effort into her business.

Mariama was able to build a small stall.  As a major improvement in the business, she added other items, such as used clothes and shirts. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to pay for exercise books, ledgers, pens, and general stationery items to sell.

loans.name: Sanaa

texts.en:
Sanaa is a 51-year-old married mother of four children. She is a hard worker and does not tire from work in order to help her husband financially to have a respectable lifestyle. In 2010, Sanaa started to work from her house. She sells homemade foods. She has a good reputation in her hometown by giving the best products to her clients. 

Sanaa is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to improve her business merchandise. She states that she will sell all products and expand her business area and she insists that she will be a permanent Vitas s.a.l. customer so she will always be able to develop her business.

loans.use: to improve her business merchandise.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase two toilets

loans.name: Tunaweza B Group

texts.en:
Ester, who is in her early 30s, is single with two kids who are still at school.  She has been selling chips for three years now.  She works from 10 am to 10 pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.  

This will be Ester's 2nd loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loan to buy sacks of Irish potatoes, cooking oil and a sack of charcoal.  The loan has been successfully paid back.  She used the profit to pay school fees and cover household expenses.  She will use this loan to buy Irish potatoes, cooking oil and charcoal for cooking.  She dreams of making her business big.

Ester will share this loan with her loan group, Tunaweza B, which has three members. They will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to purchase Irish potatoes, cooking oil and charcoal for cooking.

loans.name: Mariama

texts.en:
This is 39-year-old Mariama.  She is married with three children, ages 6, 7, and 16 years old.  

In 2008, Mariama established her frozen fish business. She began her business to assist the family and follow in her mother's footsteps.   Working 6 days a week and 8 hours a day, she earns about 1,200,000 SLL every month. Competition and the rainy season are her biggest challenges.  She would like a 6,000,000 SLL loan to purchase more cartons of frozen fish for resale. 

She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately 1,500,000 SLL. In the future, Mariama  plans to continue with loans until she has sufficient capital. This business has helped her to raise her children.  She is looking forward to funds that will help her in developing her business. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase frozen fish to sell.

loans.name: Krobo Bukom Group

texts.en:
These ladies make up the group called Krobo Bukom, which has an average age of 32 years. They are into second-hand clothing, diapers and sewing accessories. 

Cecilia is 29 years old and sells cosmetics and second-hand clothing door-to-door. She buys the items (cosmetics and ladies' and gents' jeans) from the main market and sells to her customers. She has been a member of this group for three years and needs this loan to expand her business. In five successive loan cycles she has been able to save money and has improved her business tremendously.  She attended school to the elementary level but decided to join her friend and learn how to trade. 

She needs GHS 1,200 to be able to purchase more ladies' and gents' jeans to sell to her customers. Together with her colleague, they need a total of GHS 2,700 to be able to expand their businesses, and they will hold each other responsible for the repayment of the loan.

Cecilia is standing on the right in the photo with a sample of her products in her palms.

loans.use: To purchase more ladies' and gents' jeans to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy corn seeds.

loans.name: Kossiwa

texts.fr: Agée de 31 ans, Kossiwa  est une femme mariée vivant dans le quartier de Kohé avec ses trois enfants à sa charge. Kossiwa est très dynamique et vend des pagnes. Son activité lui procure le bénéfice pour venir en aide à son mari pour les besoins de la famille. Kossiwa s’approvisionne une fois par mois au marché de Lomé. Kossiwa demande ce crédit pour commander des pièces de pagne qu’elle pourra  vendre et gagner encore plus de revenus pour favoriser l’éducation de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Kossiwa is a thirty-one-year-old married woman living in the Kohé neighborhood. She has three dependent children.

Kossiwa is very energetic and sells fabric for clothing. Her business provides her profits with which she can help her husband with the family’s expenses. Kossiwa procures her supplies once a month from the Lome market.

Kossiwa is requesting this loan to order coupons of fabric to resell to earn even more revenues and support her children’s education.

loans.use: to buy thirteen coupons of fabric.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy condiments.

loans.name: Amirtie

texts.en:
Amirtie is 54 years old and lives together with her son. Since the death of her husband, she has been working in the selection department of a banana company.

Her son, now an adult, was recently also appointed as a worker in the same company. Amirtie travels on an old motorcycle at work. Now she needs to replace her motorcycle for a better one and plans also to  travel together with her son to work. For the motorcycle, Amirtie needs  SRD 3,250.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Narine

texts.en:
Narine trades with clothing in Stepanavan town. She is a mother of two children. She started her business three years ago. Her undertaking was successful, and she efficiently implements her trade.

Narine has now applied for this loan to purchase a new stock of clothing to meet customers' orders. 

Her loan has been approved within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. This program provides business start-up loans to informal businesses that do not qualify through normal channels.

loans.use: to pay for new stock of clothing to meet customers' orders

loans.name: Harakati Group

texts.en:
Zainabu, who is in her mid 30's, is married with three children. Two of them are still in school and the other one is still small. She has been selling chips for two years now.  She works from 4 AM to mid-night daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.
