This will Zainabu's second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to increase the Irish potatoes and charcoal and has paid back her loans successfully.  She used the profit to pay school fees and covered house hold expenses.  She will use this loan to buy Irish potatoes, cooking oil and charcoal for cooking. She dreams of having a big business.

Zainabu will share this loan with her loan group, Harakati, which has four members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy Irish potatoes, cooking oil, and charcoal for cooking.

loans.name: Sergio

texts.en:
Sergio is a single man and he doesn't have children. He pays rent and he is a sewer.  His best jobs are when he makes vests for children. 

Sergio needs a loan to buy an overlock machine that will be very helpful for him. Sergio has been in this business for two years but he has a good hand and he is a brave entrepreneur. He would like to have his own workshop in the future because he also pays the rent of the place where he works

loans.use: to buy an overlock machine

loans.name: Chernor Maju

texts.en:
This is 29-year-old Chernor Maju.  He is single, and has no child.   He has one additional dependent who lives with him to be fostered and help in business.  

In 2000, Chernor Maju established his timber (boards) business. He began his business since he dropped  out at the secondary level because of lack of interest in education and joined his mother in doing her clothing business and later changed to the  timber (board) business.  He helped her on commission.  

The money accumulated was used to start up his business. Working six days a week and eleven hours a day, he earns about SLL 2,645,000 every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of SLL 5,000,000. Chernor Maju requires a loan in order to buy assorted sizes of timber (board). 

In the future, Chernor Maju plans to buy land, reinvest, and expand his business.  This loan will help him maximize more profit.  His major challenge is delay in delivering of goods demanded by customers.  He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy assorted sizes of timber (board).

loans.name: Yusifu S.

texts.en:
This is 42-year-old Yusif S., who has two children aged 16 and 4 years; both are school going children. 

Yusif S. established his ready-made items (shirts, jeans, lacoste, crepe, etc.) business. Working six days a week and eleven hours a day, he earns about SLL 3,537,800 every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of SLL 5,000,000. 

He has already received and successfully repaid three loans, and now requires a new loan in order to buy dozens of jeans, shirts, crepe, shoes, Lacoste  shirts, and polos. In the future, Yusif S. plans to rent a shop, reinvest in the business, and start a wholesale business.  

He was not able to complete his building project but has improved his business as previously planned.  He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy dozens of jeans, shirts, crepe, shoes, Lacoste and polo shirts.

loans.name: Tangini Group

texts.en:
Ramla, who is in her early 30's, is single with two children who are still at school.  She has been selling charcoal for two years now.  She works from 6 AM tp 8 PM daily and is able to make a small monthly profit.

This will be Ramla's second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loan to increase the charcoal stock and has paid back her loan successfully.  She used the profit to pay school fees and cover household expenses.  She will use this loan to  buy sacks of charcoal and meet her customer's demand.  She dreams of adding another charcoal store.

Ramla will share this loan with her loan group, Tangini,  which consist of six members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal and meet her customer's demand.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy poultry

loans.name: Samvel

texts.en:
Artak is a proud father of a son and lives with his wife and son in Sisian town. 

For ten years already, using his own truck, Artak has been providing transportation service in Sisian town and the nearby region.  
    
Artak has now applied for this loan to pay for renovation of the truck.

His loan has been approved within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. This program provides business start-up loans to informal businesses that do not qualify through normal channels.

loans.use: to pay for renovation of the truck

loans.name: Tejedoras De Pachitac Group

texts.en:
The Friendship Bridge Trust Bank “TejedorAs de Pachitac” is beginning their second loan cycle after a successful first period in Friendship Bridge. “Tejedoras de Pachitac,” meaning “Weavers of Pachitac,” is made up of eight women from the small community of Panajxit. Panajxit is one of the many rural communities that surrounds the departmental capital of El Quiche, Santa Cruz el Quiche, in the western highlands of Guatemala. Other than small-scale subsistence farming, the people of Panajxit weave artisanal cortes and hupiles (skirts and blouses) to generate income to supplant the small earnings from agricultural pursuits. 
	 
	Cecilia is a thirty-year-old mother of three and the president of the Trust Bank. She has been weaving colorful traditional skirts and blouses since she was 16 years old, almost half her entire life. Currently, Cecilia employs two women who help her weave enough skirts to reach the weekly demand from her clients in Santa Cruz el Quiche. She is reapplying for a loan to buy thread and dyes to maintain her current production of artisan textiles. With this loan she will have the capital necessary to not only meet the demands of her current clients, but possibly expand her business and reach a wider client base. With her 11-year-old and 7-year-old children in school, Cecilia is inspired to build a profitable small business to support their education.

	Thank you, Kiva investors, for providing Cecilia and the remaining seven women with the opportunity and support to invest in their futures through business. We look forward to updating investors with their successes.

loans.use: to buy thread and dyes to maintain her current production of artisanal textiles

location.town: Santa Cruz del Quiche, El Quiche

loans.name: Rosas De Guadalupe Group

texts.en:
Patulul Suchitepequez is an important commercial center located between the coast and the well-known coffee town of San Lucas Toliman. The town is well known as a center of dairy products, because the most prestigious cheese factory, Parma, is located here. 

Juana is a member of the Friendship Bridge Trust Bank “Rosas de Guadalupe” or “Roses of Guadalupe”. She is an enterprising 21 year old single woman who lives with her parents and siblings. Her father is a laborer and her mother sells dairy products. Juana is in her second year of studying medicine and will manifest her dream of working in the medical field. She also has a small convenience store where she sells basic items like oil, eggs, sugar, milk, sausages and soap. Juana opened her store two years ago and the business is growing. She needs to purchase additional inventory including sacks of beans, corns and sugar as well as pasta, eggs, sausages and ham.  She will use her earnings to help her family and to fund her advanced medical studies. Juana is in her second loan cycle with Friendship Bridge.

KIVA investors are valued partners with Friendship Bridge in the efforts to help there women create their own solutions to poverty. They, along with their families, will face a brighter future armed with their new tools! Thank you, KIVA investors, for your kindness and generosity

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory including sacks of beans, corns and sugar as well as pasta, eggs, sausages and ham.

loans.name: La Luna Group

texts.en:
Rural Totonicapán is located in the Southwest region of Guatemala.  The Totonicapán Department has the highest altitude of all the Guatemalan Departments and is quite cold compared to the spring-like weather of most of Guatemala.  It is known for its handicrafts, its many beautiful religious and civic buildings, and for its many ancient religious rituals.  The main language of the Department is Maya-K’iche with many also speaking Spanish.  The people of Totonicapán are known for their beautiful smiles and friendly nature. 

The Friendship Bridge Trust Bank “Luna” is located here.  It has 11 members, many of whom are now in their second and third loan cycles.  One of the members of “Luna” is 21-year-old Francisca, who is married with a three year-old child and is happily expecting a second.  She has a chicken business, and along with her husband who is a bricklayer, hopes their incomes will provide a good future for their children. 

Francisca is asking for another loan in order to increase the number of chickens she raises.  She wants to buy 100 more so that she will have enough chickens to sell during the upcoming Holy Week in April.  Holy Week is a very important holiday in Guatemala with many festivals where people buy chickens.  Sometimes the baby chicks are colored like Easter eggs.  Francisca hopes that with the income from her additional chicken sales, she can also raise other animals such as pigs.

The members of the Trust Bank “Luna” are grateful for the monthly meetings where they have the opportunity to learn from their Trust Bank Officer many important subjects that are useful in their daily lives.

loans.use: To buy 100 more chickens so that she will have enough chickens to sell during the upcoming Holy Week in April.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: buy condiments

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Godfrey

texts.en: Godfrey is a 35-year-old married man with two children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He is a retailer dealing in phone accessories and mattresses. He is faced with the challenge of limited capital that hinders progress in his business. He has asked for a loan to buy cement, sand, and bricks and pay workers for his house construction.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, and bricks and pay workers for his house construction.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: buy bean kernels

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: buy rice and spaghetti

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy grocery goods

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Rafiatou

texts.fr: Agée de 29 ans, Rafiatou est une femme mariée et mère de deux enfants. Rafiatou habite à Sanguéra et vend des fruits dans le quartier. Rafiatou s’approvisionne trois fois dans le mois au marché. Rafiatou souhaite répondre favorablement aux attentes de ses clients qui trouvent satisfaction dans ses prestations. Rafiatou  demande ce crédit pour commander des paniers de banane et des sacs de d’orange afin d’avoir une marge de bénéfice pour couvrir ses charges quotidiennes
texts.en:
29-year-old Rafiatou is a married mother of two children. She lives in Sanguera and sells fruit in her neighborhood.

Rafiatou resupplies three times a month at the market. She wants to respond positively to her customers' expectations, who are satisfied with her products.

Rafiatou is requesting this loan to order baskets of bananas and bags of oranges, so she can have a profit margin sufficient to cover her daily expenditures.

loans.use: buy five baskets of bananas and two bags of oranges

loans.name: Arben

texts.en:
Arben is around 52 years old and has a 16-year-old child who goes to school. His family lives in the city of Korca. He has been feeling sick lately and wants to go to the doctor, yet he hasn't been able to put any money aside even though he’s been working in the city’s administration for a pay of $450/month, so that he can rely on himself. His income is the only one for their family. His wife never found a job even though she searched for one for a very long time. Kindly note that unemployment in Albania has been very high these two past years, due to the fact that the recent government changed the tax process from flat to progressive, and demolished buildings and businesses that had no licenses. All this had a terrible impact on the poor only.
 
Arben would very much appreciate your compassion and financial help as he stated.

loans.use: to visit a doctor about some health concerns that he has been feeling lately

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Agbuidohun

texts.fr: Agbuidohun vit à Adidogomé et est âgée de 38 ans. Elle est une femme veuve et habite avec deux personnes à sa charge. Pour mieux subvenir aux besoins quotidiens qu’elle éprouve, Agbuidohun vend des charbond de bois  afin d’avoir un revenu pouvant subvenir aux charges quotidiennes. Agbuidohun s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché. Agbuidohun demande ce prêt pour commander des sacs de charbons de bois pour alimenter son stock afin de tirer du bénéfice nécessaire pour relever ses défis et étendre son commerce.
texts.en:
Agbuidohun lives in Adidogomé and is 38 years old. She is a widow and lives with two dependents.

To better meet her daily needs, Agbuidohun sells charcoal to generate income that can cover her daily expenditures. Agbuidohun resupplies twice a month at the market.

Agbuidohun is requesting a loan to order bags of charcoal so she can bolster her stock supply, and use the earnings to meet her challenges and expand her business.

loans.use: buy 15 bags of charcoal

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy vegetables and fruits

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy small chicks

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a young cow

loans.name: Hamdi

texts.en:
This is Hamdi, and in the background is pictured his so-called ‘house’. 

Hamdi is a father of two, and he wants to improve his family income now by buying another dairy cow. He has been working in agriculture and livestock for the past 24 years, since the collapse of the previous communist regime. He currently has a dairy cow and also a horse, which he uses as a means of transport. He feeds his animals with fodder and corn that he plants himself. He also plants beans and sells them all. His family income comes only from the beans and the little milk he sells to a nearby dairy farm.
 
Kindly note that his family stands way below the poverty level.

loans.use: to increase his family income by buying another cow

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a young cow

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Tojiniso

texts.ru: Точинисо 49 лет. Она проживает на районе Яван. Она замужем. Ее муж со старшим сыном занимаются животноводством и строительством. Младший сын работает в Российской Федерации разнорабочим. Дочке 15 лет, она учится в средней школе. Точинисо начинающая предпринимательница. Она хочет открыть собственный продуктовый магазин. Чтобы начать бизнес, у нее нет достаточных средств, но есть хороший бизнес план. Для начала она построить магазин у себя дома. В этом ее родные помогут и сейчас ей необходимо купить стройматериалы. После завершения ремонта она приобретет товар и сразу приступит к продаже. Самое главное ей сейчас необходимо купить строй материалы, для этого она обратилась за кредитом.
texts.en: Tojiniso is 49 years old. She lives in the Yavan district. She is married. Her husband and oldest son are involved in animal husbandry and construction. The youngest son works as a handyman in the Russian Federation. Her daughter is 15 years old, and she attends a secondary school. Tojiniso is a new entrepreneur. She wants to open her own food store. While she does not have enough money to start this business, she has a good business plan. For a start, she will build a store at home with the help of her relatives and now she needs to purchase construction materials. After finishing the construction, she will then purchase the merchandise and start the sales right away. The most important thing for her now is to purchase the construction materials, and this is why she requested this loan.

loans.use: to purchase the construction materials in order to build a food store

loans.name: Firuzamo

texts.ru: Фирузамо молодая жительница не большого района под названием Фархор. Ей 34 года. Фирузамо замужем и имеет четверых детей. Она отзывчивая, приветливая и доброжелательная девушка. Ее детям от 14 до 8 лет. У нее трое сыновей и одна дочка. Фирузамо обратилась за кредитом, потому что хочет начать новую деятельность. Она, как и многие сельские жители хочет заняться животноводством. У нее имеется коровник, но нет скотов, и Фирузамо надеется на заемные деньги купить пару голов телят и бычков и начать бизнес.
texts.en: Firuzamo is a young resident of a small district called Farkhor. She is 34 years old. Firuzamo is married and has four children. She is a responsive, friendly and happy young woman. Her children's ages range from 14 to 8 years old. She has three sons and one daughter. Firuzamo requested this loan because she wants to start a new business. She, just like many rural residents, wants to get involved in animal husbandry. She has a cowshed, but no livestock, and Firuzamo relies on the loan to buy a couple of calves and bulls and start her business.

loans.use: to buy a couple of calves and bulls and start her business

loans.name: Odiljon

texts.ru:
Одилчон  мужчина в возрасте 45 лет. Он  женат и имеет двоих детей. Его жену зовут Гулнора.  Она торгует на базаре.  Он очень трудолюбивый мужчина. Любит свою семью и старается для семейного благополучия. Одилчон работает поваром в местном кафе. Профессия повара приносит хороший доход ему. 
Одилчон обратился в Арванд за кредитом. Он хочет оплатить договор обучения своего сына. Он надеется на положительный результат. Он заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержу!
texts.en:
Odiljon is a 45-year-old man. He is married and has two children. His wife's name is Gulnora. She is a seller at a market. Odiljon is a very hardworking man. He loves his family and tries hard for the family's welfare. Odiljon works as a cook at a local cafe. The cook profession yields him a good income.

Odiljon requested a loan from Arvand and wants to pay for his son's education. He hopes for a positive result. He thanks Arvand for the support in advance!

loans.use: to pay for his son's education

loans.name: Sejdin

texts.en: This is Sejdin, a villager and a poor man who wants to buy a dairy cow. He is 48 years old and a married father of two ranging from 16-20 years of age. Sejdin’s family income comes only from the agriculture/livestock that he’s been pursuing for some years now since he returned from Greece where he used to do the same farming work. His only brother died in a terrible accident in Greece and after that, he returned to his village and never went back. Currently, he plants okra and he has two cows and four sheep. He also has some grapevines and plum orchards and sells homemade dairy products, okra and fruit as well.

loans.use: to improve his family's well-being by adding one more dairy cow.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Mujeres De Maria Group

texts.en:
San Lucas Toliman is a town located on the shores of beautiful Lake Atitlan in the Western Highlands of Guatemala. A majority of the people who live there are descendants of the Maya Kachiquel and often only speak that language.

The Friendship Bridge Trust Bank “Mujeres de Maria”, composed of seven women is located here. There are seven ladies in the Trust Bank whose average age is 33 years. The Treasurer of the group is 29-year-old Estercila who is married and has two children. She is very pleased and proud that both of her children attend school in the town. Estercila had the opportunity to attend school until the 8th grade. However, she was not able to complete her studies due to unfortunate circumstances. Currently, Estercila, along with her husband, works hard to improve their standard of living. They want to be certain that their children face a brighter and more prosperous future.  Estercila buys and sells traditional clothing in the center of town. She is requesting a loan that she will use to purchase blouses in different styles, skirts, belts and cloths. This is an especially important time in Guatemala as the Easter holidays are fast approaching and potential customers will want to purchase new clothing. Estercila is hopeful that her loan will be funded by generous KIVA lenders.

Education is very important in the lives of Estercila and her friends in the Trust Bank. Each month, a Friendship Bridge Loan Officer shares practical information with the women in their own language about a variety of subjects that they can apply to their lives immediately. 

KIVA lenders are greatly valued by the “Mujeres de Maria” Trust Bank. They will face a happier and more successful future armed with their education and small loans. Thank you, Kiva lenders!

loans.use: To purchase blouses in different styles, skirts, belts and cloths.

loans.name: Saimir

texts.en:
Saimir wants to start up a little activity that involves a bar café next to his car washing services as seen in the picture. Saimir wants to add chairs and tables and build a washroom in the bar cafe. 

He is 31 years old, lives in a village and works hard as stated by him. “I wake up very early in the morning seven days a week and in addition to the car washing thing, I also plant beans in my family’s own land and then I sell the beans to wholesale buyers. I want to help my parents as well and I do, of course. They are my priorities and I live with them at the moment because they are growing older and have no means of income to cover their medications,’ said Saimir.

loans.use: to add chairs and tables and build a washroom in the bar cafe that he's building next to his car washing services

loans.name: Julita

texts.en:
Julita is a married woman with eight children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Julita is 48 years old and three of her children are in school.

Julita has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Julita requested a PHP 8,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional boxes of fish to sell.

Julita has been in this business for ten years. In the future, Julita would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of fish to sell.

loans.name: Hilda

texts.en:
Hilda is a woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Hilda is 28 years old and one of her children is in school.

Hilda has a buy and sell vegetable business in the Philippines. Hilda requested a PHP 8,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy vegetables to sell in her business.

Hilda has been in this business for two years. In the future, Hilda would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy vegetables to sell in her business.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Alma is 34 years old and both of her children are in school.

Alma has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Alma requested a PHP 6,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fish additional boxes of fish to sell in her stall.

Alma has been in this business for three years. In the future, Alma would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of fish to sell in her stall.

loans.name: Narcisa

texts.en:
Narcisa is 53 years old and a married woman with eight children. Two of her children are in school.  She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Narcisa has a fishing business in the Philippines. Narcisa has requested a PHP 50,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy a new engine for her fishing boat.

Narcisa has been in this business for 13 years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy new engine for her fishing boat.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en: An $800 loan is offered to Alice to improve her business. She has a kiosk where many people come to buy every day. She will buy some additional supplies such as rice, slippers, cigarettes, sugar, salt, milk, coffee, water, body lotion, eggs, soap, shampoo, oils, biscuits and books. She has been involving herself in business activities since 2004. She feels so comfortable running her business because she can earn money every day. Running a business has made Alice independent because she can be responsible for herself and also help her family. She hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: To buy rice, slippers, cigarettes, sugar, salt, milk, coffee, water, body lotion, eggs, soap, shampoo, oils, biscuits and books

loans.name: Arcelie

texts.en:
Arcelie was thankful for the needed capital when she joined PMPC in 2009. She has three school-aged children. 

Arcelie knew that this would be her last opportunity to get back on her feet when went her first business failed.  PMPC came as a rescue to Arcelie for lending her money when she needed it badly. Now that Arcelie heads up the post harvest operations, she has requested another loan for this quarter's cropping. She has requested an amount to pay for threshing, drying, storage and milling. Arcelie perseveres and always believes in reaching her goals to provide for her family. She also hopes to engage in the rice retailing business to earn extra income.

loans.use: to pay for post harvest operations.

location.town: Tangub - Garang, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental

loans.name: Carlos Antonio

texts.es: Carlos vive en casa propia con su compañera de vida y su hijo, el se dedica al cultivo de caña de azúcar y granos básicos, se dedica a esta actividad desde hace 6 años, vende sus productos en los diferentes mercados que están cerca de su casa y ya tiene muchos clientes por los buenos precios, el está solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, control de plagas, herbicidas, etc. para preparar la tierra y si tener buenas cosechas para una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en: Carlos lives in his own house with his life partner and their son. He works growing sugar cane and basic grains. He has worked in this job for the past 6 years. He sells his products in the various markets that are near his house and has many customers due to his good prices. He is asking for a loan to purchase seeds, fertilizer, manure, pesticide, herbicide, etc. to prepare the land and have a good harvest for better economic stability.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizer, manure, pesticide, herbicide, etc.

loans.name: Josue Antonio

texts.es: Josue de 38 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, el se dedica a la producción y venta de leche desde hace 6 años, produce todos los días y la comercializa en los alrededores de la zona donde el reside, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, el está solicitando un crédito para la compra de una vaca con cría para seguir con la crianza y poder tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: Josue, 38 years old, lives in his own house with his family. He has worked in the production and sale of milk for the past 6 years. He does production every day and he sells in the nearby areas of the zone where he lives. With what he earns from his sales, he manages to pay some of the household expenses. He is asking for a loan to purchase a cow with a young calf to continue with raising animals and be able to have better income.

loans.use: to purchase a cow with a young calf.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 22 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y frijol, tiene 4 años de dedicarse a esta actividad, cuando su cosecha ya esta lista la almacena en los graneros que muestra la fotografía y la comercializa en los alrededores de la zona con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, la joven vive en casa propia con su compañero de vida y su hija, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, herbicidas, fertilizantes, etc. y así poder seguir con su trabajo para tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: The young woman, whose face has been pixelated because she is 22 years old and lives in a high-risk zone, works growing corn and beans. She has done this work for 4 years. When her harvest is ready, she stores it in the granary shown in the photograph and sells it in the nearby areas. With what she earns from her sales, she manages to pay some of the household expenses. The young woman lives in her own house with her life partner and their daughter. She is asking for a loan to purchase seeds, fertilizer, manure, pesticide, herbicide, fertilizer, etc. and in this way be able to continue with her work to have better income.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizer, manure, pesticide, herbicide, fertilizer, etc.

loans.name: Mario

texts.es: Mario de 53 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa, el se dedica al cultivo de maíz, tiene varios años de dedicarse a esa actividad, comercializa sus productos en los alrededores de la zona donde el reside y con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, el está solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, control de plagas, herbicidas, etc. para poder recoger buenas cosechas y así tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: Mario, 53 years old, lives in his own house with his wife. He works growing corn and has been doing this work for some years. He sells his products in the nearby areas to the zone where he lives and with the earnings that he gets, he manages to pay some of the household expenses. He is asking for a loan to purchase seeds, fertilizer, manure, pesticide, herbicide, etc. to be able to have a good harvest and, in this way, more income.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizer, manure, pesticide, herbicide, etc.

loans.name: Dúo Bendición De Bárcenas Villa Nueva Group

texts.es:
Bendición de Bárcenas Villa Nueva
Tomas  tiene 61 años de edad, es soltero, tiene dos hijos quienes ya formaron su familia propia,  inicio su negocio hace cinco años, cuando regreso de Estados Unidos, y tomo la decisión de iniciar un negocio tiene una tienda de consumo diario, se siente muy satisfecho por su negocio  y por que gracias a el obtiene los ingresos para su hogar, solicita un crédito para invertir en la tienda y satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Bendición de Bárcenas Villa Nueva
Tomas is 61 years old, single, and has two children who already have their own families. He began his business five years ago when he came back from the United States and decided to start a business of a store with products for daily use. He is very satisfied with his business and so, thanks to the earnings he gets for his home, he asks for a loan to invest in the store and satisfy his customers' needs.

loans.use: to purchase items for daily use (food products).

loans.name: Dúo Kairos Villa Nueva Group

texts.es:
Dúo Kairos Villa Nueva
El cual esta integrado por doña Juana, quien es propietaria de un negocio de telas  en el mercado de ciudad peronia, madre de 6 hijos de los cuales 2 son menores, ella tiene muchos  sueños y muchas metas y quien desea adquirir un nuevo crédito para la compra de telas,  jabones y shampoo por lo que espera se tome en cuenta dicha solicitud. 
El crédito que solicita es para invertir en su negocio para adquirir nuevos productos e incrementar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Dúo Kairos Villa Nueva includes Juana, who is the owner of a fabric business in the market in Peronia. She is the mother of 6 children, of whom 2 are minors. She has many dreams and many goals and wants to get another loan to purchase fabric, soap, and shampoo, so she hopes that she can have this loan.

The loan that she asks for is to invest in her business to get new products and increase her sales.

loans.use: to purchase fabric to sell.

loans.name: Marvin Leonel

texts.es:
Marvin, de 24 años de edad, tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar hasta bachillerato, está acompañado y su pareja está aún estudiante bachillerato y pretende continuar con estudios superiores porque no tienen hijos. 

Marvin, no tiene un negocio propio, luego de dejar de estudiar trabajaba reparando e instalando aires acondicionados, pero hoy se dedica a trabajar de mesero y cocinero en un centro turístico, se dedica a ese trabajo desde hace 2 años y lo aprendió desde hace mucho tiempo en su mismo hogar, ya que en tiempos libres practicaba cocinando los alimentos de su familia.- Su jefe supo que tenia alta vocación de servicio y lo contrato para su negocio; sus horarios de trabajo son de lunes a domingo de 8:00 a.m. a 5:00 p.m. dependiendo de la demanda puede se variable.
 
El lugar de trabajo queda aproximadamente a 20 minutos de su casa, pero por el tipo de negocio algunas veces sale tarde o entra temprano y cuando no hay transporte de buses y tiene que hacerlo en bicicleta para llegar un poco rápido.- El crédito es para comprar una motocicleta, con la adquisición de la motocicleta, tendrá la gran ventaja de transportarse sin problemas, ayudandole a ser más eficiente y productivo para la empresa. 

Los deseos de superación son muy altos, pero las condiciones no se lo permiten por el momento, es por eso que seguirá con la idea de estudiar Gastronomía, que es su mayor sueño.- Además, quiere tener su propia casa, y darle estabilidad a su familia.
texts.en:
Marvin, 24 years old, had the opportunity to finish secondary school. He is partnered and his partner is still a secondary student and plans to continue with her higher education because they don't have children.

Marvin doesn't have his own business. After he stopped going to school, he worked repairing and installing air conditioners, but now he works as a waiter and cook at a tourist location. He has done this work for the past 2 years and he learned it a long time ago in his own home, since in his free time, he cooked food for his family. He boss knew that he had a high service vocation and hired him for his business. His work hours are from Monday to Sunday from 8:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m., depending on demand it can be variable. 

The place he works is about 20 minutes from his house but because of the type of work, he sometimes leaves late or gets there early and when there aren't buses, he has to go by bicycle to get there a little faster. The loan is to purchase a motorcycle. With the acquisition of the motorcycle, he will have the great advantage of getting around without problems, helping him to be more efficient and productive for the business.   

His desires to improve himself are very high, but conditions don't allow it for now. So, he will continue with the the idea of studying gastronomy, which is his greatest dream. In addition, he wants to have his own house and give his family stability.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle.

loans.name: Solidario San Cristóbal Group

texts.es:
Solidario San Cristóbal
Doña María, es casada tiene 47 años  y tiene 3 hijos.  Los cuales dependen de ellos.  su esposo es comerciante y le ayuda con los gastos de su casa.  su negocio es  el corte y confección de cortinas y mas a si mismo ella los vende.  el negocio de doña maría está en su casa.   el préstamo lo solicita porque necesita invertir en  telas , hilos para su negocio.
el sueño de doña maría es hacer más grande su negocio tener su propio lugar de trabajo y expandir sus ventas.
texts.en:
Solidario San Cristóbal
María is married, 47 years old, and has 3 children, who are dependent on her. Her husband is a businessman and helps with the household expenses. Her business is sewing curtains and she sells them, too. María's business is in her house. She asks for the loan because she needs to invest in fabric and thread for her business.

María's dream is to make her business bigger, have her own work space, and expand her sales.

loans.use: to purchase fabric to make curtains, etc.

loans.name: Wilfredo Antonio

texts.es:
Wilfredo, de 28 años de edad, es un joven muy trabajador, estudio hasta bachillerato, está acompañado y su pareja se dedica a los oficios domésticos en su casa y cuidar de su único hijo de 2 años de edad, actualmente no tiene casa propia, es por eso que paga alquiler.

Wilfredo, se dedica a trabaja en una tienda, vendiendo diferentes productos de la canasta básica, ropa y productos de primera necesidad.- Tiene 2 años de trabajar en la tienda, el trabajo lo obtuvo gracias a que la propietaria de la tienda es conocida de su familia, actualmente este trabajo es su principal fuente de ingreso.- Aparte de esta actividad también es albañil, lo hace en sus momentos libres, es otra fuente de ingreso para él y su familia.- Para poder llegar a la tienda, se tarda media hora en bicicleta, entra a las 7:00 de la mañana y sale a las 5:00 de la tarde.

El financiamiento del préstamo lo utilizara para comprar una motocicleta, para poder transportarse a su lugar de trabajo, pues en la bicicleta se tarda mucho tiempo.

Wilfredo, sueña a futuro seguir estudiando y graduarse de una carrera universitaria.- También desea construir su propia casa, también desea en un futuro tener un mejor empleo, que le genero mayores ingresos económicos para él y su familia.
texts.en:
Wilfredo, 28 years old, is a very hard-working young man. He went to school through secondary school, is partnered, and his partner takes care of the household tasks in their house and cares for their only child, 2 years old. Currently he doesn't have his own house, it is for this reason that he pays to rent. 

Wilfredo works in a store, selling different products for the household pantry, clothing, and basic products. He has been working in the store for 2 years, he got the job thanks to the store's owner knowing his family. Currently, this work is his primary source of income. Apart from this work, he also is a bricklayer, which he does in his free time. It is another source of income for him and for his family. To be able to get to the store, it takes half an hour by bicycle. He arrives at 7:00 in the morning and leaves at 5:00 in the afternoon.

The loan will be used to purchase a motorcycle to be able to get himself to work, since the bicycle takes a long time.

Wilfredo dreams of going back to school in the future and graduating with a university degree. He also wants to build his own house, and wants to have a better job in the future, which will generate more income for him and his family.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle.

loans.name: Cesar Enrique

texts.es:
Cesar, de 23 años de edad, estudio hasta quinto grado, decidió abandonar los estudios para ayudar a su padre a trabajar la tierra, desde que era un niño a trabajado muy duro para tener los ingresos necesarios para su familia, está casado y su esposa trabaja en la oficina de una cooperativa, tienen 1 niño de 3 años de edad, quien cuida a su hijo es la madre de Cesar, en su casa vive su esposa, su hijo y la madre de Cesar.

Cesar, trabaja en una finca desde hace 10 años, comenzó cortando café para temporadas y así poco a poco fue trabajando más y más hasta que hoy en día, tiene un trabajo estable.- Aprendió a realizar este trabajo gracias a sus padres, ya que ellos se dedicaban a lo mismo y el aprendió muy bien de ellos, su jornada laboral comienza a las 6:00 a.m. y sale de trabajar a las 2:00 p.m. para llegar a su trabajo, tiene que caminar durante una hora en calles deterioradas por la mañana y por la tarde.

Con el crédito comprará 100 pollos de engorde cada 8 días, para hacer más grande su granja; actualmente tiene 200 pollos y con la compra que hará cada 8 días, tendrá una producción escalonada, también con el crédito comprará concentrado, malla y plásticos, porque necesita mejorar la infraestructura, para asegurar la vida y permanencia de sus animales.

El desea en un futuro, poder ver su sueño hecho realidad de tener una gran granja de aves y obtener ingresos de ellas, así como poder hacer más grande su casa, desea también, que su hijo crezca en un lugar sano lejos de la delincuencia, que sea un joven emprendedor y se pueda superar académicamente.
texts.en:
Cesar, 23 years old, went to school up to the fifth grade. He decided to leave school to help his father work the land. Since he was a boy, he has worked very hard to have the necessary income for his family. He is married and his wife works in the office of a cooperative. They have one boy who is 3 years old. Cesar's mother cares for the boy. In his house, live his wife, their son, and Cesar's mother.

Cesar has worked on a farm for the past 10 years. He began cutting coffee seasonally, and then little by little, began working more and more until now he has a stable job. He learned to do this work thanks to his parents, since they worked at the same job and he learned it very well from them. His work day begins at 6:00 a.m. and he leaves work at 2:00 p.m. To get to his work, he has to walk an hour on deteriorated streets in the morning and in the afternoon.

With the loan, he will purchase 100 chickens for fattening each week, to make his farm bigger. Currently he has 200 chickens and with the purchase that he will make each week, he will have tiered production. Also, with the loan, he will purchase concentrated feed, mesh, and plastics because he needs to improve the infrastructure to assure the lives and continuity of his animals. 

In the future, he wants to be able to see his dream come true of having a large poultry farm and get income from them, to be able to expand his house, and also wants his son to grow up in a healthy place far from crime, that he be an enterprising young man and be able to improve himself academically.

loans.use: to purchase 100 chickens to fatten them every week, concentrated feed, mesh and plastics, to improve the farm infrastructure and assure the lives and continuity of his animals.

loans.name: Janeth

texts.en:
Janeth is a married woman with seven children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Janeth is 42 years old, and has three children who are in school.

Janeth has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 21 years.

She requested a PHP 7,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy an additional stock of fish to sell.

In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy an additional stock of fish

loans.name: Analiza

texts.en:
Analiza is 38 years old and married with four children, who are all in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

Analiza runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more stock of groceries to sell.

Analiza has been in this business for four years and sells a variety of items such as shampoo, snack food, canned goods and other groceries. 

In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stock of groceries

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita is 49 years old and married with four children. With two children in school, she works very hard to provide for them.

Nenita runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell in her general store like beverages, canned goods, eggs, home care products and other groceries.

Nenita has been in this business for three years now. 

In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her general store like beverages, canned goods, eggs, home care products and other groceries

loans.name: Priscilla

texts.en:
Priscilla is 67 years old, married, and has 11 children. 

Priscilla is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

Priscilla has been raising pigs for eight years now, and has borrowed 24 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, she would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Jasmin

texts.en:
Jasmin is 51 years old and has nine children. She is married, and has four children who are in school.

Jasmin is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Jasmin has been raising pigs for three years now, and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Alcides

texts.es:
Alcides tiene 62 años de edad, vive en casa propia de material rústico junto a su esposa en el distrito de Pucará que se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Jaén, región Cajamarca, en la sierra norte de Perú. Los pobladores de este distrito se dedican a la agricultura, comercio y crianza de animales principalmente.

El se dedica a la crianza y comercio de animales menores como gallinas, patos, pavos, entre otros, cuenta con experiencia en este negocio y con buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. El crédito será utilizado para la compra de una mayor cantidad de animales como gallinas y pollos para incrementar el stock de su negocio, con esto Alcides espera ofrecer mayor variedad de animales a sus clientes lo que le permitirá incrementar su nivel de ingresos mejorando su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en: Alcides is 62 years. He lives with his wife in his own house of rustic material in the district of Pucara, located in the province of Jaen, Cajamarca region, in the northern Andes of Peru. The inhabitants of this district work mainly in agriculture, commerce and raising animals. He raises and sells small animals such as hens, ducks, turkeys, among others. He has experience in this business and good personal and work references in the area. He will use the loan to buy a larger amount of animals such as hens and chickens in order to increase the stock of his business. With it, Alcides hopes to offer a larger variety of animals to his customers, which will allow him to increase his level of income and improve his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: to buy a larger quantity of animals such as hens and chickens to increase the stock of his business.

loans.name: Shelane

texts.en:
Shelane is 26 years old with one child who is in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

Shelane runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell in her general store like soap, condiments, home care products and other groceries.

Shelane has been in this business for one year now. 

In the future, she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her general store like soap, condiments, home care products and other groceries

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.en:
Adelaida is 65 years old and married with five children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Adelaida runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock of groceries to sell.

Adelaida has been in this business for four years, and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, biscuits, diapers and other groceries. 

In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of groceries

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is a woman with 13 children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Myrna is 42 years old, and has four children who are in school.

Myrna has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 7,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fish to sell in her food stall.

Myrna has been in this business for three years. 

In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell in her food stall

loans.name: Amparo

texts.en:
Amparo is a 67-year-old widowed woman with eight children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Amparo has a coffee shop business in the Philippines and she has been in this business for eight years.

Amparo requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more stock of coffee, milk, and sugar. In the future, she would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy more stock of coffee, milk, and sugar.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 65 years old and married with seven children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Erlinda runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 20 years.  

Erlinda requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of household goods to sell like soap, coffee, milk, sugar, egg, etc.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of household goods to sell like soap, coffee, milk, sugar, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Divina

texts.en:
Divina is 44 years old, married, and has seven children, two in school. Divina works very hard to provide for them.

Divina runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for three years. 

Divina requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, soap, milk, sugar, etc.

In the future Divina would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, soap, milk, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Rosella

texts.en:
Rosella is 35 years old and is known in Mantic, Tangub for her sari-sari (variety) store. She actively participates in the various programs and services that the co-op offers.

Rosella hopes to live comfortably, with a decent house, so she applied for a loan to purchase plywood, nails, and sticks. She hopes to maintain her membership in good-standing, with a good repayment record. It matters that she has been given a priority, as a microfinance member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC). She is thankful for all her financing needs of her retail business being supported by PMPC.

loans.use: to purchase plywood, nails, and, sticks for her house.

location.town: Tangub-Mantic, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental, Mi

loans.name: Leslie

texts.en:
Leslie is 45 years old and lives in Mohon, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. She is single and has two children now of school age. Leslie has been engaged in a dried fish vending business for two years. At present, she is also receiving support from her live-in partner. She earns approximately PHP 5,000 each month doing this type of activity, and this amount is very helpful in supporting the needs of her children.  

Leslie has requested a loan to be used in purchasing additional stock of dried fish for retail. She has been a member of PMPC for just this year. In the future, Leslie hopes to expand her dried fish vending business.

loans.use: To be used in purchasing additional stock of dried fish

loans.name: Alfonso

texts.es:
Alfonso tiene 51 años de edad, es viudo, vive en casa familiar con sus 02 hijos en el distrito de Cayaltí que se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú. La comunidad esta habitada por gente amable dedicada a la agricultura, ganadería y comercio principalmente.

El se dedica a la crianza y venta de cerdos, cuenta con 05 años de experiencia en este negocio y con clientes fijos quienes brindan muy buenas referencias personales y laborales de el. Adicionalmente se dedica a brindar servicio de transporte en su mototaxi con una experiencia de 01 año. El crédito será para la compra de una mayor cantidad de cerdos así como alimento balanceado para el engorde de estos, con lo cual Alfonso espera incrementar su nivel de ventas lo que mejorará sus ingresos y le permitirá tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Alfonso is 51 years old. He is a widower and lives with his two children in his family home in the district of Cayalti, located in the province of Chiclayo, region of Lambayeque in the northern coast of Peru. The community is inhabited by kind people who work mainly in agriculture, animal husbandry and commerce. He works raising and selling pigs. He has five years of experience in this business and regular customers who give very good personal and work references about him. Besides this business, he offers mototaxi transportation services. He has one year of experience doing it. He will use the loan to buy a larger quantity of pigs, as well as balanced feed to fatten these. With it, Alfonso hopes to increase his level of sales, improve his income and have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more quantity of pigs and also balanced feed to fatten these.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn has a hobby of listening to music, and she loves to sing as well. She came up with an idea to put up a videoke bar. She is enjoying it and she also earns a meager income to support their family needs. 

She busies herself to sufficiently provide for the family. She grabbed the opportunity to become a member of PMPC. She credits the cooperative for her financing needs. 

To generate more income, Marilyn opened a sari-sari (general store) and took a loan from PMPC to buy additional inventory for her store. 

In the future, Marilyn wishes to own "Videoke" units and put them in every store or resort so that she can also help others to earn income for their own families.

loans.use: to buy additional inventory for her store.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha is 43 years old and married with four children, one of whom is in school. She works very hard to provide for her family. 

Editha runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more stock of groceries to sell. She has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items such as rice, feed, spices, and other groceries. In the future, Editha would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita, 51, is a married woman with six children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Nenita has a buy and sell dried fish business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 10 years.

Nenita requested a PHP 13,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fish to dry and sell in her food stall.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her business.

In the future, Nenita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fish to dry and to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Jeanilyn

texts.en:
Jeanilyn works hard to support her family. 

Jeanilyn is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Jeanilyn has been in this business for eight years now.

She requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell.

In the future, Jeanilyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell.

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel, 29, is a woman with two children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Maricel has a buy and sell rice business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for one year.  

Maricel requested a PHP 9,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy sacks of rice to sell.

In the future, Maricel would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Antoninha

texts.en:
Antoninha is taking a loan of $1,500 to improve her business. She runs a kiosk that helps her generate income for her family. She opened her kiosk a year ago with her own working capital of $600.

Antoninha will use the loan to buy stock to keep in her store such as beer, Coca Cola, Sprite, sagiko, a refrigerator, coffee, sugar, salt, oils, and cigarettes. She is a hard-working woman and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: To buy beer, Coca Cola, Sprite, sagiko, a refrigerator, coffee, sugar, salt, oils, and cigarettes

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn is 33 years old and married.

Analyn is in the agricultural business, farming sugarcane in the Philippines. Analyn has been farming sugarcane for 13 years now. She has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF and more recently, from Kiva to sustain it.

Analyn requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to provide and secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Arminda

texts.en:
Arminda has a second-hand retail business where many people come to buy every day. A $1,500 loan is offered to Arminda to improve her business. She will buy some additional supplies such as sheets and blankets.

She has been involving herself in business activities since 2011. She feels comfortable running her business because she can earn money every day.
Running a business has made Arminda independent because she can be responsible for herself and also help her family. 

She hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: To buy sheets and blankets.

loans.name: Kuña Aty Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Kuña aty es un grupo nuevo, está en su ciclo número 1, forman parte del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, que les permitirá poder conocer la situación de vida de todas y poder ir mejorándola.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Idalina quien se encuentra en una pobreza extrema, pero sigue trabajando para poder crecer cada día e ir mejorando. Ella se dedica a vender frutas frescas, lo hace de forma ambulante, donde ofrece a sus clientes todo tipo de frutas frescas de estación.  Su meta es poder seguir trabajando, para poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida e ir aumentando sus ingresos.
Idalina pide este préstamo para poder comprar frutas como ser: manzanas, peras, piñas, y otros, de manera a poder seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder seguir con su trabajo.
texts.en:
The Kuña aty is a new group, and this is it's first loan cycle. They are part of the poverty-elimination program, which enables them to know the life circumstances of all the members, and to be able to go about gradually improving them.

One of the members is Señora Idalina who is in extreme poverty, but she continues working to be able to grow everyday and gradually improve. She makes a living selling fresh fruit. She does this work as a traveling street vendor, and she offers her customers all types of seasonal fresh fruit. Her goal is to be able to continue working, improve her living conditions, and continue to increase her income. 

Idaline is requesting this loan to be able to buy fruit such as apples, pears, pineapples, and other fruit in order to be able to continue selling in the way she has been up until now. She expresses thanks for the opportunity that she is receiving to be able to continue with her work.

loans.use: to buy apples, pears, pineapples, and other fruit.

loans.name: Laura

texts.es:
La  Srta. Laura tiene 22 años de edad es  soltera y vive en la ciudad de Carapeguá, ella al cumplir su mayoría de edad empezó a trabajar como empleada en un negocio, pasado dos años juntó un poco de capital para poder empezar su propio negocio que es la venta de ropas en general y así poder generar más ganancia ya que su sueldo como empleada era muy poco, actualmente ya tiene clientela formada.
Solicita el préstamo para la compra de calzados deportivos, remeras, jeans, entre otros ya que en esta temporada lo solicitan mucho sus clientes.
texts.en:
Laura is 22 years old, single, and lives in the city of Carapeguá. When she came of age, she began working as an employee at a business. After two years, she gathered together a little capital so she could start her own business, which is the sale of clothes. This way she could make better profits, as her pay as an employee was very low. She has now accumulated clients. 

She is requesting this loan to buy sport shoes, t-shirts, jeans, and other items, as in this season these items are often requested by her clients.

loans.use: to buy sport shoes, t-shirts, jeans, and other items

loans.name: Rosie

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Rosie works hard to support her family. She has a fishing business in the Philippines.

Rosie is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy fishing gear and other equipment for her fishing business. She has been sustaining her business activities through her past 21 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. Rosie hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Ma. Jonah

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Ma. Jonah works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from pig fattening. 

Ma. Jonah is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to buy fishing nets and other equipment for her fishing business.

Ma. Jonah has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and other equipment.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa is 39 years old and married. She has three children, two of whom are in school. Teresa works very hard to provide for them.

Teresa runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for four years now.
 
Teresa requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy item to sell in her general store like home care products and other groceries.

In the future, Teresa would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy item to sell in her general store like home care products and other groceries.

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann is a 40-year-old married woman with eight children, four of whom are in school. Mary Ann is a very hard-working entrepreneur. She has a business buying and selling rice in the Philippines. Mary Ann has been in this business for one year.

Mary Ann requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy sacks of rice to sell. In the future, she would like to save enough money that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
Melanie is a 24-year-old woman with four children, one of whom is in school. Melanie is a very hard-working entrepreneur. She has a business buying and selling ready-to-wear clothing in the Philippines. She has been in this business for two years.

Melanie requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to buy clothes to sell in her stall. In the future, she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell in her stall

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase vegetables, fruits, canned and baked foods, and other grocery items.

loans.name: Antonina

texts.en:
Lucia is 20 years old and she is married. She has a kiosk to generate income for her family. She has been thinking about how to run a big business, but she does not have enough working capital. 

Lucia feels better since she applied for her first loan and now she is applying for her second loan of $1500. She will buy some additional supplies to keep in her store such as cigarettes, Fanta, Coca-Cola, Sprite, water, soap, sugar, salt, biscuits, eggs, fish, and candles. She is happy with Tuba Rai Metin, which offers loan to poor people.

loans.use: To buy cigarettes, Fanta, Coca-Cola, Sprite, water, soap, sugar, salt, biscuits, eggs, fish, and candles.

loans.name: Sor

texts.en:
Sor is a 54-year-old woman from a remote area of Siem Reap Province. She is a mother of six children, three of whom are single and three of whom are married. To make a living, Sor raises chickens to sell. On average, she is able to earn US $1.00 per day. So far, she has been in this type of business for five years.
 
Sor would like to improve her living standards by having clean energy for household use. Because of her lack of capital, she is asking for a loan to build a biogas digester, under the National Biogas Program in partnership with HKL. After an initial investment in this system, she hopes that she won’t spend much money on fuel and will lessen the smoke produced from burning wood or charcoal. She is very happy and thankful, because with this kind of loan HKL offers a better interest rate than with its general loans. Sor awaits your kindness and relies on your generosity.

loans.use: to build a biogas digester

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in her car washing business, purchasing a pressure pump and soaps for washing cars.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is 56 years old and married with five children, one of whom is in school.

Maria earns a living by farming citrus plants in the Philippines. Maria is borrowing PHP 28,000 through NWTF to purchase additional varieties of citrus plants, fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Maria has been farming citrus for 30 years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, which is to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional varieties of citrus plants, fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is 55 years old and married with five children.

Helen works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more stock of groceries to sell.

Helen has borrowed and repaid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

Helen aspires to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Edgar

texts.en: To make a living, Edgar operates a water refilling business, which provides water services in his community. He earns well from this to pay for the needs of his family. His wife works as a teacher in their village, and the couple shares all the expenses for the improvement of the family. However, Edgar wants to buy more gallons for his water refilling business to cater to more customers. He borrowed money from Gata Daku Multi-purpose Cooperative. Edgar wants to expand his business in the near future so that he can save money from the business.

loans.use: to buy more gallons for water refilling.

loans.name: Elsa Melina

texts.es:
Elsa tiene 32 años de edad, es soltera, vive en casa familiar con sus dos hijos en una zona rural del distrito de Cayalti que se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú. Los pobladores de este distrito se dedican a la agricutlura, comercio y crianza de animales.

Ella se dedica a la venta de salchipapas, su negocio se encuentra ubicado al frente de su domicilio. Realiza esta actividad desde hace 03 años y cuenta con buenas referencias personales y laborales en su distrito. El préstamo lo utilizará para realizar reparaciones en su carrito sandwichero donde vende sus alimentos, ya que actualmente se encuentra en mal estado, con esto Elsa espera ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus clientes lo que tendrá un impacto positivo en su nivel de ventas y le permitirá mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Elsa, age 32, is single.  She lives in the family house with her two children.  They live in Cayalti, a rural district in the Chiclayo province, in the Lambayeque region, on the northern coast of Peru.  The inhabitants of this district work in agriculture and commerce and raising animals.

She sells ‘salchipapas’ [hot dogs with French fries].  Her business is located in front of her house.  She has been engaged in this business activity for three years.  She has good personal and work references in her district.

She will use the loan to make repairs to her sandwich cart from which she sells her food.  It is currently in bad condition.  With this Elsa hopes to offer better service to her customers.  This will have a positive impact on her level of sales, and it will allow her to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to make repairs to her sandwich cart.

loans.name: Nelia

texts.en:
Nelia is 51 years old, married and works hard to help her husband by generating additional income for the family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs. Nelia is borrowing 10,000 PHP through NWTF to  purchase ingredients like beans, fruit, sugar, milk, etc. for her food vending business. Nelia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 7 loans from NWTF. 

She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients like beans, fruit, sugar, milk, etc.

loans.name: Voeun's Group

texts.en: Voeun is 47 years old and the married father of three children. The family lives in a rural district of Preah Vihear province. Voeun supports the family by farming rice. He also works for a labor fee in cassava fields to make additional income. Concerned about his family's hygiene, Voeun led a group of three members to apply for loans from VisionFund. Voeun will use his loan portion to build a proper latrine for his family, as will the others.

loans.use: To build a latrine

loans.name: San Blas Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado San Blas  está en su ciclo número 12º del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde gracias al trabajo unido de todas y las capacitaciones han ido mejorando.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Hilda, quien en su última encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel tres, lo que quiere decir que ha mejorado mucho gracias a las capacitaciones y verificaciones que ha hecho la fundación. Es una mujer muy trabajadora que quiere dar a sus seres queridos todo lo que ellos necesitan. Ella se dedica a la docencia, y también hace confecciones de todo tipo.
La Sra. Hilda Solicita de este préstamo para la compra de insumos, como ser telas, hilos, botones y otros, de manera a poder seguir con su trabajo como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en: The group named San Blas is in its 12th cycle of the women's committee, where all of them work and help each other get ahead. They are doing the survey for poverty elimination, where thanks to their joint efforts and their training,  they have been improving themselves. One of the members is Mrs. Hilda who, in her last survey, showed a level of poverty within level three, which means that she has improved significantly thanks to her training and  the validation done by the foundation. She is a very hard working woman who wants to give her loved ones what they need. She is a teacher, and also does all types of tailoring. Mrs. Hilda is asking for a loan to buy inputs such as fabrics, threads, buttons, and others, to be able to continue with the work she is currently doing.

loans.use: To buy fabrics, threads, vuttons and other items for tailoring.

loans.name: Melati Putih Group

texts.en:
The Melati Putih Group has received seven loans from MUK and has paid back well. Kadek, head of the group, manages her loans wisely. Any repayment of the loan can be done on time under her  supervision. Kadek sold her piglets for a satisfactory price after keeping them for 2 months. 

Kadek is very grateful for the benefits she earned and she thanked lenders for their support. For electricity and water, Kadek spends 200,000 IDR per month.

The Melati Putih Group has received their new loan. The group expected to get a larger loan, but after they had an evaluation by MUK staff, the group received the same loan amount.

Kadek already has 2 sows and she will use her portion of the loan to purchase super quality feed. She must protect the health of her sows. Kadek is a piglet-seller in her village and also a farmer. She uses the pig’s manure as a fertilizer in her garden. One sow can give birth to 8 – 12 piglets. She hopes the sows can give birth safely and the piglets can grow healthy. She will sell the piglets for fattening or pig barbeque. She has a plan to save all the profit and use it for business capital later.

One of the members could not attend the meeting as a member of her family died.

loans.use: to purchase super quality feed.

loans.name: Lan

texts.en:
Lan is a 40-year-old woman from a remote area of Siem Reap Province. She is a mother of three single children. 

Lan is a chef for wedding parties and earns, on average, USD $2.00 per day. So far, she has been in this career for ten years. 

Lan would like to improve her living standard by having clean energy for household use. Because of the lack of capital, she is asking for a loan to build a biogas digester, under the project of NBP (National Biogas Program) in partnership with HKL. 

After an initial investment in this system, Lan hopes that she won’t spend much money on fuel and lessen the smoke from wood or charcoal burning. 

Lan is very happy and thankful, because with this kind of loan product, HKL has offered a special interest rate. She awaits your kindness and relies on your generosity.

loans.use: to build a biogas digester

loans.name: Retche

texts.en:
Retche has managed a general store for over five years and she earns a good amount to support her husband’s income. She has sustained the business and was able to successfully repay her previous loan used for the business. 

Planning to offer more goods, she took a new loan recently to purchase additional grocery goods and grains to sell.  

In the future, she wants to improve her house from the income of her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery goods and grains to sell.

loans.name: Wilmer Franklin

texts.es:
Wilmer tiene 41 años de edad, vive en casa propia de material rústico con su cónyuge y sus cuatro menores hijos en el distrito de Pomahuaca que se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Jaén, región Cajamarca, en la sierra norte de Perú. Los pobladores de este distrito se dedican a la agricultura, comercio y crianza de animales principalmente.

La actividad a la que se dedica el cliente es la agricultura, específicamente al cultivo de café, cuenta con una experiencia en el rubro de 10 años y con buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. El préstamo que se le otorgará lo utilizará en labores agrícolas, aplicaciones e incorporaciones de productos fito sanitarios, fertilizantes, y mano de obra para su cosecha. De esta manera lo ayudara a la mejora tanto fisiológica, morfológica y productiva de su cultivo, así como también tener una cosecha oportuna y por ende tendrá mayor producción, una mejor calidad de producto, por lo cual no tendrá problemas en vender su producto lo que le generará mayores ingresos y le permitirá mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Wilmer, age 41, lives in his own house, which is made of basic materials.  He lives with his wife and their four minor children in the Pomahuaca district.  It is located in the Jaén province, Cajamarca region, in the northern highlands of Peru.  The inhabitants of this district primarily work in agriculture and commerce and raising animals.

Wilmer is a farmer, and he grows coffee.  He has ten years of experience in the field, and he has good personal and work references in the area.

The loan that will be granted to Wilmer will be used in his agricultural work to add and apply pesticides, to purchase fertilizers, and to pay for labor for the harvest.  This will help him improve the physiology, morphology, and productivity of his crops. It will also allow him to have a timely harvest, greater production, and a higher quality product.  Therefore, he will sell his product without any trouble. This will generate a higher income that will allow him and his family to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to add and apply pesticides, to purchase fertilizers, and to pay for labor for the harvest.

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.en:
Beatriz is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

Beatriz is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to purchase more stock of groceries to sell in her general store business.

Beatriz successfully repaid her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

NWTF is re-listing Beatriz's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Marifee

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Marifee works hard to support her family.

She has a business buying and selling rice in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling charcoal.  Marifee is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy different varieties of rice to sell in her rice business.

Marifee has been sustaining her business activities through her past 5 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy different varieties of rice to sell.

loans.name: Donna May

texts.en:
Donna May is 35 years old and married with two children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, milk, sugar, egg, milk, coffee, etc.

Donna May has borrowed and paid back 19 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 5 years and also earns an income from pre-paid mobile load.

She aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, milk, sugar, egg, milk, coffee.

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a clothing sales business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to purchase more stocks of clothing to resell.

Aida successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

NWTF is re-listing Aida's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of clothing to resell.

loans.name: Suo's Group

texts.en:
Suo’s group live in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Suo makes a living cultivating rice to support her family.
